reviews.review: You've never seen THIS Spartacus!. Went to see the Spartacus Ballet! First of all, this Opera House is a must see!! Talk about over the top! It is the most beautiful opera house I have seen. Make sure you don't miss this lovely venue!

A must see for music lovers...enjoy classical musicians c in a classical setting. We were lucky enough to go to two concerts here. Check it out online and book on jegymaster. There is very little aircon so warm! Our first seats were towards the front on the ground level. Great view, aucoustic very good. The second concert we were in a box. Beware when booking, it is not clear on the website what they are and what the view is. They look like row on a higher level but they are in a box. Go for the front row because the seats in the second row are on the same level. They are small seats and it is 8 seats per box, 4 front, 4 behind. The aucoustic was excellent and we were lucky enough to get front row tickets.Dress up, all the locals do. There is a lovely bar/ snack area for the break. It is reasonably priced.

Lovely evening at "Spartacus" at Budapest opera. We always try to do something cultural when we travel, so went to the Opera House to see if anything was available. A wonderful surprise--it was a ballet. The opera house is beautiful, small and intimate. Bar service during breaks. Seats on the floor are great. The boxes down close on either side appeared that people had to lean out to see parts of the performance on either far side of the stage. Great experience; recommend giving it a try.
Beautiful building. I didnt actually go inside, just admired the lovely architecture outside. Nice area with lots of great restaurants
Impressive building. It is worth booking the mini-concert at the end of the tour when one of the singers sings a couple of well-known arias. Very informative tour guides.
Beautiful opera. A must see when visiting the city. Beautiful opera and I recommend the guided tour. It ends with a 5mns opera!

An Opulant Opera House. Situated in the centre of Andrassy Ut, or outside the Opera station, the Opera House is one of Budapest's national treasures. Once inside the Opera House, visitors have the opportunity to either take part in the tours of this beautiful setting; to watch a short operatic performance or you can buy tickets to one of the ballet or opera performances showing at night. Even if you cannot watch one of the shows, I would recommend taking the tour in order to experience for yourself the grand staircases and the numerous chandeliers that spring from the ceilings. You must visit this magnificent building and gape in awe at the wonderful artistic architecture.

impressive building. Nice night at the opera, it is a impressive building from bothoutside and inside. e tickets available and for good seats we paid 60 euro for a Saturday ballet.when in Budapest not a bad idea, and if you like the opera or ballet a must.
Beautiful building. Don't just go and look inside the lobby. Take a tour, which isn't too expensive, to get the full flavor of this lovely building.

Majestic and stunning building. This opera house has a magnificent and beautiful architecture both from the outside and the inside. It is a replica of the Vienna Opera House but on a smaller scale. It has splendid decorations in gold finish. There are several guided tours in different languages of around 50 minutes. We enjoyed every minute of this tour with full explanations of this magnificent building. While on our tour we were surprised to listen to one of the sopranos singing with his majestic and loud voice. We recommend a visit to this Opera House and if you have a chance attend to one of the operas being held on a daily basis.

Beautiful building.. Timings of tours are based on the language of preference. Beautiful but very crowded until you get into your group... once separated well organized. They offer a mini- opera for an extra charge. I would skip that. They do not seat you, you are listening to a beautiful voice but many can't see the person singing due to the crowd.

Arrive early!. The entry to the Opera House is gorgeous. I planned to take one of the scheduled tours. Unfortunately I got quite lost on the way and didn't arrive as early as I wanted. So after an hour (GPS map issues) of waking in the rain I couldn't get a ticket. They had sold out. I tried to reserve a spot for one of the next days tours and they wouldn't sell them ahead of time. I decided not to make the trip to that part of town again without a guaranteed spot on the tour. I love seeing old Opera houses, it's one of my go to sights in any European city, and I am disappointed to miss out on this one.

Beautiful building. Great decorations to watch and some history to hear during a short 45 min tour with a guide. There are a lot of visitors divided into multiple language groups, but they have alternative paths. I just didn't get the way how the English group was split into subgroups. I think it's a bit too expensive anyway. You can take extra mini concert, but it's only two songs on the staircase - good option if you love opera or never heard it live, otherwise save your money or just go for a regular play.

impressive opera. go with a guide to learn everything about this wonderful opera house. We were incredibly lucky to have a mini performance by a tenor and soprano who sang some of the La Traviata arias for us. A statue of Franz Listz is outside near the entrance

Book early. Enormously popular venue that sells out quickly, so if you want to watch a show book early. I had emailed the box office to enquire about a performance but never got a reply, which was disappointing.Last weekend's offerings were Billy Elliot in Hungarian, or La Traviata, which we'd just seen in Vienna. Thus we opted for the guided tour. These are held at 3 & 4pm and take just under an hour. The building is beautiful, a national treasure. On our way round we met a group of primary aged children who seemed to be on an introduction to opera event. The man in charge of the group who was very close-by suddenly started singing, and I have never heard such a rich and powerful sound coming from one individual. I can only imagine the impression it made on the children- truly memorable.The guided tour finished with a soprano singing two well known arias quite beautifully. Again, you are only a few metres away from the performer, and eventhough it's only two songs, it's still a real treat.The State Opera is a splendid venue and we will enjoy a performance on our next visit.

great informative tour. I must admit i wasnt convinced i was going to enjoy being led around an opera house but it was enjoyable and informative.The guide spoke great english and managed to bring both hour and facts to the tour.
A beautiful building. This opera house was financed by the Austrian king. He was so disturbed when he saw it because it surpassed his opera house in Vienna that he never returned!
State Opera House. This was within walking distance to our hotel and I highly recommend visiting and seeing a show here, inside is beautiful and its not to be missed!
Where the opulent gold meets the good taste of art. A beautiful building combining good taste with sheer opulence. Ranked in the word's top 10 for its acoustics.

nice building. beatifull building on beatifull street.Nice , old scene and chairs. It is a pity that Eliot by Sir Elton John was singing in hungarian language instead og English , but anyhow it was good to see it.

Like a dream. Red velvet curtains, sweeping wooden staircases, gilt chandeliers, golden balconies - this is a dream of a building. We saw "The Nutcracker" two weeks before Christmas and it was pure magic.

A Morning at the Opera. We were privileged to have the opportunity to participate in a tour of the Opera House. The history of the building was fascinating. The acoustics were amazing. We even had a singer present a couple of arias for our entertainment. Absolutely wonderful!! Would definitely recommend a visit to the opera house.
Exceptional experience. The Opera is very well preserved. There was a guided tour in English and we even paid to attenda live mini-concert!! Beautiful experience
beautiful. although it is not as big as the opera house in viena, it is not less fancy. the tour is a must in order to see the inside. tours are at 14, 15 and 16.
Beautiful theatre. What a beautiful experience I had watching The Nutcracker at Christmas time. The theatre is beautiful, and even though I was sat near the back - I could see perfectly well.
Great night out. Watched La Travita at the opera house. Opera house is beautiful inside and acoustics are good. Great night out
Day Tour. We did a tour of the opera house. A very informative tour and a truly beautiful building. We completed our tour with the short performance - that was also really worth the extra cost!

Beautiful theater. We were able to get in with our tour group so luckily we didn't have to pay separately and didn't have to wait but a few minutes.
Tour guide was very nice and seemed to enjoy giving the tours which made it more enjoyable.
Theater is beautiful and is certainly worth a visit if you like historical architecture.

Magnificent Opera House. This glorious opera house rivals the Vienna Opera House in its use of interior decoration. The opera I attended was well sung with an excellent orchestra. The chairs in the box seats were a bit uncomfortable, and the lack of air conditioning at the end of June (the end of their season) didn't help. The opera was staged in a very modern mode - even with an English translation (and this was an opera being sung in English) - it was a bit hard to follow the plot (being so different from what I had expected). The ticket prices were quite inexpensive compared to other major opera houses, and I was pleased to see an audience of a wide age range. Opera in Hungary is youthful and (at least in this production) daring.
fabulous. This gorgeous opera house is stunning. There are tours in several languages offered at 3 and 4 o'clock. Be sure to add the "mini opera concert" to your ticket price.

Beautiful, must see!. Excellent guided 45 minute tour which provides a great overview of the building and its history. English tour available at 2:00pm, although some sites only indicate the 3:00 and 4:00pm ones. Arrived 15 min prior to start and were able to join the tour.
Great show . Went to watch Billy Elliot. Great show. Nice place to enjoy it In. Tickets were very reasonably priced. Would definitely go back.

Amazing place but rather a short visit. The guide was very informative and we saw the main areas. It was a shame not to be able to see any of the stage but understandable. We paid for the "miniconcert" which was certainly mini - 5 minutes! The whole visit was over in 45 minutes.
Impressive!. Impressive interior i do not know which i liked more the Opera house itself or the performance we went. By the way very easy to buy your tickets over the internet, very good!

Beautiful building. beautiful
there are guided tours inside
nice to see a show if you like opera, otherwise just go there to take pics and mayb take the guided tour
Fabulous building worth the visit. its very opulent building and would have loved to see a show at this venue. The guided tour was also nice and the 5 minute opera at the end of it was a nice touch.

Expectations failed. . We watched "Traviata" on the 15th of October, Saturday evening. I bought the tickets, the last ones, 1 month before the venue. So, the hall was full. The theatre is decorated like an usual opera theatre of those times. A lot of gold, mixture of classicism and baroque. What's the main, key ingredient of any good opera house? Yes, it's the acoustics... I expected to experience again those emotions, that shiver, those goosebumps that I had with the first accords of an ouverture to Verdi's "Aida" in LaScala. There was a hurricane wind from an orchestra and singers playing, the music and the word were in each cell of my body. As for the Hungarian opera house, the first what I felt was lacking the air. It was stuffy. When the music started I realized that it sounded so muffled, unfortunately. It didn't flow, it stayed somewhere around a scene. Voices of singers were squeezed out... Our places were in a box. So, I don't complain because of bad location. How it could be the 3rd best theatre in terms of acoustics in the whole Europe I don't know... Nevertheless it was nice to visit this place and to touch the history.
Absolutely amazing. A visit inside this building and you will discover the most amazing paintings and gold lined architectural features. It is simply stunning
Go to see the architecture . Go to see the grandeur of this building. Step inside the reception hall to look at the ceilings. Awesome architecture! Well worth a look!

Beautiful Venue and Wonderful Ballet. No better way to enjoy this building than to see a performance in it. We enjoyed the ballet Sparticus. Something very different than we have seen before. Actually, a great performance for non-ballet lovers as the story itself captivates. The orchestra was spendid. Take advantage of this venue and of its offerings when in Budapest.

The ruddest staff. We don't expect hungarian staff to smile or be welcoming, however, this was the worst experience we have had in any European theatres or operas we visited. The staff was extremely rude. They have a rule that you have to leave your coats before entering, which costs 200 ft and is not optional. We left our coats as requested, even though I never leave my coat in operas and theatres nornally. My bf had a small backpack with laptop and camera in it. They didn't let us in with it without explaining the reason. They had no indication of the size of bags alowed or not, they simply rudely told us they wouldn't let us in without leaving all the valuables. When asked about the reason, the only explanation we were given was: "this is opera". Which means any of the operas, including Royal opera house in London or Vienese opera house without such strange occurances are not operas. And this was done with such contempt that we never wish to return there.
Nice n grand opera house . It's a magnificent structure at heros square at Budapest. Offers all government sponsored n others opera and relevant shows. Nice place to stroll in evening.
beautiful. beautiful building. Recomend a guiding tuar which is hold in many defferent languages and ends up with a mini performance.

Great tour. Taking the English tour of the Opera House we had a great time.The tour guide was absolutely hilarious and her personality boosted an already interesting visit.The venue was incredibly beautiful with a great history, plus a short performance on the main staircase was a nice touch.

World class. There was a world-class soprano in a wonderful building. Edita Gruberova's concert was fantastic experience in this 132 years old Operahouse. It is still possible to visit the opera this season, but the house will be closed next summer for renovation until 2018.
Magnificent. What can you say, great architecture, well preserved, great facility for a cultured people who have fallen on bad times. May the music continue for the benefit of all Hungarians

Beautiful architecture. We saw an opera there. Beautiful architecture and beautiful performance. W we also took a tour in the opera house, which added a lot more background knowledge to the building. Both are recommended.

Gorgeous!. We went there after a couple of recommendations.Just make sure you know the hours of the tours. We went there without knowing the time of the tours and there was no english tour at that time so we had to come back at the tour time. (You can't enter the opera house and walk around by yourself,you mist be with a group with a guide). It was worth coming back and taking the english tour, the guide was really kind and explained everything! Her English is very good too. Don't miss it- check the time of the tours (there are other languages too) and go :)

Beautiful!. I had a great tour of the interior of this elegant opera house. Quite something to behold. I went to the Vienna opera house later in my tour and it was not nearly as impressive. The gilded interior is awesome. They were holding mini concerts...a soloist singing 2-3 arias in the upstairs stairwell. I was tingling as I listened to the incredible acoustics.

Hungarian state opera house Budapest. Guided tour with APT ,brilliant structure,internal details ,presentation and work done is absolutely wonderful. They were setting up for opera on the following weekend.
Outstanding opera house.. Royal class. BEAUTIFUL! It is a must see. Excellent tour guide. Absolute wow factor. 😊 just spectacular.

Nice opera house in Europe. The Opera House building was a stunning one and should be one of the best structure in Budapest. During our visit there, we did not fit in with the daily tours (3pm & 4 pm) and so we just hurried to take a few pictures from outside. Recommend others to check the time and see the internal parts including performance viewing.

Unexpected tour . We decided to go for this tour unexpected. It turned out to be very good and informative. My only complaint is that you have to pay extra to take pictures (we didn't pay) plus pay extra for a mini concert (which we paid) well you can take pictures even if you don't pay. Also you you can watch the mini concert even if you don't pay. No one checks you out.

Wow! I enjoyed La Traviata even though I did not think I liked the opera.. We purchased the inexpensive seats on the third level for just 600 Ft or about $2.20. The price was right. We had seen two productions at the Vienna Opera House and wanted to compare the venues. The Hungarian State Opera House is smaller than the Vienna Opera House. I could not compare productions because they were different types of productions. I can say we left both of the Vienna productions at intermission. I am not an opera officionado. So I cannot critique the opera. I can say I enjoyed it. We expected to leave at intermission but stayed for the whole production because we liked it so much. It was a little disappointing that our tickets precluded us from entering via the main hall. We were told to go to a side door and go up three flights of stairs. There was no way to come down through the main hall either. This was a minor disappointment. All in all a mighty fine evening.

Something is tremendously right about a country that lays wreaths on statues of composers. I love the Budapest opera. It is a stunning buildings. The stories about the building starting with the army being called in to impose order on the Opera patrons on the opening night as pushing to be the first in verged on a riot that alarmed Emperor Franz Josef and Sisi. What a great place!

Awesome Tour. I wish I would've been able to fit in an actual performance on my trip, but since I wasn't, I was so happy that the tour was so god. My guide was enthusiastic and fun stories; she did a really good job of making little facts interesting, and was considerate in letting people take their time to enjoy the space and take pictures. It's such a beautiful building. Definitely a must see in Budapest!

impressive. There are two tours (3pm and 4pm).takes about 45 minutes. The building is very beautiful And impressive. Note that the tour doesn't take you on stage or backstage. They only show you the main hall and the royal balcony. Would like to be taken in stage too. Worth a visit though.

Take the tour---gorgeous. Oh my goodness, what a gorgeous building! You must take the tour to see all the really beautiful parts, but it is very worth it. The exterior is nice but really only so-so compared to the inside, which is amazing. A must!

Go to the performance, not for the tour. +The performances are excellent+The building is beautifulo There is a tour for tourists in the afternoon.- You do not visit any other place, but the same places that you could access with a regular ticket, no backstage or any unusual aspect

Pleasant interior tour. We enjoyed the opportunity to have a tour round this lovely building. It lasted about 45mins and provide a good insight into the history of the building. We followed this with a mini opera - just 2 arias, but long enough if you are not a real opera buff
Beautiful . Saw an out door event outside the Opera house of the opera La Traviata. This is an impressive building to see on the outside and even more on the inside. A must see. So much history.

Beautiful but rushed.. Beautiful Opera House - really stunning -- but there were more than 5 tours going on at once in different languages, so it was difficult to hear the information, no time to ask questions, and sometimes it wasn't even possible to get photos. It really felt like a cash-grab, "Get as many people in and out as quickly as possible."

Cultural taster. Took the one hour tour of the spectacular Opera House that included two beautifully sung arias from a soprano. The build is just amazing - a smaller version of La Scala - and we had a knowledgeable and humourous guide who answered all questions.
Verdi´s Traviata. the Hungarian State Opera House is beautiful old-style building and Verdi has been my favorite through long years - great event
Wonderful. Simply amazing! One of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest! Worth visiting either if you would like to make tour inside or for a performance
Amazing building. A truly stunning building, one of Budapests finest. Lovely marble steps outside. It's a great photo opportunity.
royal box with statues of the 4 voice ranges. 50 min tour with short amusing recital at end. informative open to questions interesting facts about relationship with Austrian opera house

Worth a visit. Loved this. You get to visit various parts of the building - all beautiful. Sample performance a nice final touch. Although I understand it may be cheaper to attend a full performance the tour is a great option.

Stunning. The building entrance can take your breath away. The acoustics and ambiance were beyond description. We were surprised by the size of the venue, as we thought it would be larger. The seats are wooden and padding not very comfortable. Intermission was a good time to stretch. Refreshment service was organized and efficient. The lead singer was amazing, thoroughly enjoyed production's twist of presenting. Worth seeing a show here as it is very reasonable in price.

Worth a visit. There are tours every day at 3 and 4 pm that include a 'mini concert' which is 2 arias sung on the staircase - the tour and mini concert are well worth doing - a lovely building and beautiful singing!

Truly awesome. What an experience. To be able to go up the beautiful marble steps and get into one of the special boxes and experience what it would be like to hear an opera sitting there! Very privilaged to gave been there and then treated to a bit of ooera singing also!@

An awe inspiring theatre. As part of our River Cruise with APT we visited this opera house. It is imposing and very ornate and reflects the affluence and opulence of the 19th century period under the Emperor Franz Josef of Austria.The decorations including the chandeliers and ceilings were beautifully decorated and have stood the test of time. The Royal Entrance is also magnificent as is the interior an the Royal Boxes.On our tour of this establishment we were regaled by an impromptu performance by a one of the Budapest Opera's tenors who sang from one of the ornate balconies.
Ornate. This is a very ornate building, a neo-Renaissance opera house which is really well preserved. The decor is worth the visit if you are interested in this style of architecture
Quick look inside revealed it wasn't as nice as Vienna. I quickly stepped inside and could see that the building, although very nice, isn't as spectacular the the opera houses in Paris or Vienna.

What a stunning building.. It seems to me that the Hungarians are very proud of their architecture and this building does not disappoint. We started off by sitting at the cafe attached to the opera house and the further in we went the more impressed we were..

Beautiful architecture. The building is beautiful but you require fee to view it from inside. I would suggest booking a guided tour which lasts for 45 minutes and includes a 5 minute mini opera performance to get a true taste of the architecture. The English shows are limited so I would recommend booking and planning in advance if you are short on time. A must to see while in Budapest.

Over priced tour. The 40 minute tour is a nice way to see this historical charmer but 11 Euros is a bit steep- don't pay the 2 Euros to take pictures- everyone takes pictures and the staff doesn't stop those that don't pay the fee. The tour visits a couple of VIP rooms, the Kings VIP box, and the main theater itself... Check for coupons in the hop on hop off booklet and other tourist publications... 2pm tour in English only - 3pm, 4pm and 5pm tours have several groups based on language- the English group at 3pm had almost 100 people- so the groups can be large..

Beautiful Opera House. Very enjoyable guided tour. Our guide spoke excellent English & was very knowledgeable. A special treat was to be entertained by two of the opera singers. Would love to have seen a show but the opera house was not open for the season yet.

Beyond Beautiful So much Gold and Sparkle !. If you only have time for one tour this is it so much history and pay the extra for the opera singer she gave me goosebumps I was just in awe of her voice ...its an amazing building ...
Beautiful building. We did the tour without the opera singing. Our guide was very informative and spoke very good English.The building inside is beautiful. I would say well worth a visit.
Wonderful. Very beautiful building. The guided tour is not very long, only 40 minutes but the guides are very interesting. You should also buy tickets to see à show at night, ballet or opera.

Simply Spectacular!. Budapest Opera House is a must see attraction. We had a private tour around the building, with full explanation on every detail, story and plenty of time to admire and look closely on paintings and architecture. We also had time to take pictures out in the main balcony. The tour also includes a mini concerto. I consider this as one of the most memorable attractions during our stay in Budapest.
What a treat. Some weekends the Opera offers free concerts in front of the building. Check their website for a schedule. We enjoyed a Donizetti opera and afterwards toured the inside. What a treat.

Another beautiful building. We also enjoyed our tour of this building, but if we had been able to attend a concert, I wouldn't have bothered with the tour. It's not that informative, but a good way to see the inside of this beautiful opera house.

Interesting tour and spectacular building. My husband and I took a 3 pm English tour of the Opera House. It was informative and interesting, The opera season had just closed when we arrived in Budapest, so this was a great way to see the lavish marble and gold-leaf decor.
Opera House visit. Enjoyed a great tour of the Opera House. Tour given by a college student working part time. She was very knowledgable and spoke excellent English

Budapest Opera House tour - known for its acoustics. The tour was excellent, but the optional "mini concert" that followed was not worth the price. One soprano sang two arias in a side room--most disappointing after hearing about the awesome acoustics of the main opera hall.

Beautiful a must do in Budapest. I was tossing doing the tour but did so because of TA reviews. I was not disappointed. The tour is cheap and is about an hour. We got to go to all levels of the stands and to many rooms while learning about the history of the theatre. This place is beautiful definitely get the tour, I didnt plan well enough and couldn't actually see a performance.
Tour. Must go on the tour of the opera house to get the history and get the feel of this majestic building
With a Touch of Opera. This was a wonderful stop on our Budapest tour. The highlight was standing on the grand staircase and listening to an opera singer perform a few songs for our group.

interesting visit. Worth doing and not too expensive, the guide does share some interesting facts and the building is impressive in respect of decor. We opted for the add on of the mini concert, the singer was very good, but I hadn't expected to be told to sit on the stairs. Not quite a classy operatic experience.

Fantastic architecture. To see an opera in Budapest is an experience worth its price! The building is an amazing structure. The ambiance is classic. The seats are original. We sat at the top which I believe you must at least once to see the whole setting! You get a real feel of the place from the balcony! Intermission can be enjoyed with a coffee or wine and dessert. It is great value for the price!
lovely. Do not miss this venue, when you visit Budapest. Lovely spot, and during the festive season is just magical here!

Gorgeous!!. We did a tour with mini concert - while the tour was crowded and noisy, it did give you history and you got to see the opulent space. We did the tour with mini concert and that was one of the highlights of everything we saw in Budapest in two weeks there. Highly recommend it

Tour of Opera House. If you enjoy music, the Budapest opera house is one of the most beautiful I have seen. The history was fascinating and gave you insight into Budapest's love for music. Since it was part of my tour package I cannot provide details about ticketing, etc. but I suggest exploring the webiste and possibly attending an opera while in Budapest (caution no subtitles in English.) I was fortunate to be in Budapest for an annual festival (Sept 17 and 18) when the operas were shown on the screen outside of the opera house for all to see. What a wonderful treat. Enjoy!
Beautiful building.. The décor inside and outside is wonderful. Take your camera. We were lucky enough to visit when an open air mini production was going on at side of building. FAB.

Touring the Hungary Opera House.... Beautiful, gorgeous piece of architecture. Its very impressive. The red color of the Auditorium is breath taking. You have to go and see it for yourself. I can not describe what I have seen there yesterday. Very important, buy a tour which includes a mini performance in you language. Real Humans as guides, no hand held devices with earphones. Overall is a must see point of interest/rhings to do. Go and enjoy. Learn about Hungarian Culture. Enjoy the mini performance...

Stunning opera house. We arrived to find an opera rehearsal on a stage outside the opera house which was an unexpected pleasure. The tour was very interesting but spoiled by the large number of different language groups which made it difficult to hear our English speaking guide. We paid extra for a mini concert which, while excellent, lasted for 5 minutes and was performed on the staircase not in the auditorium. Left feeling slightly disappointed.

Opportunity missed.. We attended a guided tour and mini concert at The Opera House today. There is a real opportunity here for huge improvement! The tour group was way too big. It was hard to hear at times and it was hard to see. The mini concert was held in the stairwell. The Opera House is an amazing venue and is worth seeing but the current way of doing the tours left us feeling dissapointed. My suggestions...1. Limit the size of the groups. 2. Run tours all day so that there isn't a whole lot of people being rushed around at the same time. 3. Charge a little more so you can care for all your visitors with more care and attention. 4. Hold a proper concert in the main part of the Opera House every day. It doesn't have to be long but I would have loved to have sat in the seats in the Opera House and listened to the very talented singer perform. It was disrespectful to her and us to be in the stairwell. The young people running the tours did their absolute best but they too deserve better. Time for a new approach!

One of the nicer buildings of the city. Is a nice classic building, it has plenty of caffes and restaurants around so is worth the trip.There are tours to visit the insides, also in english, but we were late so missed the last.
Great to see at night!. Visited the Opera House both during the day and at night - once lit up the building looks incredible. You can often hear some singing coming from inside too which is good.

So worth getting a tour! . We got student tickets to do a tour of the opera house and a mini concert. It was very reasonable for all the information you get. Both lasted around 1 hour in total. It was really really interesting - Our tour guide was lovely and gave loads of information. The concert was very entertaining.
Historical. Took a tour of the Opera House which entailed a very short recital at the end - well worth it. Also the cafe attached does great strudel!

Wonderful.... We couldn't experience a performance but we could go into the foyer which is wonderfully decorated and we heard rehearsals for a concert which sounded superb. How I would have liked to have seen a production had there been something on when we were there.

Free opera. The day I was there, there was free opera in the fore court which was amazing! Just great to see the performers giving it their all with a small orchestra performing as well. Not sure if this is a regular thing but I loved it and Im not a big opera fan. I didnt do the tour but had a look inside and wished that I had the time for the tour. Just beautiful!!
Impressive building. Great Building, Impressive decorations, and mural decoration. One of the best Opera Houses that i have ever visited
a great palace. The best is the statues outside the building. Is a great place to remind you of the austro hungarian empire.

A Piece of History. A great place to get a glimpse of Hungarian history. Our APT tour included a champagne while listening to a short performance in the grand stairway - while admiring the beautiful ceilings and furnishings.

Not worth the time or $. We took a tour and found it very boring and there really was not that much to see inside. To take photos, they would charge 500 forint extra, not that much money but kind of strange.
Beautiful, beautiful opera house. Well worth it. Excellent tour of the opera house. Go for the extra ticket that includes an opera song. Lots of fun.

Expensive tour. While the Hungarian State Opera House is quite beautiful inside the 2,900 Ft charged for a 45 minute tour is excessive, considering the size of the tour group and the limited number of places visited within the building. The best aspect was to sit in the auditorium and observe a set being constructed and to also be able to visit the emperor's suite.

Lovely Opera House. We did a tour of the famous Opera House, It was very interesting, very beautiful inside,many boxes all around, highly decorated with lots of,gold,,leaf. It was closed for the summer recess when we were there. La Traviata was to open middle of September. Often visited by royalty, with the queens special box on the side., We paid a bit extra and a soprano sang 2 songs for the audience. Worth a visit..
Beautiful. Lovely building and very centrally located. It is part of the Hop On Hop Off Tour Buses. very good architecture.
Like a Museum. One of the many gorgeous buildings in Budapest. Definitely go inside. On Saturday afternoons there are short performances at a reasonable cost. I believe the first was at 2:00pm.

Tour is a little expensive - better to just buy a ticket. I took the opera house tour on whim when I passed by the building. It is fairly heavily advertised from the outside, however it is a little pricey for what you get. The group on my tour was quite large, and our guide was so quiet I could barely hear what she was saying. For the cost I would recommend just going to see a performance as the most interesting part of the opera house is the main seating area.

Opera house gets high marks, the tour not so much. Our tour guide was from NYC and he was a fast talker. Even after being asked to slow down he continued without pausing for breaths and I could tell the older guests were getting frustrated. We did get to see the grand staircase (weekends only) and learned some interesting facts about the patrons and the building of the opera house. The mini concert was a highlight and not to be missed!
Inside is better than outside. It is worth to spend sometime visiting inside the Opera. It recalls Vienna's Opera. Watch for the program in advance to have better prices and seats.
Tour and Mini Concert. Great value for money. A fabulous tour of the Opera House and a couple of Arias on the stairs. Buy the photo band or you cant take pictures

Really lovely.. We took a tour of this opulent opera house. Included in the tour were historical tidbits: the Royal box, the bar where couples hid from chaperones, etc.The architecture/ decor is so opulent that you really have to see it. "Grand" is too simple a word.We were also treated to an "impromptu" concert: two soloists singing well-known arias, in full costume. Lots of fun.

Gorgeous. Great tour available in many languages. Extremely informative history of the building of the opera house and of the links to Vienna and the Hapsburg empire. Well worth the extra few euros to listen to one of the opera company sing a couple of arias at the end of the tour.

Magical building. We did a tour of the Opera House which was amazing, didn't go backstage as Billy Elliot was showing but went saw the rest of the building. Paid the extra few dollars to see 2 singers perform 3 songs after the tour. Wonderful experience.
Opera House. Mediocre at best. Lasted 30 minutes. Done history. Not worth the money unless you also see the shirt opera afterward. We did not bc of a time issue.
Really beautiful. We really enjoyed the tour of the opera house and was delighted and surprised to watch two brief opera singing which was arranged by our river cruise at the end of the tour.

Beautiful Building. We enjoyed looking at the wonderful artistic details inside the opera house. The ceilings are covered with paintings and the whole building is very well maintained. They have tours every day at 2, 3 and 4pm. We walked on our own and enjoyed it without the tour or an opera performance.
Pretty. Wasn't able to plan ahead and book an actual opera but it would have been nice. Its a beautiful building.
Beautiful! Take the tour.. I was very interested in seeing this opera house, and it did not disappoint me. While smaller than Vienna's opera house, it is much more lavish.

Try to get a ticket to a real performance!. Hungary subsidizes the arts, so performance tickets can be scooped up for a fraction of what they cost in other countries. If you can't manage that, do the tour.

Like any other . You can't actually visit all the time only restricted guided visits in the afternoon It is a beautiful building but if you have seen other opera house from the same time nothing too much To Wow you
Leisure. A guided tour of this attraction for a small fee is recommended to gain the historical knowledge about it. Will definitely try to catch an opera here on our next visit!

A must visit when in Budapest. Small group tours in English with an option brief opera performance for a minimal additional fee. This is an opportunity to visit the royal opera box and see where the protection detail sat.

Well worth the time and little cost.. While not this is not a La Scala, a visit to this opera house is definitely worth the time and little cost.Easily accessible by metro.We went without advance tickets and bought them there with no wait. Tour group reasonable size, with guide speaking the language of the group. Guide knowledgeable and entertaining.Would recommend you purchase the additional ticket to see the short performance following the tour.

Another of the must see buildings, and a performance if you can. A Neo-Renaissance building built in 1884, so many great performances have been seen here and the work of many famous composers. Today it can rival any Opera House in Europe. it was built when money was no object and as such a lavish interior completes the façade design and workmanship that went into building it.

While this opera is beautiful but not worth the entrance fee.. This opera house is more beautiful than the rival Vienna Opera, but the tour was not very interesting or informative and the tour price was a bit high.

Fascinating Building. There are so many little details in this building that you could easily spend a couple of hours looking around at it. The Sphinx on one corner jarred a bit, but otherwise it was a beautiful Hungarian building. Unfortunately, time prevented us going on a tour inside, but the sounds of preparations for the autumn concerts suggests the season is going to be superb.

Well worth the tour. This is an amazing architectural gem and the guides are good and manage to hold huge numbers of tourists of differing languages in the time slots available and make it interesting and informative.
Opera House tour. Beautiful bulding well-worth seeing. Tours available in many languages; lasts about 45 minutes. Worth paying a bit extra for the mini-concert at the end of the tour

Worth booking a visit if you can't get a show ticket. Very flash. Very red and gold. Good guides and well organised. I'd take my own cushion if I was planning on seeing a performance. The chairs were horrendously uncomfortable in the stalls!
Budapest visit.. The building is very impressive and we had a good guide taking us through the building. We also saw an impromptu performance as well.
Great Vantage Point. The history of this bridge is interesting. Many of the Hungarian people use it and at nigh they sit or stand on it to watch the river boats pass.

much ado about little. Not really worthwhile- this is not one of the great opera houses of Europe, nor a second division one. not worth the money. And the cleaners who insisted on starting to vacuum the place when the tour started basically gave us all the finger.

One of the best tours in Budapest. The building is spectacular - from the lobby to the private box that was reserved for the Emperor and Empress. The guide was very knowledgeable and very friendly. The icing on the cake was that our particular tour (2 PM on a Monday) had a special short concert just for us on the stairs of the Opera House. The singer was magnificent (better than one we heard in Vienna!).Check the Opera House web site to find out when the Opera House tour with the singers are held -- you will love it and its a wonderful way to end the tour of the incredible building.

Beautiful building and ceiling. We did not go totally in as you must sign up for a tour but the outside and lobby ceiling are beautiful. We had a delicious snack and drink at Opera cafe outside. This is right off the 105 bus stop and Opera metro/subway.

Expensive for what it is.. Although the Opera House is lovely, we found that, like other places in Budapest, they took advantage of the tourists. We paid for a tour but had to pay 500 Huf extra to take photos (even though no-one checked) and we chose to watch a 5 minute performance afterwards. Obviously, we paid the extra here so that we could get an impression of what it's like to watch an actual show. I didn't expect lighting or an orchestra or anything like that, but did expect it to be in the actual theatre, not on the stairs as it was!Our guide was lovely but we almost didn't get to tour as even though we arrived 5 mins before our slot, they said it was full and we'd have to get our money back. I was furious and made such a fuss that they squeezed us in, but about 10 others didn't.
History. Very good guided tour with a short concert afterwards.Guide was excellent giving many interesting facts. Eveb if you are not interested in opera the building is worth seeing.
Beautiful Building. It is a beautiful building. We did not get a chance to go inside the building. It is very close to the Opera Metro Station or about 5 mins walk from Deak Ferenc Metro station.
Great from the outside. Billy Elliot is on at the moment ( august 2016 ) at the Opera House. The facade of the Opera House is very nice and gives a good idea of the grandeur of Budapest

the operetta is the best bit. very good guided tour of the place although there is not a lot to it . Loads of history you wouldn't realise and the operetta at the end was just stunning . The lady we saw had a massive range and brought your arms to goosebumps

Takes you back in Time!. A very informative tour of a historic and beautiful Opera House. A bit confusing when buying the tickets, which included photos and a short performance. To clarify, it allows you to take photos, not have your photo taken. The short performance was disappointing since it was given in the staircase, and not on stage. Our guide was very well spoken and took her time to ensure everyone got to see and hear her presentation. Well worth the time and price overall.

Stunning Interior - Amazing Tour. What an absolutely beautiful opera house. The marble and gold leif is just top notch. The tour was informative and funny! What a great 30-40 minutes. Make sure to stay for the 5 minute mini opera.

Stunning. Well worth checking out the foyer even if you dont take a tour. We were passing and stopped here to see if there was an opera but no such luck. However both the exterior and interior are stunning and well worth viewing.

One of our first sights in Budapest.. We were passing by this magnificent building and it is definitely worth a look inside. We did not go to see a show there or go for a tour but had a free look inside the main hall which is a splendid building .

Beautiful facade, beautiful interior. This is a beautiful opera house. If you're not attending any event in the Opera House, it is a good idea to take the guided tour. Guides are ok, but the building is a good enough reason for to take the tour.

Beauiful, but I would recommend seeing a show instead of the tour. The building is beautiful and worth seeing, but I would recommend getting tickets for a show instead of paying for the tour. Our tour was less than 40 min, we were rushed through the rooms as there were other groups waiting and sadly couldn't understand everything the guide was saying, he was talking really fast. The price for the tour is 12 euros (3000 huf) and you can pay 500 huf to take photos and another 700 huf for listening to 5 minutes of opera at the end of the tour.

Beautiful building, average tour. The building is simply gorgeous. The tour was average. It was very busy and chaotic. The guides didn't seem to be handling that very well. The tour started later which made the tour feel a bit rushed. Had barely time to take a few photo's. At one point we couldn't enter a room yet because another tour was still there so the guide had to improvise a bit. The guide spoke decent English, but seemed a bit nervous and would sometimes stop in a sentence and not finish it. All in all I would still recommend it because of the beautiful interior.
Opera in miniature. Same plans used for the Vienna Opera house but half the size. Excellent guided tour and do book the 5 minute opera at the end.

The oppulence is breathtaking. Attended a performance of Tchaikovsky's "The Ace of Spades" here. EVen if you don't go to a performance, the building is well worth a visit. The opulence is stunning - I've never seen so much gilt in all my life. As for the opera itself, it was well performed with good soloists and chorus and a very capable orchestra. Sur-titles were displayed above the stage in Hungarian and English. Well, ... American - but then you can't have everything! ;-)
What a gem. The tour of this beautiful send quaint opera house with the couple of arias sung at the end of the English speaking tour makes this an unforgettable experience which must NOT be missed.
Average. I m not a an Opera lover anyways but found it average, i felt a little sleepy through the entire show

A must-do tour in Budapest!. Pure elegance! They are so particular about the acoustics that they retain plain wooden seats -- no cushions to muffle the sound. We toured just after the matinee performance of Billy Elliott. Fun! We paid extra for the 15 minute concert and are glad we did. [And I paid extra to be allowed to take non-flash photos.] Even the bar/snack area is beautiful. Afterwards we went downstairs to the cafe for Esterhazy cake and an iced latte. Ah, the life!

Beautiful inside and out. The Hungarian State Opera House was just beautiful. Not as impressive inside as the Opera House in Paris, but regardless we really liked the tour. We opted in for the little concert afterwards. Keep in mind it is not in the actual theatre, and its just like 2 songs from an opera singer. The inside of the theatre is stunning!

Not to be missed!!. We booked tickets at home before travelling & we're not disappointed. The auditorium & theatre are stunning & the performance - Billy Elliot was excellent. We drank a glass of champagne during the interval, a wonderful evening that I will remember for a long time.

Totally aewsome. We had a tour as part of our trip to Budapest. Only in an absolute monarchy could something so extravagant be built. You are overwhelmed by the plushness and so much gold. It has to be experienced as words do not do it justice. PS if you have seen Budapest don't bother with Prague.

Great cheap operas. When buying tickets it you are tall and need legroom do not get the cheap balcony seats they were tighter than most. Otherwise the building is beautiful the opera was amazing and the upper concession room during intermission is this beautiful rich painted wood room not to be missed when drinking a glass of bubbles.

Opera in Budapest. Fabulous place a must visit experience. Only thing is a strong tip, at the breaks it is nearly impossible to get to the bar, so we popped out turned right and headed to a nearby bar. Was able to suitably refresh ourselves etc and return within 20 minutes for the next interval and some people were still queuing for their first drink or for the toilet.

Worth touring. Although it was a short tour, around 45 minutes, and not as informative as the tour at the Vienna Opera House, it is a beautiful opera house and well worth it to see it. Not nearly as opulent as the opera house in Paris but definitely a beauty. Downside of visiting in the summer -- no performances. Did not pay for the solo performance at the end --- our timing was such that we could see and hear her from our tour!

Yes, it is a theatre, but fun. The highlight of the experience was the quick solo performance at the end by one the performers. The tour is basic; walking around the corridors, see the royal box and some antechambers but the highlight was the quick little show at the end with a snippet of Don Juan and The Marriage of Figaro. The restaurant attached the to Opera House has good food and was a great place for a mid afternoon meal.

Go inside! Even if you are not fan of the opera. From the outside it's just an opera house, one like you can see all around Europe. Nice to see from outside, of course, but you definitely should go inside to see the real beauty. I argued with my husband like "I don't wanna pay a ticket to see an opera house like one in my own home town". I entered after him still arguing, and in the moment I stoped talking and opened my mouth. I have never seen such beautiful and colorful lobby with marble staircases and golden wall ornaments. A big big surprise. You are not obligated to pay a ticket if you are not going at the show. You can enter a lobby for free. We couldn't enter main hall because of the show. From the inside you can imagine royal carriages coming on a social event century back. I felt like I entered in a time machine.
Very grand and beautiful interior. Managed to catch 'Billy Elliot' at the grand and beautiful State Opera House. The interior is, in my opinion, grander than the Royal Albert Hall in London.

Billy Elliott. We saw Billy Elliott here, which was originally scheduled to play at the Erkel, so the location change was a nice surprise. The play was wonderful, with great sets, acting, dancing, and singing. World class performance for a much more reasonable price than in the similar opera house in Vienna. We dressed up a bit, although there were some people wearing jeans, shorts, etc.

Attending a performance here is a must. Being stunned by the decor and taking advantage of the reasonable ticket price, we spent a fabulous night by watching a musical here. Most of the walls and pillars in the hall are made of gold. The ceiling is painted beautifully. The decor here is just beyond description. I guess some people may be deterred by the language barrier. You can actually rest assured that there are English supertitles for most performances. So, don't miss this gem when you go to Budapest.
beautiful. lovely building inside and out we did the tour,very interesting and includes a snippet of opera in the stairs at the end

Great 1 hour tour of this beautiful opera house. Well done tour in English explaining the history of the creation of this opera house. We recommend paying a little extra and staying for the 10 minute mini-opera afterwards with one of the opera performers - well worth it and you won't sit any closer in any performance!

Not an opera fan, but solo performance gives fond lasting memories of this opera house. I was bewildered at entire lavish interior deco, there must be a fascinating story behind the overall structure design and past century happenings. The opera guide (uni graduate?) was very confident, eloquent, well spoken English and definitely knowledgeable! We were in a business group so a pre-arranged opera performance on the grand staircase where the 2 performers (a male & female) sang so beautifully well. Both solos and duet. and they have Venetian mask...adds on the mystery! I personally not an opera fan, but these few songs give me fond lasting memories of this opera house!

Opera House . This building has presence. And sometimes there are free mini concerts too. We passed by several times and walked around. Very beautiful, next time I have to see and enjoy the mini concerts.
Enjoy. you can enjoy the visit with a mini concer, funIf you like music, essential to know its secrets. Not to be missed
Nice. Nice and interesting tour of the opera house. You pay a small fee and an extra fee for a small opera show at the end. Very enjoyable. Recommended.

Most beautiful building in Budapest.. As you come in you already know you're in a special place, you see gold everywhere.The paintings on the wall and the ceiling make it extra special. If you're in Hungary a must visit in my opinion.
Must see!. Whether to attend a concert or for a guided tour, the opera house is worth a visit. Located on Budapest's most elegant boulevard, the opera house is iconic and worth a visit.

It looks no doupt as an Opera. The building design of this Opera, not just an other design, but it yield clearly its destiny. The whole building, its decorated entrance, the slavish interior, the clock room, end even the toilets are a clear statement of culture and elegance of the past century. Even its location in the City is suitable to its purpose. If you don't intent to see some great performances that in the program, just a visit to the interior, is a worthwhile experience.

Lovely building, worth seeing. The opera house was beautiful and the tour was interesting. The tour guide was very proud of it, noting that the emperor wouldn't allow Budapest to have a bigger opera house than Vienna's, but that she thought the opera house in Budapest was more beautiful. Having seen both, I'm not sure I completely agreed with her, but I enjoyed my visit. I'd love to go back and see a production some time; they told us that ticket prices are very reasonable.

Popular landmark in Budapest,. Located on Andrassy a popular area to chill and watch the world go by.
The architecture is stunning like many sights in Budapest.
We stayed close by so walked past it several times a day, but did not go inside.
Another popular landmark in Budapest, it is close to the Opera metro and opposite hop on hop off bus stop

A treasure of the Opera world. We went here for the Nutcracker with our daughter - easily the most beautiful opera house I have been in. Also, the acoustics are incredible. The food served during intermissions is pricey, but the overall experience is first class indeed.

If you Love Opera. All over Europe opera remains not for the wealthy but for the lover of classic music. The building not only attracts your attention but the shows are keeping both local and visitor in step with the performing arts

Interesting history, stunningly beautiful inside.. Well worth a visit and easy to do on your first day when you arrive as tours are at 3pm and 4pm. Really enjoyed learning about the history of the building and the people who have visited. Stunningly beautiful inside - very impressive and worth paying just a few extra Florint for wrist band to enable one person at least to take photo's.Tours available in all languages and the guide was informative and entertaining. It can be quite humid inside the opera house.
The marriage of vigaro. Amazing opera hall! Beautifully decorated! Lovely bar during the interval . Very well organised theatre . Staff very helpful
Beautiful architecture . Worth a visit! Beautiful and just off of Andrassy, a main thoroughfare. One of the nicest sights in Budapest.

Visit for the outside alone!. We didn't manage to go inside of this stunning building, but we did pass it every day as we were staying close. Stunning architecture with a lot of history. If travelling by public transport it is number one, the yellow line. To the stop opera.

3-euro tickets - A must see outside and inside. Easy to find on Andrassy boulevard, this opera should also be visited inside. You may just peak in but even better is to visit it. Either you go at 2 or 3pm for a guided tour or you go for a play. Tickets start at 3 euros (if you don't like it, you can leave earlier) and there are plays (or dance shows) in the afternoons on Sunday. Some plays from the classic repertoire are shown in very unconventional ways - you might be surprised.

Beautiful building and informative tour. We did an afternoon tour which took approx 45mins. Absolutely stunning architecture and a lot of original furnishings. An informative guide gave us a snapshot of the history of the building. Fascinating! We paid a little extra to see an opera performance on the grand staircase where the performer performed two songs. Great acoustics and very talented lady!

Great Experience. The Opera House's interior is beautiful, almost (but not quite) as grand as the Parliament building. You can do a tour of the Opera, but I'd recommend seeing a show here. Tickets are very cheap and it will be an unforgettable experience to see an opera in one of the premier venues in the world! The show my friends and I saw was definitely worth the less than $20 price.

Worth visiting for the architecture alone. We stopped off to look inside rather than to see an opera. It really is a very impressive building. As the guide book says you can imagine the horse drawn coaches with the rich and famous of the time drawing up outside the building and entering in their finery to glide past the murals, columns, chandeliers and gilded ceilings on their way to their seats to see an opera performance. If you are into opera this must be a wonderful place to see/hear one. I understand that there are guided tours of the main stage and auditorium but it is worth visiting just to stand in the foyer and wonder through to the cloakroom, café and shop.
Ornate. Popped in today. Didn't pay to go in but the entry area gave a good indication of what the inside looked like. Nice little gift shop with quality goods.
Stunning architecture. Beautiful, buy a photo licence. Breath taking painting, many on the ceilings.Really interesting tour but book in advance as sell out quickly.
Great architecture. You can't do much with a building except take photos and learn about its history. that's what we did.
Beautiful!. This is another of Budapest's most beautiful buildings, well worth a visit. Not the cheapest activity, especially as they charge more for a 5 minute "mini concert" or for taking photos.

loved it. I know alot of people might not like operasbut it was first time to see such a huge opera houseI went to see how the preparations took place ,how the lights were put up and how the effects worked.Go see it !!

Nice to See. Very nice to get a tour of the Opera and have a mini concert. It is interesting to hear some of the history of music in Budapest. This is a relatively quick afternoon activity which likely could follow by a glass of wine on a terrace. Worth the visit!

Don't judge a book by its cover. While somewhat ornate on its exterior, the Hungarian State Opera House looks like it needs just a little bit of love and care from the outside... even if just a good clean.But inside... WOW...!! The actual auditorium itself, alone, is a very impressive place, with lots of gold, with red velvet-covered seating... albeit that seating is a little cramped and not too comfortable. The Presidents Suite is on the first floor looking directly at the stage providing the President and his guests with perfect viewing of a performance. Our tour included access to this small suite, but with strict instructions that we were not permitted to sit in his special chair.There are a number of supporting rooms, meeting rooms,etc., within the opera house complex, and they are all spectacular, with expensive woodwork, ceilings etc. I would suggest an official tour of the complex because that provides you access to some areas of the Opera House not normally accessible to the general public walking in off the street.Well woth a visit for an hour or so, if you can spare the time.
Worth to see. If you are in Budapest, this opera house definitely must be seen. Smaller than Wien Opera house but worth to see. You can see everything related with Franz Liszt.

Overpriced, overcrowded. My mother and grandmother adore opera and after reading about the Operahaz in the guidebook they really wanted to book a tour. We turned up for the 3pm tour to find the lobby packed with Viking tour groups. We were very surprised to see that the tour tickets did not include the "mini-concert" advertised in the guidebook - this costs extra - and it costs extra for a pass to take photos! The tickets were cheaper than what one would pay in England, however they were expensive relative to other Budapest attractions. I got a student ticket which was still quite dear.At the time of our English tour, there were tours for 5 other languages also. In total there were around 200 people being toured at the same time. The English group had to be split into 2 groups as there were about 70 of us. This was poor planning on their part - why did they let in that many people if they could not handle it?The tour began 10 minutes late. In every room we visited, there was at least one other tour group so it was almost impossible to hear what the tour guide was saying.The guide herself was excellent however and very fluent in English, using English sayings and making jokes throughout the tour so she was clearly well trained.Unfortunately, we had to leave the tour early because it was unbearably hot in the building. It was 30+ degrees Celcius outside, and the sheer number of people in the building meant it was even hotter inside despite the stone walls and floors. Shortly after we left, however, we saw the rest of the tour group leaving so the tour was only around half an hour long.

Beautiful Opera House with excellent acoustics. Opera and Ballet are not my favourite pastimes, however, my partner loves both and living in Budapest we couldn't miss going to see Nutcracker at Christmas. The ballet itself was absolutely stunning with great cast and stage set-up. I would thoroughly recommend this at Christmas as it is generally on each year. The Opera House is stunning inside and the bar has been fully restored giving a great spot to relax during the intermission. Queues at the bar were long even though there were plenty of servers, however, did not detract from the occasion and the setting. Well worth a visit although I did watch an Opera in November and can't even remember the name of it which says a lot for my classical knowledge :-)
Just outside. The outside view of the palace is very nice, as well as the ground floor. We did not make the tour because there timing was not good. The toilets were free and clean.

Buy a ticket - the prices are very reasonable. We didn't do the tour as after reading a few reviews, realised that we could go to a performance for much the same price. We saw the fairy queen and the tickets were about £4.50 each for a 'front row in the gods, to the side' - so a slightly obscured view but it was fine - the cheapest tickets were just £1.50 but you would have had no view at all. From here we had ample chance to soak up the atmosphere, admire the beautiful building, and enjoy the performance. Seats are quite small and it is VERY high up so if you are not comfortable with this sort of surroundings you need to think about booking - I can imagine it would freak some people out. Also helpful if you are OK with watching an opera - probably not with kids unless they like that sort of thing. Can't believe what good value it was and enjoyed it.

Amazing performance of Billy Elliot in the HSOH!. The show has been a joy in every aspect: musically, choreographically as well as in terms of the epic heartwarming story. The acting has not left us disappointed either with the script giving the original production a bit of a Hungarian touch.The Opera House is breathtaking and is oozing of history. One of the most impressive exterior and interior architecture I have ever seen of this kind.To avoid queues at the bar during the short interval and so that you can finish consuming your drink or bite to eat before the bell, it is advisable to pre-order your items. Don't forget, you won't be able to take any drink or food into the auditorium.

They Sing to You at the end of the Tour!. The opera house is beautiful, although quite small. I'm sorry we were there in the summer when no performances were scheduled. The tour guides are excellent. And, should you be willing to pay a little bit extra (do it), you get serenaded by one of the opera performers at the end of the tour.
Beautiful. We took a tour of the inside of the opera house which was very interesting. For an additional fee, you could listen to a mini showl

Loved it!. I went there and watched Billy Elliot. Just loved the musical, the acoustic is perfect, and the view as well, even from the cheapest places. There is a translation into english of the play so, you better go with glasses otherwise will be very difficult to read. Very recommendable and the building is beautiful

Imperial splendour at its best.. Guided Tour is worth taking and is the only way to see the Opera House. It is an opulent building built the Emperor with a magnificent staircase built for his exclusive use. In fact he used it once! A Mini Concert is offered at the end of the tour with singers performing well known arias.

The guide will probably go into too much detail.... But, you get to sit in one of the box seats and take look back in time. This opera house had to be built smaller than the one in Vienna, but no one sad it had to be less beautiful. So, it is appointed in detail with wonder. Oh, it will cost 2 eros to take picts.

Expected better. Impressive historical building. I watched the Billy Elliot musical. The visitors were dressed undemanding, in flip-flop and sandals...The break took shorter than we could have our drink in buffet. Not enough toilet.

Wonderful Historic Opera House. I have visited Budapest several times and each time I have attended at least one performance at the opera house. The interesting fact is that in these days of international stars, Budapest opera mostly features local Hungarian talent without famous opera divas and gents and offers a glimpse into a rich cultural musical tradition. Without fail, performances of Mozart, Verdi and Puccini were first rate while featuring young and up-coming performers.The very building and stage transports you into another time, not unlike the Vienna State Opera except that the Hungarian Opera in spite of its ornate architecture is still a smaller more modest version of the Vienese beauty. In addition, the Andrassy neighborhood where the opera house is located is a marvelous piece of local architectural and cultural history with many wonderful restaurants ad coffee shops or just places to go for an after dinner, or after performance aperitif and an obligatory Hungarian delicious dolci.I loved walking in the Opera house neighborhood on the Pest Side of this beautiful city by the Danube, Budapest, Hungary.

Amazing if you like opera. We went and bought a ticket for the opera here at last minute not knowing wat was the tittle of the opera.The architecture and design of the opera house was mesmerizing.Couldn't really say the same about the opera,partly to blame may be due to our interest and lack of cultural knowledge.But it's definitely worth a visit.
Pretty . This us actually a stop on the yellow line (underground) direction of Mexiko utca and is right there when you go up overground again.

large and beautiful Opera. The tours start only at 14:00 every day which is a bit limiting.(For example, the Vienna Opera tours starts in the morning).tour is very interesting and lasted about 40 minutes.During the tour we passed through several interesting rooms and Listen to interesting explanations on the structure and the period.

A worthwhile tour.. If you are not going to the opera (we won't), then the opera house tour is worth your time. Impressive, well done, and informative, it ended with a "mini concert" that was just 5 minutes. Did it for me.
Amazing!!!. A must see in Budapest. It takes you back in time. There is a mini concert and the talent takes your breath away.

Expensive. Nice building. This is the main place to watch a show when in town. The cheapest price we were given was 50 euro's which was too much for us. Apparently it always is at 98+% capacity. Ithink because they sell cheap last minute tickets at 10% of the cost to help fill the empty seats....but you should ask that when you go there if you are on a budget.
Excellent. All tourists in Budapest must visit this opera house. The facade of this building is beautiful with statues of famous composers.

Nice building, bad seats. We went to see Billy Elliot and it was fantastic. It was an impressive building, the show was great. The only problem was my seat. If you are 180 cm or taller, do some stretching before and during the interval otherwise you would need a massage right after the performance... or a knee surgery! ;-) Sad, but true...

Don't miss it. After coming from Vienna we weren't really sure that this Opera house would impress us. Well, it is much nicer and lavish than the one in Vienna. In fact, it used to be frequented by Sissi. The tour guide was so knowledgeable and made the tour very interesting. At the end we got to experience how the acoustic works with an encore presentation by a great soprano. That was really amazing. Again, Vienna was not to par to this, since there we got a so-so soprano. Highly recommended.

Well worth a visit. Whilst it is not free it is well worth a visit. You will have to wear covers over your shoes so as not to damage the interior so you need to be careful on the floors but it is very ornate inside and there is a lot to see.

Absolute must to see inside. Massively impressive structure that we saw with the aid of a guide on a walking tour and also when we attended Billy Elliot sung in Hungarian with English sub titles. The frescos and older style opulence of the entire building is very special to behold. Great rainy day alternative but possibly boring for kids - not that we had any with us!
Excellent. We went to Billy Elliot and it was amazing! A beautiful building and a fantastic show. I would recommend this to anyone visiting Budapest!
Great architecture. Amazing building located at the Andrassi avenue. Not huge, but still quite big building with great looking facade.

Opera house -play: Billy Elliot, Opera ház Billy Elliot. The play is great and extremely spectacular. Actors and scenery are also amazing. It is worth watching. There are many kids involved in the play who are also great perfomers. Ii is worth emphasizing two kids who took the roles of Billy (Vizlendvai Áron) and Michael (Lukács Olivér) delivered superior performance in dancing and singing in spite of their young age. Do not miss this play.The build itself is amazing like a castle of the XVIIIth century. Guided tours are available.A musical nagyon látványos. A színészek és a díszlet szintén szenzációs, feltétlen érdemes megnézni. A színdarabban szereplő gyerekek is kiváló teljesítményt nyújtanak. Érdemes kiemelni a két főszerepet játszó kisfiút Billy - Vizlendvai Áron és Michael - Lukács Olivért, akik nagyszerű teljesítményt nyújtottak táncban és zenében is. Ne hagyd ki, nézd meg!Az épület maga is nagyon szép, akár egy XVIII. századi kastély. Vannak vezetett operaház látogatások is turistáknak.
Beautiful and Entertaining Opera Tour. It's a beautiful building, with great history - the tour is a must. There are opera shows every night, can't miss it!

Stunning building. We joined a tour & paid a little extra for a mini concert. The tour was very interesting, each room we went in we learnt a little about it, it was quick and interesting, a good length of time (not too long!) The building has beautiful architecture inside & out, it was really nice to sit in the opera house its self, but I was a little disappointed that the mini concert was not performed on the stage, but on the staircase instead. The singer was very good, but I think it would have made it much more impressive if she'd been on the stage. However the extra cost for this was minimal. I would certainly recommend this, it was a most enjoyable hour.
Soo classy. This building is simply amazing! And all the performances i have seen here were so beautiful and fabulos! Recommended!

old world glory. the most important budapest landmark along with the parliament and the fisherman's bastionfantastic building, super artistic program, beautiful grand bar, and a breath taking cafe accessible also independently from the opera house. check out their home made pasta, pizza and one of the best goulash in town

Beautiful building. State Opera is situated in Andrassy Blvd, and it dates from XIX century. It was built in Neo-Rennaisance style, but it has a lot of Baroque elements. You can see statues of 16 composers: Mozart, Beethoven, Verdi, Bizet...

Very informative. The tour is not long but they pack in a lot of information so you get a real idea of its history. You have the option of a mini concert at the end. It was a pleasant way to end the tour but be warned it is not a concert with musicians but an opera singer who sang a couple of songs. Some people were disappointed but the extra cost is so minimal you shouldnt expect more. I would recommend it.

Beautiful architecture at the Hungarian State Opera House. The Hungarian State Opera House has beautiful architecture. We did not have time to take a tour and there as no performance during the weekend we visited Budapest. Nevertheless, we enjoyed viewing its architecture as we walked around the neighborhood.

Pop in to get a feel of grandeur.. We passed this many times on the way to other places and it's an impressive building. By the time we actually got there we missed the last tour of the day in English, but milling around on the ground floor you still could get a buzz of history and performance.

Breathtaking operahouse. As I have visited it many times since I was born I can admit, this is one of the most beautiful building in Budapest. The operas and concerts are nice too, but many of them are in original( german,italian) language so to understand it it is recommended to search for the background story.Better to book a ticket as it is quite cheap compare to its sister in Vienna
nice tour. the opera house is a nice place to visit. The tour is not too in-depth but the building is beautiful.

A snooze. We visited the opera house today. The price was expensive! 10 Euro for a tour of a opera house that is less superior then the Vienna opera house and they charge MORE!! Vienna is only 7,50 Euro and provide more history. The tour walked you through the building. Talked about when it was built but nothing else. Couldn't even see the Emperors Box. No musical history - Famous performances or debuts. Very disappointing! You also have to pay to take photos. Then they also charge extra to hear a "performance" of an opera singer who performs to to a CD track. Only two arias. Total tourist trap. No real music love or culture.
Amazing. The architecture and the design of the building is amazing. It's really a must see place. There are guided tours every day in the afternoons.

If you enjoy a fine theatre and musical experience, just go,,,. The building is amazing outside, Inside it is a stunning and proud building. It speaks of music and feels full of the history and people that have enjoyed the magic an auditorium like the one here inspires.The stall seats can create a bit of an ache, but the lower balconies are stunning and good for a clear sound.Compared to the UK, prices are amazing value.

Beautiful Opera House. We did the English tour + mini concert. At the end of the tour, a singer sang 2 arias. I assumed it would just be someone they grabbed to sing for the tourists. But she was quite good. The opera house itself is gorgeous. Worth the tour if you are an Opera lover.

If you have been to Vienna or London,skip it. Nice place but not as attractive as that of Vienna. Short sight seeing tours. Do not take you behind stage as they do so in Vienna (only in July August). A concert after guided tour (costing additional 2 Euros) was a mockery as it was carried out by one artist and we were made to sit on staircase. Can give a skip definitely. However well connected to Metro yellow line and yellow line is UNESCO HERITAGE selection so nice coaches and nice stations.Remember Austria metros have frequent ticket checking as we saw on many occasions few people being penalized.

Magnificent Building. Beautiful building & worth seeing if time, with guided tour. Hear about Emperor's box, how & when used. Only four stars because had to pay extra to take photos, then no one monitoring those taking. Also be aware that mini-opera at end (extra fee) is on staircase, not inside opera house itself.

Show. The place is worthwhile visiting and so is the guided tour. However, the additional offer of experiencing a musical show is simply humiliation: you sit on the stairs and most of the audience cannot see the singer. The whole show lasts a few minutes only

Paid tour of the inside of the Opera House. The tour is excellent.
