Beautiful Opera House. amazing building inside with rich history and paintings. the guided tour was very informative and fun.
Historic. Actually attended an opera here. It was very entertaining. The old facility has such charm and is excellent for acoustics.

Beautiful Building, Excellent Tour. The Hungarian State Opera House is a Budapest landmark on a very elegant boulevard of upscale shops and restaurants. It is really exquisite inside. We had a tour with a very good English-speaking guide, followed by a short concert of 2 arias performed by a lovely soprano with a voice that was the real deal. Although it may seem silly to pay extra for a 10-minute concert after the tour, it really was worth it.

Take the tour with the performance. We took the opera house tour with the mini concert and had a fine time. The guide was pretty knowledgeable, the place is beautiful, and the mini concert was a lot of fun. Afterwards, if you take two left turns on your way out, there are a lot of fine little cafes where you can grab a bite and a cup of coffee. Perfect entertainment for a rainy day.
Ballet at the Opera House. We saw the ballet Eugene Onegin in this beautiful and ornate building - wonderful performance in a spectacular venue - fizz at the interval made it a perfect evening!
Opera House. This architectural monument, representative of Budapest is located near the Opera metro station. I recommend discovery of this monument with the mind, heart, soul and eyes.

A very nice experience. Going for a night at the opera is always a nice part of a city break and Hungarian opera is impressive not only as a building but as a very, very, very good troop! Translations are available in English and tickets are more than affordable, especially for the quality of performances.

Beautiful place and the best private guide. Dori Horvath gave us the best private tour ever! The Opera is the a beautiful piece of architecture and the history behind it is fascinating. Worth visiting and I would recommend attending a show.

Onegin Ballet performance. We were not only impressed with the architecture of this very impressive building but the ballet performance was superb.Try the house champagne in the interval which is reasonably priced and can be pre booked before performance and gives you a reserved table without queuing at the bar which is very long!

Plan Ahead and Get Tickets for a Show. My friend and I really wanted to see an opera at the Hungarian State Opera House, so we booked opera tickets online as soon as we had our dates in Budapest confirmed. We ended up staying right across the street from the Opera House, which was amazing. The inside is stunning and absolutely worth seeing a show.. We even bought champagne to take in with us (turns out you can't take it all the way to your seats, FYI). We ended up sitting next to a local who filled us in on all kinds of details about the history theater that we didn't know.During the intermission, theatergoers can trickle out onto the balcony. We went in June so it was gorgeous outside.

Wow!. Be sure to do the guided tour of this remarkable opera house. Our guide provided an interesting history of the building in a friendly, quirky manner. The building itself is spectacular. Well worth the time and entrance fee.

Splendid Building ; Excellent Performance ; Wonderful Experience ; Outstanding Staff ; This One is Not to be Missed!. Do you find that all of the main sights are full of tourists while the Hungarians are elsewhere? Then you haven't been to the Hungarian Opera.To start, we are in Central Europe -- the Austria-Hungarian Empire -- and the opera is important. This Opera House is not exception, and is a beautiful example of late-nineteenth splendor. If you don't want to attend a performance there is a tour of the building. But why would you not attend a performance?The musicianship and performance craft is excellent. This is Hungary, after-all, and this is important. If you enjoy the opera you will enjoy this, and if you don't enjoy the opera, please realize that if you must see an opera Budapest is one of the better places to see classical opera in the world.For the experience: This is Central Europe after-all, and attending the opera is important. Black tie. Something to look forward to. Dinner. Drinks. It's an event. The audience will be mostly Hungarian, with some other assemblage of diplomats and music-lovers, and relatively few ordinary tourists. And finally, a huge shout-out to the most professional ushering staff I've seen in a while. I took my 88 year-old father, who has arthritis, and got a high box. The ticket-taker called her colleague, who took us to another colleague who had a key-card to the backstage elevator, and who took us up to our floor, and who brought us back out to the public areas. Then, at the end, an usher came and got us, whipped us to the elevator, and straight down to the carriage-entrance. Thank you!Opera-love or not, this is a very special place.
Worth passing by. If you're in the area get a takeaway coffee and a sandwich and go and seat on its steps, you'll enjoy students practicing their vocals inside
A wonderful matinee. We went to a Sunday matinee of the Hungarian Ballet's performance of Eugene Onegin. The building is just magnificent and in a beautiful state of repair.

Beautiful Ballet In An Incredible Opera House. We had recently visited the Opera House in Prague which was beautiful enough but the Opera House in Budapest just blows your mind! Absolutely beautiful. The décor on the inside and the architecture of the building on the outside really is something to see. We thoroughly enjoyed the ballet performance we attended here - if there is something on at the Opera House whilst you on in Budapest then a highly recommend it - alternatively you can pay to go inside and take a look even if you aren't attending an opera/ballet performance it's certainly worth a look inside just beautiful!

one of the best opera houses in the world. beautiful building with the best decoration you could wish to see. Its interesting to see how the other half lived. Don't be tricked into purchasing a ticket to take photos (no-one checks if you have)

A must for opera lovers and others. We had the tour and mini-recital and it was lovely. The mezzo-soprano sang a few songs on the elegant stairway where we all sat, and it was such a treat to hear such beauty amid such elegance for a small price.

Not to be missed!. Stunning building, great informative tour. Only 3 tours per day - English only at 2pm, then 3pm and 4pm. Get to visit the Royal box but can't sit In the Royal chair! Great new Rennovated bar inside. Pay slightly extra for mini concert just for sample of opera at end of tour.

Gorgeous!. We had just visited the Vienna Opera House and were so impressed with it. But after visiting the Hungarian, were blown away by the beauty of the inside. We're lucky to attend 2 performances and enjoy it greatly.
The Nutcracker on Christmas Morning. Beautiful building. Dress up or be shamed! As this was a very special day, everyone was dressed to the nines :) Great performance also. Five stars!
An enchanting experience!. We saw top professional "Sleeping Beauty" ballet. Traditionally performed and mesmerizing for three hours. Building and decore were worth the ticket price alone!

Beautiful! Well worth the time and ticket fee.... This one of the top attractions in Budapest by many travel guides. The place has beautiful architecture and interior decoration and is definitely well worth your time and money. At the end of the short guided tour there is a taste of Opera by one of the performers. Although not real opera fans we were really blown away by the short performance at the end of the tour.Tip: buy your ticket beforehand and get your student or other discount. If you want to book a place for a full opera / concert, be sure to do it in advance (a few days before, normally will not be enough if you are in the high season).

Beautiful and Charming. Excellent Guided visit to the Opera House. We went through the history of the house, every space and curiosities. After all a short 10 minutes show with a Tenor by the stairs. Nice visit.

Amazing. This is a real old-world feeling opera house with tickets ranging from 600 to 20000 forints. Advance booking is recommended! In the breaks you can have a drink on the balcony facing the Andrassy boulevard. Classy :)

Worth a visit.. We booked this simply for the experience if visiting an opera. The building itself was amazing, but we weren't fans of the opera,although it was in Russian, as that was the only one available during our visit. We booked tickets in advance and Paid less than £5.

Very Impressive Architecture. Glad I bought a ticket for the English tour of the Opera House. Without buying a ticket, you can not see interior. You can also pay to watch a mini concert after the tour, but I elected not to, mainly bc I had other plans that day. The Opera House was extremely impressive in design and décor. Recommend stopping by for the tour.

Perfect Evening!. Before arriving in Budapest we booked tickets to a ballet gala through the Opera House website. It was incredibly easy, could view in English and choose our individual seats. The best tickets only cost £45 each and the confirmation was emailed straight back to me and I was able to print the tickets at home. Perfect start! The building is stunning from the outside and even more stunning inside. I would advise arriving 30 mins before your performance to have a walk around and take some photos or enjoy a drink. There is a fantastic bar and the doors open out onto a terrace with great views all along Andrassy Ave. We ordered our drinks for the interval and the lovely girl on the bar pointed over to a small table and said that's where they would be. When we returned there was a "Reserved" sign on the table by the window with 2 chairs and our drinks with name. Couldn't have asked for more. The ballet gala was a full house; the atmosphere was fantastic; the dancers were world class, for example we watched Yonah Acosta one of the Principal male dances from the English National Ballet dance with First Soloist Yuhui Choe from the Royal Ballet along with lead dancers from the Hungarian National ballet, Mikhailovsky Theatre and Norwegian National Ballet. It was a prefect evening in every sense and we will definitely return to Budapest and to the Opera House,

Opulent but practical showplace from the 19th cenetry. The tour was complete and informative of this showplace. We were treated to a private tour and brief performance in this palace of performance. Well designed and carefully cared for, this is a must-see for your Pest visit.

Budapest without seeing a ballet or opera is not complete. A visit to the opera or ballet should not be missed; I saw Sleeping Beauty by the Hungarian State Ballet and it was outstanding. The Opera House itself is beautiful.

One of the most beautiful opera houses in the world. The Budapest Opera House is one of the best opera houses in the world for its acoustics and its auditorium seats 1200 people. The statue of Ferenc Erkel, the composer of the Hungarian national anthem stands in front of the Opera House, and the statue in front of the Budapest Opera is of Ferenc Liszt, the well-known Hungarian composer.We visited the Opera House during the day, and we were in a group, but only one person was allowed to take photographs as they charge for this. You can also go to see the performance in the evening, although we did not have time for that. The whole tour takes about 45 minutes.

Unforgettable experience . Took mum to see sleeping beauty ballet. Was so lovely to see the arts well appreciated. Beautiful building, good bar service and stunning decor. Excellent value for money as I understand tickets are subsidized. Great evening spent all around.

Amazing experience in an amazing atmosphere and amidst some grand atchitecture. Had the absolute pleasure of seeing "St. John's Passion" as a staged performance in one of Europe's grand opera houses. Excellent architecture and internal decor, amazingly restored and maintained, a totally "full house", great acoustic, and an exquisite stage set. All in all an amazing experience.;

Tour of Opera House. We just took the guided tour of the Opera House. Tours in English, French, German and Hungarian (some other languages available) last about an hour: pay extra for a brief "Mini" concert at the end. General tour of public spaces and auditorium with details of building/history. Guide was excellent. Auditorium stunning. Well worth it.

Take The Tour. The exterior is stunning but the interior is energizing. A guided tour makes the building come alive. The tour is followed by five minutes of arias sung by one of their stars and is magnificent.

Very beautiful . This opera house is very beautiful inside. The tour guides are informative and friendly and you can choose to see a little opera at the end of your tour if you pay extra. Definitely recommend!

Brilliant ballet Sleeping Beauty. Having planned a visit to Budapest months ago we checked what was happening at the Opera house. Delighted that our visit coincided with a ballet. Choreography, music, stage set, technically all excellent. And what a beautiful Opera house. Plan in advance and buy the best tickets that your budget allows.
Grandeur from a Bygone Age. Beautiful building inside and out. Easily accessed from the No.1 (yellow) metro line - get out at the imaginatively entitled "Opera" station.

Wonderful Ballet. First time to visit the Opera House, it was an amazing experience! We watched The Sleeping Beauty, fantastic performance, talented cast throughout the show! We'd bought the most expensive tickets sat in row 9 opposite the stage where we could enjoy every minute of it! The building is beautiful, definitely worth a visit!

Worth seeing both inside and out even if your not atending. We went to a concert of folk music a few blocks away at Liszt Academy rather than come here for something that is not our cup of coffee, but the structure and beauty is worth visiting

A MUST. I been there and really like it.
It's look amazing, so luxury and amazing concert with fair prices !
If u do not see tickets online - go to there at 11 I think and ask frontal

Gorgeous building!. We took one of the daily tours offered (in many languages) and were very impressed with the amazing interior of this beautiful building. Everywhere you look you see rich detail in both wood and in gold leaf. The guide was very well-versed in not just the building history, but also in music history.

Magnificent. Don't miss out on visiting it. Luxury is in the air! As much as I was temped to take photos of this awesome place, photography was banned inside unfortunately! Certainly a must-see in Budapest.
A Wonderful Evening of Muis. We two performances while we were in Budapest. I highly recommend going. The prices are very reasonable and you will be experiencing a lovely historical Opera House.

Beautiful building and fascinating tour. The building is stunning. The tour was well organised and full of interesting information on the history and operation of the place. When a lot of people joined the English language tour it was split in half, giving a more intimate feel to it as there was plenty of space to see and you didn't feel crowded.This is a must do in my opinion.We did not stay for the mini concert after the tour or visit in the evening as we are not opera enthusiast but still found the place a fascinating visit.

Worth a visit. We arrived just as the four o'clock tour was about to start. You enter through a side door which confused us a bit as didn't seem to be sign posted. We paid extra so one of us could take photos and also extra to stay for the five minute concert at the end. It's a really beautiful building and we thoroughly enjoyed the two arias performed for us at the end of the trip, recommend,
Really beautiful and a must to visit. Fantastic building and beautiful interior. Really worth to visit and join the singer after the tour.

A very fond experience, watching a opera/ballet is a must.. We went to see the sleeping beauty ballet premier and it was a magnificent experience. The inside of the opera is astoundingly beautiful. The ballet, indescribable. Would highly recommend anyone visiting Budapest to buy a ticket to one of the shows! There are both cheap and expensive tickets for those interested. There are also guided tours for those not interested in buying a ticket.

Beautiful old world majestic opera house. We attended an opera and enjoyed the splendour of this beautiful building. Subtitles are provided during the opera so the audience can follow the performance. Tours of the building are also available once a day - check website for times.
Fantastic !!. Beautiful in all aspects. The guided tour was full of interesting information. Special treat at the end of the tour, lucky to be there.

The most ornate opera house. This is a a very tasteful building.. We ensured that we booked the tickets for the guided tour at our hotel's concierge. This opera house is grand in every sense of the word on the inside. It gives you a sense of history and how the royals engaged in classy entertainment in the old times. The architecture is mind blowing and as soon as you enter it , you are transported to a different world where everything is either coated with gold or designed with the most artistic detail and attention. We had a pram with us and decided to leave it at the cloakroom. Top tip: Do attend the mini concert- its well worth it !

Even if you don't like opera, you can't help but to fall in love with the Oper House.. The Opera House is lavish and rich in History. From the elaborate paintings, gold etched baroque lining the walls and ceiling and the amazing performers that have graced the stage of the historical place, you will be in AHH! Ironically enough, we actually walked right past the Star performer/Main character in the Opera we saw the night before (the very next day) He was so gracious!
Rival to Vienna opera. A beautiful opera house built around the same time as the one in Vienna and as spectacular Tip - try and get to a 'ticketed dress rehearsal '. Much cheaper and just as good!
beatiful. we participated the Spring Festival Opera of Tchaicovsky's Queen of Spades here. the opera house is really beatiful. I have not been to la scala but it is the kind of feeling

Go to the Opera. I am an opera fan, and used to paying a great deal for tickets in London. Make the most of your visit to Budapest by buying a ticket and going to a performance; the best seats in the house cost around £40 and you can go to a performance for less than a guided tour of the building if you choose a limited visibility seat.Opera in Hungary is heavily subsidised and not elitist; there is no need to dress up too much. The Opera house has superb acoustics and is luxurious and attractively faded. There is a beautiful bar on the first floor with an open air terrace overlooking Andrassy Street.I heartily recommend a visit: what superb value.
Sing Song. Superb opera house. 4 hours listening to and watching Queen of Spades. Excellent production. The only drawback was hard uncomfortable seats with little leg room.
Beautiful exterior. Did a walk by on Sunday afternoon with my wife. Beautiful exterior. Would like to return for an inside tour.
Beautiful space the opera was so so. Went to the opera house. Architecturally stunning. The opera had been updated and was off. But the surroundings helped make up for the lack of a good performance.

Beautiful. A must visit to see this beautiful and ornate building inside and out! We went to an opera and we enjoyed the opera experience as much as just sitting there looking all around us admiring the beauty of the interior.

Absolutely loved it. . It is a shame that I do not remember the tour guide's name, because he was really good ( the tour was in english). The Hungarian States Opera is stunning but what actually made that visit really special, it was at the end of the visit when tourists could enjoy listening to an Opera singer ( whose voice is amazing) singing a song from Don Juan and another one from Le Figaro. That made my day. Another must visit.

Very nice old opera. The visit is well made and you have group of language so it qui te well organized ;)The opera itself is very beautiful and the it is definitely a nice visit.Visit is quite short (45minute) but it gives you a lot of stories about the place.

Expensive and not worth the money. The opera house is a very beautiful building and I am glad we saw it, but comparing it to other tours we did in Budapest, it was poor and very expensive. The tour guide, Emma was lovely and very knowledgable, but we came out feeling we had wasted the large entrance fee. Compared to the brilliant tour if the parliament building we did, it fell short and was 3 times the price,

Great tour and mini concert.. Amazing building , tour guide gave us interesting insight into the history of the place. Mini concert was lots of fun. take time out to wander Andrassy, worth a look at the architecture.

Priority. When in Budapest, attending a performance in the State Opera House is one of my priorities. In terms of architecture and acoustics it is known as one of the finest in Europe, whereas the performances are usually highly appreciated by the enthusiastic public. Although I prefer Puccini's La Bohème, the last time I enjoyed Wagner's Die Walküre not in the last place because of its innovative visualisation. Unfortunately, the usual after opera soupér in the neighbouring Art Deco style Callas Restaurant didn't go on because it was closed due to a private party.
Must see!. This is a must visit! I took the tour as well as bought a ticket for an opera. The tour was actually enough. Reminded me of the Paris Opera. So beautiful and elegant.

Amazing!. We booked tickets online, just over £50 for four of us for the Opera. Beats any guided tour! Accoustics great, production thoughtful if dated, and we loved it even though we are opera novices and usually in heavy rock camp. Go and enjoy!
Another impressive building. If there had been anything on while we were there we might have bought tickets because I'm sure the interior is just as impressive.

Okay from outside. Nothing great about the opera building from outside. When we came there were just too many hoardings hung from the roof and couldn't see the building. I am sure would be good from inside, didn't take a tour as it didn't fit in schedule.

Incredible ballet!. I've been here a couple times for an English tour, and they weren't the best, but going there for a show was amazing. The ballet company was incredible, the theater is gorgeous, and the tickets weren't too expensive. I'd recommend it!
very good tour. the guided tour in the opera house is highly recomended. you get to see the royal booth and the concert hall. there is mini concert at the end of ther tour for a little fee

Guided tour with a very good flow and organisation. Tours are well organised. The staff is very helpful. Impressive architecture. An appropriate level of details about the opera house and is easy to follow (a group of 5 teens aged from 20 to 23 that English is not our first language). It's just a 1-hour tour with lots of things to see. We all found no reason to miss this place and its guided tour during our stay in Budapest. Definitely worth spending HUF690 (not sure if this is a student price) for the mini concert.
Beautiful building . I walked by, beautiful building from the outside, lots to look at with many details. Take a few minutes to enjoy it, before you continue.

Gorgeous!. We took an English speaking tour without the mini concert and enjoyed it. The woodwork and art are beautiful. It was fun to sit in the seats and see people at work building the sets on the stage. Also, interesting to see the view from the presidential/royal box.

Breath Taking. We popped in for the tour, the guide was very friendly and informed. I was about to complain about how short the tour was... until I realised we were gawping around for an hour! You get lost in the paintings, a truly beautiful building! Very historic as well. I would recommend going. Be warned though - you have to pay a little extra to take photos, but it is worth it! We also went into the cafe where prices were reasonable and again staff were really friendly.

A wow visit. Even standing outside this impressive building and taking photos is well worth while.
Each day there is a tour of the inner venue and a brief rendition of an opera which provides a flavour of a full concert.
Some day I will attend a full show.

Stunning interior, great entertainment. We chose to do the tour of the Opera House. Which was well planned with different tour guides for different language speakers. The segment of opera performed by the soprano was further enjoyed by her choosing our male companion to be her dance partner. Priceless!
Beautiful!. We went to see and Opera during our stay in Budapest. It was an amazing experience. The building is gorgeous and the main room is lovely and dreamy.

Beautiful. Went here for a pre-screening a few months ago. The inside of the venue is simply stunning, you will be transported back to a time when going out was a classy thing to do. Highly recommended for a visit and admire the building.

Cool place to visit. . This was a nice place to visit for the adults.
Pros: Very unique.
Guided tours in several languages.
Short performance after tour.
Cons: Very hot.
No pictures unless you pay for a picture ticket.
Kids may find the tour portion boring.

One of the most beautiful opera buildings in the world. We did not have a chance to attend a performance at the opera but went on guided tour. Definitely a useful exercise since you can see the nicest “classic” interiors and listen to many curious stories on the opera’s life told by your guide. Recommended!

A masterpiece . I was expecting it to be beautiful however it was magic! We took a guided tour which was so much fun. The tour leader, who was great by the way, and took us round explaining the history of most of the rooms together with stories related.The interior itself is magical! With frescos, marble, statues and so much more, it just looked so rich I could imagine Queen Sisi there! Our tour also consisted of a mini concert, which was basically one of the opera singers singing, but for the extra 2 euro it is definitely worth it.

Romeo & Juliet . Went to see a ballet of Romeo & Juliet here. Price was very good. I think around €14 per ticket. And good seats too in the balcony directly facing the stage. Sound was fab and the show was fab. Very enjoyable
Very enjoyable. Very nice place. Tour guides are really informative & lighthearted. Tell alot of interesting background information. Very beautiful inside and extremely well kept
Must see attraction. On one of the best street in budapest, how beautiful architecture outside and inside. Unfortunately we could not watch opera, but we entered in and admired inside,too.

Tours of the Opera House. Tours of the opera house included backstage glimpses and costume, wig, and set workshops. Guides speak several languages at once. In the summer it's hot - not air conditioned so choose a cooler day.

A beautiful building. It is a beautiful and impressive building. You must book tickets ahead of time. There are tours from 3-4 p.m and it costs up to 12 euros. During the tour you attend a 5 min concert.

A building full of stories and music. Really impressive in the heart of the city, the Opera house is a unique building. We took a guided tour in English for 40 minutes...We saw the main hall with the amazing ceiling and we had a very good guide explaining when and how it was built plus answering all our questions. It is truly worth visiting and you could even book to attend an Opera recital at a low price...so if you are on to Opera book a ticket for one of their performances....The building is a marvel for the eyes and even if you simply choose the tour you will be more than satisfied!

Rich Architecture, beautiful inside and a working opera house too. Went here to watch an opera (Parsifal) which was an insight into the workings of the opera. Lovely building and well thought out interval routine. Well maintained and a joy to the eye

Nice but poor if compared to other buildings. Nice but poor if compared to other buildings in the city, as the Parliament or even the castle in Buda. At night the lights are too poor and do not highlight the beauty of this building.

Beautiful interior and exterior. We went to watch the ballet and the cheapest seats were £3.50!A lot of seats in this tier have almost no view watsoever. If you see it as an entrance fee price to view the interior and ask at the ticket office if you can see the stage then they will inform you of what you are in for. I had never been to an opera house and i had never seen the ballet so it was a win win! I am glad i did it and if you have a couple hours free, i would recommend it!
Breath-taking. You haven’t got enough eyes to see and absorb it all. It’s like you can bump into Sissi herself. The extra “performance” is not of high standard, but nice as well
Beautiful building . Went on guided tour. Was very interesting. Also saw Opera which was good.Tickets are very reasonably priced.

Great place to visit.. Very beautiful neoclassical building with ceiling frescoes & statues of composers.The Budapest Opera House is considered to be amongst the best opera houses in the world in terms of its acoustics, and has an auditorium that seats 1200 people.Take the Millennium Undreground (M1) to "Opera" stationThe waiter in the cafe spoke English too.Guided tours are possible.Guided tours start daily at 3 p.m. and 4 p.m. in English, German, Spanish, Italian and French languages

Great Tour. The interior of the opera house is just spectacular. It's an architectural delight, art and artistic genius combined. We took a tour and enjoyed it very much. It was informative, not overdone but covered the topic without boring you. It was a good deal for the money we spent. We unfortunately did not have time to take in a performance. There is a nice gift shop where you can find a souvenir to take home.

Enjoyable tour in beautiful Opera House. Took the tour around this beautiful building during our second visit to lovely Budapest. The tour can be taken in different languages - with separate guides - so was nonplussed by Italian(?) who was on our English Tour translating into a different language as we went around to two other tourists. This was very distracting! Nonetheless we enjoyed ourselves and took lots of photos after paying for the privilege. At the end we were treated to a couple of songs sung by a male opera singer.We also had lunch in the cafe which although on the expensive side was very enjoyable in an impressive part of the building. The waiter was lovely and spoke very good english.All in all a good visit.

Amazing experience!. I loved the performance of die fleidenmaus in January - amazing architecture, great acoustics and my rapture was complete with my seat in a box overlooking the centre stage. Sub-titles in English and German completed a wonderful experience.

Guided tour. Good experience in the Hungarian Opera. We had a guided tour to visit the Opera inside and to know a little bite of its history. We have also paid an extra amount to see a mini concert. Unfortunately it was really really mini! Just 2 songs.
Large group, but well done. Good guides and som-what interactive. A beautiful building with lots of symbolism. I enjoyed the mini concert.

Attended an opera here! Amazing concert!. We went here to attend Bach's St. John's passion. Amazing performance and memorable evening! The whole experience was great, we bought our tickets on line for a very reasonable price. They ask you to leave your coat outside and people do dress up!!

Astonishing Opera and astonishing prices. We came from England to see Die Walkure in Budapest in the same Opera House where Malher was a conducter. Best tickets are £40 (similar Covent Garden seats are £240!). Singing was amazaing, orchestra incredible, staging 'interesting' - but that is what Opera is meant to be about. Forget London - cheaper to fly to Hungary and have the weekend in one of the best cities in Europe. How can it get better than this. Two of the Ring cycle now down, two more to go!
Great place. Wonderful place to look around and i would imagine a fantasic venue to see an opera, unfortunately there were no performances when we were there, maybe next time.
Rainy Day Afternoon Tour. The building itself is beautiful, the history a bit amazing. Our tour guide was amazing with his wit and insight. Not Opera fans so no comments from that point of view.

Great tour, beautiful building (and an impressive cafe, too). I'm not an opera lover, so on a previous visit I had merely admired the building's exterior. However, Tuesday 15th March was a national holiday and, despite assurances from the tourist infopoint, all the museums I tried to visit were shut (plus it was freezing cold and raining). Thankfully, the Opera House was open and offering guided tours. It really is a most elegant building and the 45-minute tour - which is available in a variety of languages - is conducted by very pleasant, knowledgeable, staff. You'll get to see just about everything, except backstage, but including the main auditorium and the royal box (DON'T sit in the King's Chair, please). Even if, like me, you're not an opera fan, the history, architecture and atmosphere of the place are all interesting and the guides offer fascinating insights and anecdotes. There's an optional mini concert (at additional cost) for those who wish and unrestricted photography is permitted if you buy a wristband (though this didn't seem to be being strictly enforced on my visit). In addition, there's a well-stocked gift shop plus the elegant Opera Cafe, where I indulged myself with a cafe lungo and a Tonkabab Mousse (essentially chocolate and tastes divine!) for the sum of 1,797 Ft (6.4 2 Euros) and had a pleasant chat with a waiter who spoke excellent English, having worked on cruise liners. It was with some reluctance that I left.
Culture and beauty in one. The Opera House is well worth a visit, whether you are attending a concert or just for photo opportunities. Plenty of good cafés nearby too.

As beautiful as any opera house in Europe at a very affordable price.. I have enjoyed every program I have attended. The singers are world class. I saw Edita Gruberova for a third of the price it cost me in Viena. If you have the chance, see Hunyadi Laslo. Phenomenal! I usually sit in the center orchestra but tha Verdi Requium was available for $5 in the very top so far that I couldn't see the telivision monitors but the acoustics were great and the view of the gorgeous ceiling was worth it. Because I am handicapped they took me up an elevator back stage which in itself an experience . We.had an experience where they double booked one of our seats and my daughter had to view Swan Lake from the back of a box. We went to the box office the next day and they gave us very nice seats for the following evening.. The costumes were wonderful and the performance flawless.I particularly enjoyed the production of Cosi fan Tutti.
Great Tour!. We are professional musicians and thoroughly enjoyed the fine tour of this great opera house. Wish we could have attended the opera, but time was limited here.
beautiful, but expensive. great beautiful palace, but tickets are expensive , and performance itself was just OK; not in par with Metropolitan, Bolshoy or La Scala.

Lovely experiece. We sat in the main hall and watched the ballet Manon. The whole experience was magical.If you don't want to leave your coat at the counter, you may want to bring a non bulky one and a bag to put it in. Otherwise, the staff will insist that you leave it outside.

not to be missed!. the opera house is a really beautiful building and i am sure a tour would be very worthwhile. For £25 each we had the use of a box and went to see a wonderful ballet, Minon. booked the day before. recommended as you then see the Opera House in its full glory and can enjoy a superb performance too

Only been to the hall but it was amazingly beautiful. Wasn't able to visit the all thing as something was going on (a show or sonething) and it was only opened in the afternoon. The little I have seen was so beautiful. I will visit the whole thing soon...

Heart of Andrassy street.. Hungarian State Opera House is the heart of the beautiful Andrassy street. It is surrounded by fancy restaurants/cafes and boutiques. Even if you won't find an opportunity to visit interior of this building, you can't miss a chance to pass by.In winter period, Hungarian State Opera House gets Christmas decorations. During summer, there are open-air live projections of opera house's performances right in front of the building .All in all, it is a very nice place for all seasons!
Perfect to visit if you are in a rush. Great English tour guide made it enjoyable and fun. Great history and architecture. Simply beautiful.
Beautiful. We went to the Opera to the hungarian play Bank Ban and It totally worth It. The Opera is absolutely beautiful, has a very good acoustic and excellent actors.

fabulous opera & architecture for tiny ticket price. If you like opera do not miss this; it's a stunning building ; terrace is lovely to stand out on in the interval and we had a box for a fraction of the price in London - can't wait to go back!
Opera House. What a stunning building - very majestic! I loved the architecture, but particularly by night - it really was lovely.

landmark building. HUNGARIAN STATE OPERA HOUSE ( MAGYAR ALLAMI OPERAHAZ ) is a beautiful ornate building on the fantastic street ANDRÀSSY UTCA and is well worth visiting to just go and see the wonderful ornate entrance and reception. We were on our way to the PUBLIN IRISH PUB on Andrassy utca and this building is the most eyecatching building that you pass on a street with some amazing architecture. Known previously as Hungarian Royal Opera House the building looks elegant and is in an area packed with bar's, pub's and restaurant's. Viewed at night the Opera House looks fantastic when illuminated. A great landmark building and well worth a visit.
Worth visiting. Unfortunately we didn't have time to do the tour, but just the reception area is worth a visit. The area around the Opera House has lots of good quality shops and restaurants.

Stunning building, knowledgable guide, opera performances . We paid for our tour on the day at a very reasonable price, including a mini operatic performance and knowledgable guide. Not a huge enthusiast for Opera, but still found it enjoyable! Stunning setting in a busy street of Budapest for exploring after. Easily accessible.

Beautiful Austro-Hungarian Opera House.. Went to an opera (Wagner's Das Rheingold) back in November. Beautiful venue with great acoustics. If you like opera, you have to check it out since it's architectural beauty is up there with Vienna's opera house but tickets are a lot cheaper. Performance was very entertaining (traditional opera but with a science fiction twist for costuming). There were subtitles in English so you won't get lost if you don't speak German.

Ornate front facade in need of a cleaning. Front of the building is quite ornate but the side facades lack most ornamentation. Definitely in need of a cleaning. Tours in 6 languages are given at 3 & 4 pm. Timing didn't work for us. Yellow Metro stop right in front of Opera House.

Skip the tour, buy a ticket and enjoy the setting!. Incredibly beautiful building and so many inexpensive and good seats available. Even if you are not a fan of ballet or opera, experiencing such an event in these surroundings is magical. You will be transported into a time and place so far from your home that is sheer beauty regardless of which way you cast your gaze.

Old world qualities retained. Going to the a night at the Opera House is always a little treat but this place is steeped in history and so beautifully maintained that it heightened the pleasure of listening to the State Orchestra.
Luxurious. When I first stepped in the opera house ,I can image how luxurious and rich the ancient Hungarian was. The paintings on the roof are stunning and the ambient looks as palace.

A Must See. Breath-taking performanes with heart and perfect technique! The atmosphere in this beautiful buliding adds to the experience and should be part of your To-Do list in Budapest. Sit back and enjoy!

Simply jaw dropping. Inside is every bit as ornate as the outside, nothing has changed since its creation and the decoration is total splendour, sweeping staircases from floor to floor takes you back centuries. Next time I must visit when there is an opera and not just for the guided tour.

Gorgeous Opera House!. Saw the ballet Manon at the Opera House. The theatre is exquisite. We sat in one of the boxes and felt taken back to a different age. If you can't go for a performance, take the tour. The architecture is stunning.

Stunning . Taking time out we pre booked a tour of the State Opera. It is a guided tour by multilingual guides.They was on our tour, English, German, Polish, Italian, to name a few.You can opt for a mini concert aswell with your tour. For a extra fee, and if you want to take photos you will have to purchase photo wrist band.The tour lasts about 40 to 45 mins very informative with both history and facts about the opera. Starting in the main concert hall. We're you can view the amazing wood work quilded with gold leaf.When touring the building you will have to go up and down long flights of stairs. Although know one in our group required assistance I did see a lift. So if required I would ask at time of booking.The mini concert is a five minute soloist at the end of the tour with in the main stair case lobby.Well worth the tour
what a building. well what a building well worth a visit guided tours which last about hour good to pre book , in different languages can even have a mini concert at an extra cost for 5 mins

Wonderful building, inexpensive opera. We didn't bother paying for a tour. The entrance hall is incredible though. We booked tickets with a partial view at 600 Ft (~£1.50) for Bank Ban, the most famous Hungarian opera, and had a fabulous time. You have to enter through the side reception and pay 200 Ft (~50p) for the cloakroom but this was well worth it for an evening in this wonderful venue. We had as much of a wander around as we could during the intervals and got plenty of photos.The show itself was excellent and, though we didn't see as many of the parts of the building as we would have on the tour, for a fraction of the price we got an authentic show and a great night out.

Good but expensive. Worth doing and an interesting tour explaining the history of the Opera House. A bit on the expensive side for a 45 minute tour at 2990 Ft plus extras if you want to take photos and listen to a couple of arias from a soprano. (all told around £10 doing the whole thing). I hate secondary charging! Expected the soprano to sing from the stage but the performance was conducted on the main staircase outside the auditorium. Good to do though as we were there.

wonderfull. To see the magnificent gold decoration is just majestic. The artistic skills employed to produce such work is truly breathtaking. No need to be a opera lover to enjoy a building of this outstanding beauty,
Overlooks the Danube. Beautiful opera house is set back from the river Danube with wide open area in front to add to its appearance . No concert during our stay unfortunately

A beautiful opera house that will transport you back in time. This opera house is magnificent. Instead of going on a tour, I purchased tickets to Manon, a wonderful ballet. My seats were a partial view in the balcony (saw about 70% of the stage) for only $3 USD! During intermission, I took the time to explore the opera house more closely to admire the painted ceilings, and gilded walls.

Serious bling.. We were, sadly, unable to get tickets for a performance during our visit, but did have a look around this fabulous building. One of the most impressively ornate opera houses I have ever seen. The daily tours offer a fascinating look behind the scenes for fans of opera, architecture, history or even those who just love serious bling.

Interesting tour. Here you can take a short tour (about 40 mins I think) in lots of different languages around the opera house. We found it really interesting and enjoyed seeing the royal box, the bar areas and the stage etc. The real showstopper though is the entrance hall, which you can pop in and see for free.

Beautiful opera house, in and out. Lovely coffee place, not cheap.. We went to see Romeo and Juliet, it was performed by the Hungarian ballet. It was a beautiful and most enjoyable 3 hours experience. We got tickets in a very good location, it cost 40 Pound each and was worth every penny. Most of the visitors were locals.The Coffee place is beautifully done, but it's relatively not cheap. A coffee here cost around 3 pounds where else around one pound. For us the experience did matter. It's worth visiting both, seeing a show and having a drink before at the coffee place.
ballet. Beautiful and stunning building in and out. Saw the Ballet Manon from a private box. Visually stunning to look at inside. I would imagine Opera would be good to go and listen to.

Beautiful. Very beautiful building inside out. I highly recommend to book an opera or a ballet there. It is on a smaller side so unless you are booking tickets on the very top, most will afford you good views of the stage.
WOW. Recommend to go watch a ballet. We aren't connaisseurs, but were touched and amazed! What an impressive building also!

A must for all opera fans. Beautiful building inside and out. Came to see "Die Fledermaus" performance. Atmosphere was casual with none of the elevated snob factor of Vienna. Thoroughly enjoyed the experience.

Excellent tour guide. This place is worth seeing and the guided tours are reasonably priced compared to many of the other sites. The tour guide had numerous interesting stories to tell and she was very friendly and knowledgable. I'm not sure if the mini concert is worth it though as it doesn't take place on the stage but on the staircase. Maybe it's different at other times.

Beautiful opera house. Excellent building with metro stop outside. Don't just visit but book to see the opera or ballet. It really is quite cheap. There is a board which has translations above the stage in both English and Hungarian.

Smaller than Vienna's, but more luxurious . The Hungarian Opera house was built around the same time as Vienna's opera house under Austria- Hungarian time. There's a 'friendly ' rivalry going on and Hungarian State Opera was ordered to be built smaller than Vienna one. Not to be defeated, the people of Hungary make sure it is grander and more beautiful than Vienna State Opera and it certainly is.

OUTSTANDING . Came to see Faust. Curtain went up, a guy sat in a wheelchair. Oh dear "a modern production" I thought and was full of disappointment. I couldn't have been more wrong. The music, singers, dancers all top notch. It equals anything seen at Covent Garden. Tickets for stalls cost £7.50!!!! Two glasses of champagne £5.00. Imagine what it would cost at RHO. The building itself magnificent. Ornate guilt and marble well worth a visit. They do daily tours. There are a few stairs to manage to upper floor and bar. Go! It's well worth it.

Beautiful building with interesting insights. Tours are provided in several languages, and English was by far the most popular, so our group was subdivided to provide an optimal experience. The young guide was enthusiastic and interesting. The groups all take different routes, so we could all hear everything. We paid for the optional concert at the end. A tenor in costume sang two songs while we sat on the main staircase - wonderful. After we took coffee & cake in the cafe - very civilized.

A must visit!. Either you like classic music or not, you must visit the Opera House of Budapest. It is a very beautiful building both outside and inside. If you are lucky and an opera is being played, it is a life's experience to watch it. The tickets are not very expensive and you can find availability even at the same day. Otherwise, you can always do the Tour Visit of the Opera ( twice per day and in several languages).

Wonderful evening out for opera newbies. Having never been to the opera before, and unsure whether the husband would like it, I wanted to experience the opera without paying crazy London prices.I booked 2 tickets for approx £15 each to see Tosca at the opera house on their website. It was such amazing value -a beautiful opera house, glamorous evening and a stunning performance. Even the husband said he enjoyed it and would go again!A couple of things to note -get their early to pick up tickets ordered online in advance. You can't take your coat into the auditorium so you need to check this in to the cloakroom. The drinks in the bar are very good value at approx £2 each. The website said that Tosca would be sung in Italian and have Hungarian subtitles. We swotted up the day before on the storyline but they actually had subtitles in English too which made it all a lot more understandable!
Beautiful. A must visit.. We went to the ballet which was wonderful, but even if you don't want to do this, the building is worth a visit. It really is magnificent.
Opera house . A beautiful building, go inside and enjoy the beautiful ceilings and floors. Breath in the atmosphere.
A piece of art. I totally regret that i did not attend an opera performance there. The building in nicely decorated and their boutique has nice gift options.

On the Main Street. You will certainly visit Andrassy ut. when you are there, go to the Opera, absolutely beautiful. There is a small pasta kiosk off to the right, amazing pasta and well worth the visit!
Don't do tour..... Plan ahead and go to a performance. Don't do the overpriced tour. The building is beautiful even if opera is not your thing.
Stunning. I recommend the guided visit to the opera. The building is stunning, very linked to the history of the city, and the guided tour is cheap and worthwhile.

What a beauty!. This building is just stunning! Such beautiful architecture and everything very well preserved - at least inside. We didn't attend the tours, since tickets for a performance were way cheaper. Suggestion for all: get a cheap ticket for a performance, you won't regret it!

One of the best things about Budapest. We followed the advice from trip advisor and turned up to buy cheap tickets for the opera a couple of days later. It was roughly £5 per ticket.The building was stunning and such a lovely place to be in.When we arrived we went to put our coats in the cloakroom and they upgraded our seats for free! We had these lovely seats very near the front. The performance was Faust and it was amazing. I have never experienced opera before and this was definitely one of the highlights of the trip.Brilliant!

Best experience ever!. This is a must go place! If you are debating whether you should take a tour of the opera house or see an actual venue, definitely go for the latter. We saw Romeo and Juliet (ballet version) , there was no language obviously but you could understand everything from watching it and hearing the orchestra. The performance of the ballet dancers were amazing likewise was the orchestra.We had our own box which was very special compared to an ordinary theater or anything we have been before. Also the bar area is really nicely done out, and prices aren't crazy expensive as well. This place is perfect at night time entertainment for anyone who visits Budapest, everything about it is absolutely amazing.
Good. Quite good, nice people, the only problem is that people who work there dont speak english, so its difficult to help you. I watched faust and i was quite satisfied
Worth seeing the ballet here. We had a box and it was very reasonable to see the ballet here. Great evening - very cheap snacks/drink at the bar too

Stunning venue. We were told this building was beautiful and we were not disappointed. We attended a concert by the Budapest Philharmonic which was excellent and inexpensive (especially compared to the UK). The venue is so ornate, the acoustics great and it felt very intimate. Would recommend experiencing an evening here rather than doing a tour, soak up the atmosphere!

absolutely stunning. I was only able to get in as far as the lobby and gift shop, but was allowed to peek inside and take some pictures. The opera house is so beautiful. There was nothing on the schedule for the week I was in Budapest so cannot tell you about acoustics. It is certainly worth a visit. .

Beautiful and cheap tickets possible. A tour is 15 euro's, visiting a 4 hour opera can be as cheap as 1 euro. I highly recommend visiting an opera, often not all the seats are taken, so you can move to a better spot and have a great view! The building is great and 'Faust' was definitely worth the watch!

Impeccably beautiful opera house . We went to an opera "Faust" (a mediocre contemporary over-sexualised interpretation) and had a nice chance to explore not only the production and architecture, but also a nice acoustic quality. This house was located just next to our base.

Great historical building and loooong opera. Figured we'd see a our first opera while we were in Budapest. There was only one playing while we were in town--Faust. They said in the description that it was a modern take on this classic and they weren't kidding. The opera house itself was beautiful, the seats were a bit hard for a four hour show. ;o)

Spectacular. We came to Budapest at New Year and saw not one, but two operas! La Bohème and Die Fladermaus. A highlight of the trip. Incredible sets and beautiful décor throughout the opera. The cost of seating is very reasonable and we were able to book our own opera box one night and seats in the stalls for the other. For a similar price in London, we are used to sitting far up and out of the way, so we felt truly spoiled in Budapest! The Opera café also does some good cake/hot food, worth going to before the opera begins.

Beautiful building inside but tour far too expensive!. This is a stunning building (maybe not so much from the outside) but the tour was far too expensive in my opinion, just to look around a theatre. Also the queuing system was chaotic with no real order.

Seriously, this is opuelence at its best. What a beautiful and stunning building. We were part of a tour and had the privilege of seeing this building at its glorious best. If you are in Budapest a must see

An unexpected positive outcome!. High-classed, high quality settings made it's uniquely placed in the heart of the beautiful city of Budapest. First class seating arrangements, with the best furnishings for outstanding acoustics. One of the largest stages ever built that you can watch two different performances watched on the same day. Culture for every generation at it's finest. The guides were professional in every language. Worth a visit before attending a performance. In the intervals the external view is outstanding.
A must see. Amazing décor, great tour very informative and amusing tour guide pay extra and listen to the opera singer at the end of tour its worthwhile.

Spectacular Inside and Out. The Hungarian State Opera House tours don't happen many times throughout the day or week, but they are definitely something you need to plan ahead and make time for. This building is beautiful and ornate inside and out.When you book your tour, you have an option of a tour including an opera performance at the end, or one without. We did this very last minute, so our tour didn't have an opera performance, but the tour alone was well worth the cost of admission. Make sure to let the ticket people know if you want to take pictures, because it costs extra to take pictures, and you will need a wristband so that the tour guide and workers know you are allowed to take photos.The Opera House is one of the buildings in Budapest that wasn't extensively damaged during World War II, so a lot of what you see is either restored or somewhat original to when the building was originally built. It is spectacular both inside and out. You could walk through dozens of times and always see something new. The history of the building is pretty crazy, too, which you will learn about during the tour. You can also hear about Madonna being a diva in the royal box. Some people might tell you to pass on this tour, but if you love art, architecture and history and truly want to learn more about Budapest and the history of Hungary, this is a must-do. It's a great way to spend an hour, and you'll see things you can't see anywhere else in the world.
Superb. On a par with Vienese opera house all gilt and red. Slendid throughout, a must just to see. We had an excellent view from a box right next to one of the bars.
Amazing!. Beautiful building and worth a visit behind the scenes with a mini concert to follow - you won't be disappointed

If you go on the tour include the mini concert.. There are tours every day in several languages. This is well worth it. A wonderful opulent building designed by Myklos Ybi , technically excellent with an enormously deep stage so large scale productions can be staged.Went on the 2 hour tour and payed a few florints extra for a mini concert of arias on the Grand staircase. A really enjoyable informative visit. Will definitely go to a performance next time we are in Budapest.

Try and book an Opera performance. We had booked to visit the Opera on our final night in Budapest. Fantastic value for money for a live performance. We went to see a performance of Faust and chose seats in one of the boxes. This is a real experience even of you are not a great fan of opera. The whole evening was amazing from start to finish. The actual Opera house is jaw dropping such is the sumptuous interior - gold everywhere. We also did the guided tour on the previous day. Very informative but only about 40 minutes and quite expensive. Nevertheless was worth doing.Book well in advance.

Not Home, But It's Much. It's ornate, and interesting as a symbol of another era. The tour we took ended with a so,oust singing in the lobby while champagne was served. It was all pleasant enough, but not a must do attraction.
Amazing building. Booked the tour (roughly 40mins) and the concert (about 5mins). Very knowledgeable guide and an amazing building. Well worth the visit.
Nice to see. If you like opera it will be very interesting.it was OK for me.you paid extra to hear a lady singing opera 2 songs sung.it was very busy and very time orientated.

A Beautiful Building That Sings !. Not too sure on the age of the Opera House but a fabulous looking building set back from the Andrassy Avenue and on our visit way too early to see inside. But had to stop and look on our traverse of the Andrassy !!

Beautiful architecture. We went to a show at 6pm called Faust, got decent seats in the stalls row 17. The seats would have been perfect but we ended up sitting behind a couple that had neck twitches and kept moving their heads. So maybe spend that bit extra and get a booth that's a little bit higher up. The building itself is beautiful, they also have a cloak room, 200 Ft. There were 2 intermissions each one lasts 30 mins. We couldn't find the bar at the first intermission but found it at the 2nd one. Just save yourself time and ask someone. The drinks were pretty pricey and they also served small pastries. The show did have subtitles and it doesn't distract you from the performance too much. The actors and actresses were all great too, they all had great voices. The show ended at 9.45pm which is pretty late if you haven't had dinner beforehand. There is a resturant outside to the immediate right if you do want to grab a bite after, but again very pricey.
Only saw from outside. The architecture of the building is very nice. Unfortunately I didn't catch an opera to see how the acoustics etc work .
Nice experience. I had a few opportunities to see the place, I really recommend, the place is beautiful and the affordable
“Wow!”. I'd say this was one of the highlights of our trip, it is a truly beautiful building and has fascinating history.

Excellent Piece of Architecture - Great Historical Value - Very Ornate. Each large City and Town in Europe have an Opera House - (essentially a theater; BUT with Balconies and Ground level sitting too); BUT the Budapest Opera House is one of the Most beautiful of European Opera Houses. Would recommend guided tour is you are interested in details. Centrally ocated in Budapest, near the strat of Hop On- Hop Off bus routes.
Ornate and Opulent. We did the guided tour and added on the additional aria concert (5mins) at the end which was worthwhile. A fabulous venue that is well worth the visit

visit to the opera house. it was a good opputunity to visit the opera house when taking there visiting friends, although passing by it quite frequently, and been there once before. we (group of 4 people) joined the hungarian group, so our group was 5, including the guide :)
An amazing opera house. An amazing opera house, recently restored to its former splendor. daily visits in several languages are provided daily.
My favorite operahaz. Every time when I come to Hungary I visit Opera. Very beautiful insid. I like small rooms at the balconi.
Wow!. We saw The Nutcracker here. The seats are very affordable. The performance was spellbinding. And the interior of the building is just beautiful. Such a special evening!

Glamorous step back in time. We saw Faust, which was done with a modern twist, and we found it very odd. We got super discounted student tickets just by going in and purchasing at the box office (about 2 euros for 2 tickets). In our assigned seats we literally could not see the stage. So, right before the show began, we nabbed some open seats with an amazing view. Before the show and between acts we spent our time admiring the interior of the building. It's absolutely gorgeous and evokes a feeling of going back in time. So, even if you are not an opera fan, I would recommend getting a cheap ticket and just going to check out the building and hear some musical talent as you do.

A great evening at a performance of La Boheme. The opera house is quite compact. Stunning interior evoking a bygone age. Incredibly good value for money compared to other capital cities. A great evening. Highly recommendedNote the cloakroom seems to be compulsory (at least in Winter)
A Temple of Art. Although it is a copy of Vienna Opera House, this wonderful building is a masterpiece. The statues and all the decorations are amazing. The Royal Box is breath taking.

The state Opera House is a stunning building. A guided tour of the State Opera house is well worthwhile. The interior is very ornate with a beautiful sweeping staircase, gilded vaulted ceilings and beautiful murals.

As they say, its bigger than Vienna's. Im not really into opera house and i havent been in an opera or ballet performace so i am looking forward to experience on ein the future and hopefully i could go back to this place to explore more.

Beautiful. We went to see Lear...we didnt enjoy it BUT it was well worth paying 1500Ft for a ticket (and in the end we arrived early so had better tickets given for free instead) just to see the inside of this stunning building!
A lovely building.. An important building in the Arts World in Budapest. On all the hop on hop off tours of the city. Worth a look inside.
the bat-Strauss at 1st day of the year. extraordinary experience!worth to visit the opera house!wonderful atmosphere in a classical and historical building!

Movie scene in real. Our local guide and friend told us that it is the most favourite building of the hollywod film makers. Several movies were shot in here. We watched the appropriate scenes and were told the story to them. Additionally the building is a must. History lovers, architectural fans...dont hesitate to visit!

Totally worth it. To all you Sissi fans out there! this is the stop for you! A beautiful building with great guided tours where you can see the opera house and learn all about its history. Even get to stand inside the box where Sissi sat while she watched the operas! great tour

Bargain night of quality opera. I went to see Puccini's Tosca and was able to get a pretty good seat on the front of the balcony for around 5000 HUF which is about €16. I was actually surprised by how quiet the upper tier was, however I guess it was so cheap a lot of couples were opting for boxes. Although not advertised the subtitles were in English as well as Hungarian (not that it matters greatly as the plot is fairly obvious in most cases!). The lead performers blew me away with the quality and shear volume of their voices and with two breaks it was an easily manageable time period (shorter than some films) despite opera's reputation for being epic. When the main theme surfaced for the first time it sent a shiver down my spine and gave me goose bumps. Building is also very spectacular and worth the ticket price alone (albeit not quite as good as Vienna).Make sure you bring change for the cloakroom as they don't like letting people in with bags and dress smart.

Stunning Building. We booked tickets for Romeo and Juliette from the Uk before coming to Budapest. At about 40 pounds per ticket, we were not expecting much. We were so wrong! We were in a box, completely surrounded by gold statues and red velvet upholstery. We were perfectly positioned in the front row of the box. One thing I would say, is the people in back of us couldn't see very well, as there is no incline to the seats. If you are going to book in a box, try to book the front seats, it is absolutely worth every penny!

Take the tour and add the mini concert for a great added touch.. We took this tour because my sis-in-law sings opera. The tour was very well done- they split up a large amount of people into smaller groups based on language, with English by far being the largest group. They also split the English crowd into 2 smaller groups, which made it easy to navigate and hear the guides. The opera house itself is beautiful inside, and we learned a lot about the history of the building and its construction. We chose to add the mini concert after the tour and we were not disappointed. The female singer was amazing and very comfortable singing to a large group on the main staircase in close quarters. Very well done!

To be respectful of-----. We love Budapest. No doubt. But entering the Hungarian State Opera House is to be more respectful of than ever. The Hungarian State Opera House has one of the best acoustics ever in an operahouse world wide. By the main entrance among others is a statue of Franz Liszt.This operahouse is worth a travel to Budapest if you are a lover of Opera and Ballet.

Amazing. As our hotel was near the Opera House we thought we would pop in and have a look, then we found we could book a tour and an Opera Taster.The building itself is amazing, loads of history and our guide was very knowledgeable and very interesting.Its true to say I have never seen the draw to Operas, but may I say having the taster has totally converted me. The lady came from know where with this most amazing voice, infact the hairs on your arms stood up, I am now totally converted and need to book a full length one.This is well worth a visit

Amazing. We had tickets to see the Rheingold and it was an amazing and sort of modern operetta. The opera house is very beautiful and an experience in it self. This is a must-do-activity when in Budapest!
Very impressive. We wanted to visit the opera house and decided to kill two birds with one stone and watched the Tosca opera. It is amazing and really worth a tour.
wow, what a building. try to take a tour through the building while in Budapest, but even if you only make it to the foyer: it is worth looking inside the building!
Incredible ceilings. Another must-see when you visit. The tour is interesting, but attend an event to get the real thrill of the venue.

The place for a romantic evening!. While we were in Budapest we were lucky we could purchase one of the last available tickets for the ballet Romeo & Julia (11.000 HUF/ticket).For this price we had a very good view of the stage, we really enjoyed the experience.One advice: arrive about 30 minutes before the show starts, you'll have enough time to enjoy the architecture an you'll be able to roam the building to take pictures!

We did the tour..with the singer..... Unfortunately nothing on we liked at the Opera House when we were in Budapest(Lear is a touch heavy!) so we did the tour. Beautiful opera house, very informative tour but not too much. We paid the extra for the singer at the end and she did two songs and was wonderful. We just loved this tour.

Go to the opera, it's excellent here. Budapest has some of the best opera own the world. And this intimate opera house is really beautiful inside. Even if you are not a big fan of Opera you should take to the time to attend one here...you won't regret it.
Romeo an juliet. Perfect. Perfect . PerfectIf youre in budapest youve must enjoy the opera show. Big . Pay for the best places its worth it.....
Beautiful Opera House. Lovely opera house and well worth the time to visit. Better yet, if you are in Budapest for opera season get a ticket and attend.
Great tour.. Very beautiful building and rooms, really worth seeing. The tour is very informative and has a short presentation at the end. The street around is good for shopping.
Wonderful building, great music. Great architecture and high quality performances in the Opera. Reserve a cheap seat on the top- great sight even when its a little far.
Nice tour an mini concert . I enjoyed the interesting your an then afterwards an opera singer sings a couple of songs , very pleasant, the paintings an history is very interesting

Nice building. Nice historical building with a great architecture. Worth
Visiting when in Budapest. Even better if viewed opera indoors.

Nice visit. Nice place, interior is sweet for a small opera house. Opera (Falstaff) a little boating, voices nice... Good for educational purposes.
.

Beautiful place and great opera. We visited the opera house and decide to go for 2 euro tickets to see Falstaff (sound only, no view of stage) on the basis we could experience a bit of opera, and also see the beautiful auditorium. It turned out very well, as when we arrived on the evening we were told there were free upgrades available, and were allocated our own private box! Interval drinks prices were very reasonable, approximately £2 for a decent sized glass of wine.In terms of dress code for the opera- many people were dressed up (ties/suits for men seemed to be a must). We felt very underdressed in jeans, however there was no objections from any of the staff, nor did any of the other attendees seem to notice.

Golden treasure . We did the guided tour and was very happy that we had. The opera house is a golden treasure. The artwork on every wall ceiling is beautiful and the auditorium a golden array. The tour guide was very informative and we got to see parts that we would not have seen if we had gone to a performance . If you are visiting Budapest you really should make the effort and visit .

A must see. As someone who is not into opera we came across this by chance while sightseeing and decided to take the mini tour with mini opera at the end (a lady sings on the stairs at the end) I can honestly say I was blown away by this place and found it really interesting. The singing at the end was unreal I've never experienced anything like it the acoustics were unbelievable. We wished we could have seen an opera while we were there. If I ever visit Budapest again I would book up way in advance.

Take the tour!. This was a unexpected surprise, which we visited because we had some time left.We took the tour inside the opera, which was very informative and we learned a lot about the rich history.The opera was as beautiful at the inside as the outside. Afterwards, we regretted that we didn't bought tickets for the ballet. Tip: buy your tickets for the ballet online and at time, because the shows are sold out quit often.
guided tour. fab way to see the opera hoise interior if you dont get to go to an opera. It is a stunning building and our english speaking guide was very informative.

Architecture. We went for an afternoon tour of the Opera house. Our guide was very knowledgeable and explained the history of the building, the architecture very well. It was informative. The building is located right in front of the Opera metro stop, very easily accessible.We couldn't appreciate the mini concert that accompanied the tour, may be because of the lesser duration of the performance (and in a language we didn't understand :().

Get the right show. I remembered why, after my first opera, I said I would not go again. Anyway. We were there for Falstaff. We managed to get the last two tickets. Lucky us. Anyway, quite a magnificent building, served by the quaint Metro 1 line. Worth going for the experience. The architecture is splendid. I wish we'd got an opera with more tunes in it.
Beautiful. It's a beautiful building. They offered many performances during our visit. The lobby is gorgeous with marbles and arches.

if you are lucky you can find sits and a good opera. We ordered the tickets to the opera in advance (before arriving the country) and it was a great idea. the state opera is marvelous and so was the opera.

Fab experience. Did the tour cost about £7 and then a little extra for a mini concert, which turn out to be s singer doing a solo on the staircase. But the tour was great, and informative. Love it so much that we then came back and got tickets for the Hungarian philamonic orchestra that night only cost £20 each and had great seats.....well worth it a fabulous night and a lovely experience

Stunning, highly recommend the tour. . We paid in to the opera tour and got a wristband to allow us entry. They have tours in many different languages and if the group is quite large the split you into smaller groups. They tell you all about the opera and the history behind it and you see all of the stunning pieces of art through golden filagree, sculptures, designs on the tapestries and paintings in the ceilings and walls. The interesting thing about this tour that we found quite funny is that they tell you that the opera was only allowed to be build using Hungarian people and materials but you will see that doesn't necessarily seem true but maybe back in the day they believed so. It is still beautiful and worth while to visit. They do student discount and discount if you have your Budapest card. They also have stunning Hungarian chandeliers. They're really beautiful.

Wonderfully historic building...... I took the tour of the building in English and also went to a performance of Madame Butterfly in the evening. Gorgeous building with the main theatre being all you would imagine. There is a nearby underground station 'Opera' (surprisingly enough!) so travelling to this is very easy. The tours are very busy and there a number held in different languages throughout the day. You have the option of a short performance after the tour and this doesn't take place in the main theatre but instead on the main staircase. The singing is impressive and I'm glad I paid the extra for this. Also worth seeing a performance there if you can.

Hungarian Splendor at its best. Yes a very grand Theatre with lots of interesting things to see, excellent guide Emma, the mini opera was good but should have used the acoustics of the main auditorium.

Bad view and non-alcoholic beer. Booked tickets for Falstaff for my partners birthday. The opera itself was very good and the building was very impressive. However our view was impaired - was not informed of this when booking! Also at the interval, we ordered a beer and a glass of wine, and the beer turned out to be non-alcoholic! Not impressed!!
opera house. To be fair , i didn't go inside this building , i just passed it , but as opera houses go , its absolutely splendid and it sits proudly on a street with some beautiful buildings .
Amazing!. Really nice. Went to see Romeo and Juliet. The show started a bit later than scheduled but nothing unbearable. The venue is classic and quiet. Nice for great pictures
Beautiful Building . We nipped in to see what shows they had on. The building is absolutely gorgeous. Even if you have no interest in Opera, I would recommend just going to have a look!
Great Opera. The Opera House is well decorated with a good inside atmosphere. The inside drawings, monuments and decoration is fantastic.
Wonderful old building. Book a performance in advance, a must do visit when in Budapest, building is stunning internally. Ballet was superb
very modern script writers. not too big, pretty historic opera house, in pink colours, too modern script writers. tried to understand but it was too modern. nice decorations and costumes.

Beautiful . Beautiful building. Entry fee was a little steep, however it was worthwhile to see such a nice building and it was worth paying for the mini performance at the end of the guided tour. The singer was very talented and it really completed the tour.
Amazing!. We watched The Bat. The building is magical. The orchestra was fabulous. Highly recommended to all visitors to complete the trip with a perfect final.
beautiful place. It is a beautiful building and a great guided tour with all the legends and stories, and at the end a small taste of Opera performance.

Don't miss out on one of the most beautiful buildings in town!. When in Budapest, the beautiful State Opera house on the Andrássy út is a must see. If you are not an opera lover, you can just step in for a minute and admire the marble staircases and the opulent golden decoration. There are also daily tours to visit the building but of course the real thing is when you attend an opera or ballet performance. We went to “the Bat” by Johann Strauss on December 31st, in Hungary it’s a kind of tradition on new year’s eve. Because of the subtitles projected on the stage, everybody can follow the story easily, even if you don’t know the piece. The quality of the performance was really good, we had a great evening out. During the intermission I would also recommend having a sip of bubbles at the lovely champagne bar, just to make the experience complete. The anecdote goes that when the city council decided to build the opera house, the emperor of the Austro-Hungarian Empire Franz-Joseph needed to grant permission. He did, but under the firm condition that this new opera theatre in Budapest was not allowed to be larger than that in Vienna. Years later in 1884, when the emperor came to Budapest to attend the opening performance he viewed the interior for a while and then suddenly turned to his Hungarian entourage and exclaimed: “Gentlemen, I regret I only mentioned size and not about being more beautiful!”.
Beautiful Opera House!!! I want to come back.. Lovely old Opera House, we saw LaBoheme and it was better than the production at the Met in NYC. If you like opera you won't be disappointed.
