Gorgeous Building. We did not go inside as I could nto convince my partner to go and see the Hungarian Royal Ballet, however, the building itself is very pretty and the markets outside were lovely.

Very beautiful!. This amazing Opera House has great historical features, and story! We took a full tour around with an excellent tour guide (venue provided as we arrived), and they were very pleasant and made it fun! Well done :)

Mesmorizing. We saw the White Swan inthe Opera house that was painted with murals framed in gold. The 3 story building had the suites on the sides in gold and you wondered who the one man was in one and conjectured it had to be the director with his glaring stare that he could not take off of the ballet. The ballet was like a dream and I do not go to ballets. Life is about memories and this is one of my favorites

What an experience... Was there on 24th of december to watch the Nutcracker ballet.It was outstanding what
a show what a place like a fairy tale.

Must experience in Budapest. With one of the most beautiful buildings in Europe and ticket price equal to cinema in other cities, Budapest Opera is a must go destination. Difficult to park on the streets around , so better take a cab or use the nearby parking.

Beautiful building and architecture. We went to the State Opera to see the Nutcracker. The building is stunning and well maintained. just if you buy tickets on line make sure of the numbers. We were 3 people and sat in 3 different boxes. try and buy the middle boxes and not the side as it is very obstructed. But all in all a stunning experience

Fabulous building an absolute "must see". Either a sight visit within the wonderful historical walls of Opera or attending a classic opera with great Hungarian and foreign opera singers, I'm sure you'll be spellbound by its atmosphere and fascinating surroundings. Do not hesitate to visit when you are coming to Budapest.

Amazing night at the opera. Great night at THE BAT. Amazing building both outside and in particular inside. Super seats which we booked last minute. You feel very regal in a wonderful theatre/opera space. A must to visit.

opera haz. nice place this , great interior , nice bar & cafe , really good shows that have an L.E.D display that translates an opera into Hungarian , possibly to distract you from the live action , music , or just to annoy . it's very cheap so there's sure to be alot of riff-raff in there , so if you reckon yourself better than others it's best to avoid it , you might be sitting next to someone like me . Last October A talented street artist painted the sphinx statue outside the opera haz blue & gave her yellow norks , A nice touch that was frowned upon by the local government , quickly covered over & then jet washed . . a good cheap night out , with tickets as low as a couple of nicker ,with a chance for some high jinx & general buffoonery to really annoy the art types TRYING TO WATCH THE SHOW

A must-do in Budapest. This opera house is insanely beautiful. I took my girlfriend here as part of a surprise getaway and watching Der Fledermaus at the Opera was one of the highlights of the trip. We had decent seats but I'd suggest booking front row seats if you opt for a box.

Very grand. We went to see a ballet here 6 years ago and on this trip we went to see an Opera. Fabulous ! You can enjoy dinner or a drink in the cafe, located downstairs, and they will take orders for drinks during the intervals and have them ready for you.
Another building with a stunning interior. Not sure what was best, the building or the state operas presentation of Die Fledermaus. Both of which were amazing

It worths a visit. The opera house makes you feel that you live in another century. Great decoration not only at the main concert hall but everywhere you would turn your head. Take a guided tour or ever you can attend a concert

La Bohiem. Splendid opera house and stunning performance. I absolutely loved this place. The gilt work and artistic paintings on the ceilings, spent most of the pre performance looking up and then looking down at the orchestra. We sat in obscured seats so next time would pay for better ones (use thier website direct) it was nearly sold out for a Sunday morning performance a month in advance! The top floor bar was open and friendly but with old school elegance of marble and artwork. The company doing our performance were fantastic, great sets, voices and operatic acting. I loved how passionate they got about singing about everyday things in this production. Go to the loo before coming as there were long ques pre, post and at the interval.

first visit ever to an opera!. In UK tickets to opera are eye wateringly expensive, this wasn't! . Easy purchase online, subtitled, in English and Hungarian. BEAUTIFUL BUILDING, quick service at half time drinks, take out onto the balcony to look out over avenue. metro stop immediately outside, in itself worth going to, tiled, wooden panelled platform.

Wonderfully opulent!. Visiting Budapest for Xmas, I had pre-booked front row box tickets to see the Nutcracker on Xmas eve.My son (17) had bought a new suit for this trip and was concerned he would feel too smart but everyone had dressed up, lovely to see.Stunning! What a building, so opulent. Great photo opportunity but bear in mind you are not allowed to take photos during the performance. Not huge fans of ballet generally, we felt this would be a good one to see, it was, we were captivated.Downside- not very organised during the interval ( maybe just due to time of year), we saw the long queues and went outside, on the right as you exit is a smart bar, we popped in there. A lovely glass of champagne for me (pricey though) we returned relaxed and in time for the second act.Even if you don't want to see a performance, it is well worth a visit to seethe interior of this magnificant building.
Stunning inside. This building is stunning inside and well worth the entrance fee. The tour takes about 45 mins with an optional 5 min opera performance at the end.

Most impressive. We watched at the Opera House the ballet "The Nutcracker". There are no words to describe the grandeur and excitement from the show then we did their guided tour and it was very interesting. Opera House is recommended as a must.

Most disappointing day of my life. I planned a wonderful trip to Hungary for my sister's 50th birthday, based around taking her to the opera. I paid for the best seats several months in advance through Eurpoera but when the tickets arrived they were at the back on the side in the third price section. On top we had been charged 4 times the face value! I pleaded with them and with the Opera House directly to be given the seats I had paid for but got no response from the opera house and a partial refund from Europera eventually. I felt very disappointed having to explain to my sister why I had not got the best seats but we decided to make the best of it. The opera was due to start at 7pm as stated on our confirmation however on arrival we were shocked to find the performance time had been moved forwards to 6pm and we had not been told. We were this denied access to the performance until a suitable break and missed the first act. My husband spoke to the theatre manager who asked us to write to him to sort out some recompense. We did this but received no reply. Having spent a large amount of money making the trip for such a special occasion, no one seemed at all concerned about the distress and the upset it caused. To not have the courtesy to reply is very poor and shows the lack of any level of customer service. I am sure the performance itself was very good but I had no enjoyment whatsoever by the time we were pushed into the seats at the back.

Take the tour!. An exquisite Opera House, with it's own unique history, dark corners, and majestic opulence. If you are not able to enjoy an opera event itself, at least acquaint yourself with it's fine interior by taking a tour.

Saw Die Fledermaus on January 2nd 2016. Great venue, great costumes and great opera. Die Fledermaus did not disappoint. The building is worth a visit alone, but try to get seats to an opera. Reasonable prices (60 US Dollar equivalent) for first 10 rows on the floor.

Opera guided tour. Opera House is a very beautiful place and I recommend to everyone to visit it. The guide provided us with different kind of very interesting information. If you are lucky, your guided tour will contain a mini concert too. :-)

Nutcracker. The ballet was superb, better than any performance of the classic I have ever seen (including the Moscow Ballet company). I was speechless. The Opera House itself is a site to enjoy as well. A lovely example of architecture in Budapest. The organization of lines for coat check and refreshments is lacking. The ushers and bartenders appear to be annoyed having to work . . .
Awesome building. The Hungarian State Opera House is an awesome building. No matter if you look at it from the inside or the outside, it's an outstanding venue to visit.
Professional . The Opera is very professional the price are a bit expensive but are worth each cent which you pay for what you receive the show are very good.
Elegant. A gorgeous, elegant venue. One of the city's most beautiful buildings inside and out. We had the pleasure off attending a wonderful opera; it makes you feel special
Among the greatest opera houses in the world. Don´t miss out on the opportunity to visit this wonderful opera house if you are in Budapest. It can compete with the best opera houses around the world.

Almost like the Vienna Opera house. Emperor Franz Joseph did not allow to build a bigger opera house in Budapest than the Vienese opera, so it is a smaller version of it but very dear to the Hungarians. It is one of the great classical opera houses of Europe even though the singers may not belong to the world top performers. Yet if you are an opera buff you must visit it.
Intimate and interesting . This is a lovely old opera house, nice and small so practically every seat is a good one. Beautiful interior, great acoustics. Dress up, step back in time and have fun.

Even for non opera buffs. A group of six of us ranging in age from 20 to 53 did an afternoon tour on New Years Eve. It is safe to say that every one of us enjoyed it, though none of us have much interest in opera. Our guide spoke perfect English, was full of interesting facts and we got to see lots of very beautiful parts of the Opera House. It is a spectacular building and the history of it was fascinating. As we left the crowds were arriving for that evening's performance of Die Fledermaus, all dressed up in their suits and evening dresses, which added to the grand atmosphere. Would recommend for anyone interested in 19th and 20th century European history.

The best opera house in Austria-Hungary. We visited the Viennese Opera House earlier this year and I must say the one in Budapest is more beautiful, even though according to the original plans of the Emperor it wasn't supposed to be like this. But hey, Sissy also liked Budapest better!There are usually two guided tours a day, but I recommend you check it on their website first, because it changes during some holidays. You can also buy a ticket for the mini concert which lasts about 5 minutes, but for the price of 600 HUF it's definitely worth it. We took the Spanish language tour and the guide was quite competent. She told us many interesting things about the Opera. You have to pay for the photo sticker as well. The cloakroom costs 100 HUF and I think it's not necessary to charge for this. It's optional anyway, so we were the only people who used it.

What an experience!!. I was fortunate enough to see the production of Othello during my stay. The opera was exceptional as is the building itself. When ones compares the cost as opposed to the UK it is really cheap. A real bonus is being able to take your interlude break drink out onto the balcony and watch the world pass bye.

Nutcracker on Christmas Day. Staff is not very good nor helpful (seat guidance nor coat check staff). Seat guidance staff seemed to be late teens or early Twenties and none of them were dressed appropriately (EXTREMELY casual). They did not seem to be able to accept 2€ for a coat check, despite this being 6 times the regular coat check price. Pathetic! Lovely place though.
Nothing special. It is located in the main budapest street and it is reachable by car, on foot or by public transportation. It is nothing special but nice thing for getting a photo.

A must see! . If you are in Budapest you definitely need to visit the Opera! The 40mn guided tour is extremely interesting and the building is gorgeous.
A cloakroom would have been appreciated.

State Opera. What an exquisite building! We were very fortunate to get tickets to La Boheme; absolutely stunning performance! The building itself is majestic and sophisticated and the opera itself was wonderful. I'd definitely recommend a night at the Opera while you are in Budapest!
Very nice. A very nice historical building of Budapest. Nice architecture, of monumental value for the locals. Historical data are ample to find online. Definitely worth a visit!

Amazing opera house with great singers. The building is stunningly beautiful and the Hungarian singers are always very well prepared and perform well each time around. We have seen a wonderful Madam Butterfly performance and a greatly entertaining Die Fledermaus. Last summer we saw a few Wagner operas and the company was never disappointing. If you have time in Budapest, a visit to the opera should be a must. Enjoy!
Lovely experience. Brilliant evening of local culture mixed with the classics! The opera house is a beautiful building and the New Years Day concert was a real treat!
Budapest state operahouse. One of the most beautiful buildings inside and outside in Europe! Magnificent performances and singers. Our personal favourite is the Nutcracker ballet at Christmas time.

Beautiful night at the opera. I had a great time at the opera watching La Boheme. I read some reviews complaining that seats were not comfortable. Although they are not the best, I watched the full opera without problems and everything went well. It's a unique experience to go to such a beautiful place, especially coming from a city where the opera is quite a boring building. Looking forward to come back!

Beautfiul interior. The interior of the Opera House is as beautiful as I expected it to be. The lobby and entrance halls are beautiful and it is worth going early to have a drink at the bar upstairs and soak it up. We were booked in to see a Wagner piece and had booked into a small box. A serious piece of advice I would give is to not book the second row of seats in any box. They are not raised up and the three people in front of us leaned forward effectively creating a wall of shoulders and we could not see a thing! We ended up standing up for most of the three hour performance which was hugely disappointing. We asked to move seats but it was not possible. The boxes are very good value relative to London prices but I urge you to book the front row!

One of the most beautiful buildings I have ever been in. Had booked on recommendation to see the Nutcracker. Best £50 I've ever spent. Truly magical! The show was outstanding and the architecture of the State Opera house was just stunning. Book a show, you won't be disappointed.
Beautiful building. Interesting place to visit I was disappointed no shows were on when I was there but I did the tour and it was short but good

Absolutely beautiful. Well worth spending the entrance fee for this guided tour... really interesting and lots of historical background.
Would recommend visiting the Opera House...

Very unprofessional staff. We bought the tickets for a show at 8, we arrived 5 minutes before and they closed the entrance in front of us. In the confirmation email the instructions said just to print the tickets and not to arrive at least 30/15 minutes before. It was very disappointing.
nutcracker. while in Budapest we went to see the nutcracker it was amazing. what a fab opera house, it was approx. 15 minute walk from where we were staying
Incredible!. Went with a group of friends to see Handel's Messiah. Great performance in a stunning historical Opera House. Some cracking wine on offer as well.

Very nice. You can come in only with organized tour, there is a tour on 3 pm and 4 pm., in the tour you walks around the rooms and having explanation on everything. very intersting and very beautiful.
Superrrr. Building an impressive, full of delights and historical importance, I recommend viewing, because the inside is even better.

The Nutcracker in a Gorgeous Setting. The set decorations and choreography were fantastic! This is not a big-league ballet troupe but that does not take away from it being one of the most enjoyable experiences in Budapest. The venue is stunning and small enough to allow almost every seat a great view of the stage.

Guided tour . We paid for the organised tour and short "concert", the building itself was obviously the star!Our tour felt a little crowded, but this was a drawback of being on the English tour- a lucky German couple more or less ended up with a private guide!Our guide was friendly and pleasant but ultimately to quiet to project to a group of any numbers. Also our mini concert which we paid a supplement for was held on a stairway, where we and a large over 60's tour all sat on variously the floor or steps, where we were treated to two short arias.Also disappointing but amusing depending on your point of view was being informed by our tourguide that it would in fact be potentially cheaper to buy tickets for that nights show than to go on the tour, with the bonus of not being rushed about.

Gorgeous. Got ourselves tickets to Messiah. Gorgeous building and interior. Seats in the boxed seats were crammed and uncomfortable but the acoustics were fantastic. A great experience to be had should you choose to be in the building. I highly recommend it.

One of the most beautiful opera houses. The guided visit allow you to see the main stage of this beautifully decorated opera house, which golden details can be seen from the main entrance and later from the upper floor. The royal sector is incredibly refined with carved wood and gold. I hope to come back there just for listening to a opera (in July there were no sessions).

Beautiful but uncomfortable. Went to see La Boheme this evening. The Opera house itself is magnificent. I might get around to do the tour. However, for a performance, I was in a box and the seats were so uncomfortable, not what I would expect of this Opera House. As to the performance-the orchestra was a tad loud , to the point of drowning out the soloists in quite a number of parts. Beautifully staged. The Singers I woukld say average for a state Opera House.

Great place, kind tour guide. The guided tour def worth it. You can get a discount if you are student. It was a bit annoying when the visit was before a concert and they are tuning the organ on stage. But overall the trip was nice, and the mini concert (like 10 minutes) at the end too

The Nutcracker at the Opera House. Beautiful ballet in a beautiful building. Strange numbering of the seats, but kind staff to help you. Nice to see lots of small dressed-up, well-behaving children among the audience. During the pause the best pretzel I ever had.

Guided visit of the opera , without opera singer. Guided visit ( 1 hour) is worthwhile to learn about all details of the opera.We had choosen the german guide ( less participants than the english one).

Beautiful building!. This is a really great building to visit. We weren't going to a performance but my partner convinced me to do the 45 minute tour and I'm really glad we did! It's absolutely beautiful inside and really interesting to learn more about it's construction and life (plus our guide, Joseph, was very funny). You do have to pay a couple of Euro extra to take photos but I'd recommend you do that because you'll definitely want pictures of this place.

State Opera House tours . Tours are only at 3pm and 4pm. Our English guide was Peter and he was great! Added humor and made it interesting to listen to. I've toured many theaters and he has been in the top guides from my experience. I do wish they would allow more time during the tour when very large groups are there at once so that you're not rushed in certain areas where those of use who paid to take pictures can do so.

Farnace - Great Opera night. We saw a representation of Vivaldi's Farnace, in what's a new creation for the Budapest national opera. The experience was top notch, actually better than what I'm used to in Paris or London. The building is magnificent, the bar area is calmer than in bigger name houses, in an intimate atmosphere, with decent wine and good cakes.The representation was definitely one of the weirdest I've ever seen, but the singing and playing quality impressed me, and being able to see a rather rarely represented Vivaldi Opera with male contralto voices like in the original (whereas these are often replaced with tenors in most opera houses) was an exceptional experience that I'd recommend to anyone.

one of our highlights... We attended a performance of 'The Nutcracker Suite' at the Opera House so we got to experience the delightful internal architecture and décor as audience members. I booked online some months before our trip to Budapest (easy website in English) and our night at the Opera House was one of our highlights.
Totally worth it. My daughter and I saw a magical performance of " The Nutcracker" while we were there and it is simply one of the most stunning theatre's I have visited.

La Boheme - great night. Beautiful building, incredibly helpful ushers and staff. Casual atmosphere (yes, you can wear jeans and still hear great music). They aren't pretentious. They have English subtitles on a big screen for the opera. Super affordable.

Beautiful building. Like so many buildings this is yet another grand one. It is lovely inside, but you are charged to take interior photos and a paying guide tour within the building ends with a short burst of song

One of the best of its kind. The architecture of the opera house is a work of art. The interior is regal and the acoustics are superb. Formal attire is a must for attending a performance here. The bar is packed mostly but service is very efficient at reasonable cost.

A wonderful experience. We attended a performance of La Boheme and had fantastic seats in the stalls with a wonderful view of the stage. We took the opportunity to dress up in evening wear and we're pleased that others did the same as we felt it enhanced the experience for us (a little disappointing that some men were wearing jeans although the website expressly states that jeans are not permitted). We enjoyed a glass of champagne in the bar before the performance at reasonable cost. The performance itself was fantastic. Mimi in particular had an excellent voice. The sets were stunning, particularly the night time scene outside the Inn. There were huge queues in the bar at the intermission, but we still got served. The opera house itself is a little gem with fabulous architecture that quite takes your breath away. A wonderful experience at a very reasonable cost compared with many other opera houses.

Incredible. Ill be honest I didnt pay to have a look around - We looked around outside and then popped inside to only the free reception area. The building is incredible, the architecture is beautiful
great. we went to the opera and saw the ballet of nutcracker, it was a very nice experience. we had a very good time and the show was beautiful

The Nutcracker - Magical theatre and performance. We visited to see the Nutcracker during our 2 night city break in Budapest. Absolutely beautiful theatre - an attraction in itself! We decided on tickets here rather than in Vienna as we had heard that he standard of the ballet is just as high. We felt it wasn't quite but it's just so much cheaper that it's worth it anyway! Magical performance of a classic!
Very..... ...very interesting if you are into cultural and soul feeding things. A journey back in time with quality moments.

Another splendid 19th Century building. It's a grand opera house, with all the trappings of a grand opera house. There's a good tour in several languages.At the end of the tour, there is an optional "mini concert" available for an extra fee - it's just a couple of songs. It takes place in one of the ante-rooms, and is a bit of an anti-climax after seeing the huge auditorium and massive stage.

Surprising. A short trip around a beautiful building, the price for 2 people was £14 and last approx. 40 mins, they are at 3 and 4pm.They have a free cloakroom for jackets. A big surprise at the end was an amazing opera singer.

Small opera, great opera!. Not the biggest opera in Europe, but.. what a beautiful jewel..! Great programm of operas and concerts, full of cultural activities. Animation outside: dancers of "Nutcrackers", for example with week. And you can have a picture with them for free. So nice!

Worth taking the tour. Wonderful guide led us through the building explaining things which would have gone unnoticed otherwise. Nice little two song rendition at the end (although not in the auditorium.
Beautiful. Beautiful and mini concert was a treat. The tour guide was fluent win English. It was one of the most beautiful opera halls I have seen with all the gold leaf and marble everywhere.
Great Venue for an eveing out. Simply a must if you stay in Budapest. Beautiful venue centrally located. We saw La Boheme which was 3 hours long with an interval.

beautiful building and fantastic opera. Saw The Faust here last May and was very, very pleased. The tickets are very affordable. The quality of the set and of the singing was high, comparable to what you would get in the leading European theatres. The space itself is gorgeous, all gold and red. Plenty of food and drink options during the intermission (actually, two intermissions), and several nice restaurants nearby. A lovely experience -highly recommended.

A Wonderful Evening. If you are planning a trip to Budapest for around Christmas time 2016, then I strongly recommend that you check whether the Nutcracker ballet is being performed and if tickets are available. Our tickets were purchased 6 months in advance and we had front row seats for an unforgettable evening. This is a relatively small venue by modern standards and therefore it feels quite intimate and not at all unfriendly or impersonal. Many people were informally dressed and others were in their finery including a couple of gents in cloaks. The interior decor is stunning and perhaps better seen during a stage production than during a daytime tour. There are quite inexpensive glasses of fizz available in the upstairs bar during the interval. Whilst our request to pre-purchase when we arrived, seemed an unusual request, it avoided having to stand in a 6 metre queue.

Just Amazing!!!. I went to see The Nutcracker. The Opera was fantastic!! The decorations were very impressive, they used the 3D system and it worked. I had a place in a box. I would like to say, beware, if you do have a place in a box, you do not need to leave your coat in a cloakroom, you can take your coat with you. If you do which to leave your coat in the cloakroom, it will cost only 200 FT. The team didn't really explain how I could get to my box, but after 5 mins turning around I finally find it. I sat behind 3 people, because I book my sit at the last minutes and I could see 90% of the scene, for a partial view, it was great!!! I will go back again but I will book earlier on the opera.hu website.
Nutcracker Ballet . Beautiful Opera house, beautiful performance! A+++++Last minute tickets, and how lucky were we. A truly marvellous performance
Absolutely worth seeing a performance!. We saw the inside because we attended a performance of the nutcracker. Amazing interior and great performance!

OPERA AT ITS BEST. in the beautiful and historic opera house. It is said that he one of the best acoustics of any Opera House. We booked in advance and got some excellent. What an experience! We saw Cose Fan Tute and is was a magical performance. Even if it wasn't you could not fail to be awed by the surroundings. And one other thing coming to the Opera in Budapest is that it does not cost a kings ransom and is only a fraction of the cost of trying to get a ticket to the Opera in London.

Modern takes on classic operas. You can also visit the Opera House on a guided tour - where they, I know, say a lot more about the history - but the proper visit is to enjoy an opera here. Even if you are sitting high up, you can enjoy the atmosphere and some top performances. Today's productions are more and more modern, but still enjoyable for the more conservative viewer/listener and form an interesting contrast with the romantic, lavishly decorated building.
beautiful architecture. The short guided tour of the opera house ends with two arias being sung by a professional opera singer on the main staircase. This alone was worth the visit.
Excellent Visit. We are not particually Opera Lovers, do not let this put you off The Building and inside are absolutely Fabulous, guided tour by an informative Guide

An Architectural Marvel . You just have to witness the opera in person to really appreciate the detail and craftsmanship of this edifice. Truly remarkable. Visited during Christmas and enjoyed the Nutcracker which was a real treat.

Budapest opera house . Instead of taking the tour, we went to the box office and managed to get tickets for the following day matinee performance of the Opera madame butterfly. They sell last minute tickets that haven't been collected. We had seats in the fourth row and the Opera was excellent. Very moving. And the tickets not expensive at all. We did the same for the ballet the nutcracker suite. Recommended

Great architecture. A very impressive large opera house with a stage so large that apparently only the front half is ever used with the back half used for storage.The guided tour is worth doing and we were treated to a couple of Puccini and Verdi arias by an elaborately dressed soprano in fine voice.

The Nutcracker. We had wanted to visit this building the last couple of times we were in Budapest but never had an opportunity. This time, though, we got tickets to see The Nutcracker so not only did we see the ballet but we were treated to seeing it in this spectacular building. The lobby is typical of a European opera house with grand staircases and lots of marble but once you get in the theatre itself, you can see how ornate it really is. It reminded a bit of the Palais Garnier in Paris but on a smaller scale. The seats, while old, were surprisingly comfortable. The gold decor is breath-taking. If you can't see a performance there, tours are given once a day in the afternoon.

Beautiful. This is a beautiful and grand opera house we attended farnace and it was very entertaining. The opera house is spectacular inside and out and the tickets were very reasonable. It is free to just walk in and see the lobby not sure how much a tour costs but if you have the time see a show

Just getting an initial glance, the Opera House is delightful., but. The real joy of the Opera House is being in the audience for a perfromance of either ballet or opera there. The tickets are keenly sought as the quality is tops and the prices unbelievably low. The recent Nutcracker = confectionary perfection!
Impressive building. Didn't visit the opera unfortunately, but the building itself is a wonderful site. It was set up with decorations etc when we where there, so made for many good photos.
Nicer than in Wien!. WHat a beautiful building!!! Breathtaking! Somehow I like it much more, than I liked the one in Wien, although very similar style

The nutcracker . We booked our tickets the afternoon of our performance and paid 14,400 fts which is roughly £35. Compared to the prices ypu would pay in England this is amazing value! Our seats were in the front section a few rows back, they were great seats! The performance was beautiful. The scenery was so colourful and changed effortlessly. The music was stunning and the dancers were amazing! I would thoroughly recommend this to anyone I'm not a huge ballet fan but I would love to see this again!

Amazing building – perfect Ballet. We saw the Hungarian National Ballet company presenting The Nutcracker. The building is amazing, you can stand out on the terrace to cool down (it was very warm inside, in December) and the prices were very good. Online booking makes it easy to arrange tickets and select you seat but the earlier you book the better. Acoustics were fine and the ballet was flawless. Only issue were the chatty children in the row behind, no matter how many filthy looks and harsh shushes they got, the parents were unable to keep them quiet. Not the Opera house’s fault of course!
World class. We are opera fans. We saw Madama Butterfly last week and it was world class.BRAVO to the Hungarian State Opera
Fabulous building. Large imposing building very ornately decorated, certainly worth a look from the outside even if you do not go inside.

Unforgattable experience. The place is wonderful and the show was amasing. It was dificult to get the ticket to the show, but I finally I got it. I went to see Madame Butterfly, a great history and excellent performance
just from the outside. I didn't enter to this opera house, I just saw it from the outside, the building is really gorgeous.
Great Building and Arhitect. Great Building and Arhitect on the best shoping street of budapest, Andrassy Avenue, ı've liked budapest.

Beautiful christmas ballet show. The place is amazingly beautiful from the inside as well as from the outside.. During christmas time (our visit) it was beautifully decorated.. We bought tickets, quite cheap ones for a great seats.. That was a lovely experience. You might consider not going during the morning shows as you might feel a bit sleepy in the dark while watching the show.
Beautiful Opera. I went for a tour of the opera. It was truly great. my first visit to any opera in world and I was amazed by its beauty.
Beautiful place. Beautiful building which is worth a visit, looks amazing lit up at night. We did a tour in the afternoon which was very good ... the architecture is very impressive.
Wonderfull. One of the most beatifull places ans experiences that I ever had! The opera was ok, but the place and and atmosphere makes you think you are enjoying the 1800 years!

Glows at night, Interesting tour. Fees are required for the tour (English and other languages), photography a 5-minute after-tour concert by an opera singer. All proceeds I assume go to funding of the opera house so I guessed it's okay. Tour led by local guides who provide fascinating tit-bits of the classic building and the rise of opera in Hungary, Building exterior is beautifully lit up after dark. Worth a visit.

Go See A Show!. Shows at the Opera House in Budapest are very affordable and great! There is no reason not to go see a show. Depending on where you want to sit, you can get cheap tickets for as little as 800-1500 huf (3-5 euros). Some seats only have partial or no view of the stage. However, if you buy your tickets online, when choosing your seats it will tell you whether a given seat has a full, partial, or no view, so you can make an educated decision about what you want. As far as the opera house goes, it is very nice and beautiful.
Wonderful. There are guided tours, but the best is to go to an opera here, which compared to the USA or Western Europe is very affordable. Otherwise take the tour.

Beautiful Design!. Only saw the foyer, which was so beautiful with marble columns and vaulted ceilings covered with murals. The style is Renaissance. If in the area, do step in for a photo opportunity, if not for a tour or concert. We did not take the tour or attend a concert so I cannot comment on those.

Cheap price to see a show, unforgettable experience. I had a best experience in Hungarian State Opera house. The interior design is elegant and beautiful, it is spectacular. I have an Opera and ballet show, it is a great place to see a classic opera. The most impressive thing is, the price is really cheap and you would be able to buy a good seat with low price if you are luck to ask the ticket office.Must visit.

Tour of Opera House Worth the Time.. Instead of shopping with the other members of our group I went to the Opera House and took the tour which was very interesting. The building is beautiful and the painted ceilings etc worth seeing. The staff at the desk were very helpful. Really enjoyed this.

A must to visit in Budapest. My first time in Budapest at Hungarian State Opera House was so really nice. I’ll definitely come back again and I won’t miss a chance attending a concert over here, just once in a life time.

Incredible experience and cheap too. This was a birthday treat and it didn't disappoint. I love that "culture" here is part of life and the prices are achievable for everyone. Prices start at 600 HUFs (between £1-2!) the architecture is beautiful inside, the ceilings glorious, the bar is great and does lovely little nibbles, cakes and all sorts for the break. We had a beautiful little box which wasn't expensive but so lovely. Wasnt sure which seat to sit in as the seats were loose in the box, at half time a couple came and sat in the seats next to us in front of the other people in the box although they did ask permission so not sure what that was about. I guess about 4-6 can fit in a box although we didnt ask for a box, that is just how it is laid out. We saw Andrea Chenier with La Mamma Morta which was glorious. Such a great atmosphere and beautiful place. I felt like royalty and we only had cheapish seats (apprx £18 pp). People wear smart casual/nice wear at the opera. We went to a morning showing which was perfect, about 11am start. One thing at the end of the first half people start cheering and do curtain calls so we were a bit confused but maybe thats normal here!

Get the tour with the mini concert. We were not able to see a show, but we purchased the tour of the opera house and we paid a little extra for the mini concert at the end. The tour was worth it, the opera house is stunning on the interior, the tour guide info was a little boring, but the visuals were worth it. My faypart was the mini co yay the end - definitely buy that.
Beautiful building. On the main boulevard to Hero Square. There plenty of other superb buildings too on the boulevard. Never had time to see the Opera here but I could imagine it to be superb...

Went to see the xmas ballet and loved it. Eastern Europeans do Opera Houses well. The Hungarian State Opera House was built with the one rule that it shouldn't be bigger than the one in Vienna. Legend has it that Franz Joseph was very disappointed to find that he should have added some rules and found an opera house even more beautiful than his beloved one had been constructed.The side balcony seats are terribly for visibility of stage but incredibly cheap if just going for the experience and you don't mind craning.The rest of the theatre is still reasonably priced and utterly beautiful. Worth booking a show when you're in town.

Magnificent.. We were in Budapest and a visit to the Opera House to see Madam Butterfly was on the agenda .The opera was first class but the Opera House itself was simply mind blowing.The splendour of this magnificent building is breathtaking. The seats may not have been the most comfortable but the architecture is stunning. A must see for anyone visiting Budapest.

Amazing building. This building is really beautiful.we were not lucky enough to get the seats we wanted for the Opera so we took the tour.It was interesting, but the "mini concert" felt like a tourist trap, while sitting on the stairs or standing in the hall
impressive place. we took a guided tour, the place amazing. and the tour was very informative.at the and of the tour we saw a mini concert which was on the enterance stairs and it was very impressive

Impressive structure. Andrassy Ut (a main boulevard in Budapest) is full of impressive architecture but some buildings stand out from others.The Opera House is one such building. The exterior is most fitting for the artistry that is within. Given the history of this country (Nazi and Communist occupation) it is a wonder that this building is in the great condition that we see today. Even if you do not appreciate opera, you will surely appreciate seeing the building.....be sure to check it out when in the area.

One of the most beautyfull Opera houses of the world. Recommend to visit it when going to an opera performance. But also there are guided tours available. If you go to see an opera please dress up accordingly!! Black tie recommended!

Great historical and cultural place. Opera House is located in the city center.It has own history.It is beautiful inside.You may take a tour inside with some fee.You may buy the tickets for performance.Both will be enjoyable.
Landmark. Beautiful opera building located along the very agreeable Andrassy Avenue. Free visits of the Opera are available.

A fabulous venue !. We experienced a wonderful evening with a performance of Madame Butterfly. The venue is stunning, the performance was superb and the experience was a fantastic birthday present for my partner. We both had a fabulous evening and would thoroughly recommend the evening. If you are in Budapest then don't miss out on the opportunity to enjoy architecture and culture in a truly stunning venue.
Impressive building!. An impressive building along the Andrassy avenue. You may be able to get a ticket for one of the performances.

Beautiful Building with Amazing Performances. I simply loved the opera I saw. The building itself is breathtakingly beautiful, both the orchestra and the artists were amazing.There is a digital board for subtitles both in English and Hungarian in case someone (like me) does not know the whole opera by heart. I had two negative experiences though: in the cloakroom I was asked for 200 HUF although it was compulsory to use. Honestly, I found that ridiculous. Such an exclusive venue should provide a free cloakroom, full stop. These days not everyone takes cash with them, and I wonder what those foreign tourists do who have no Hungarian coins on them at all. I thought it was a shame on our beautiful city. Also, the snack bar/café should have provided a proper choice in drinks and food and for half the price they asked for them. For the poor service they provide I only gave it 4 stars and not an excellent rating, I'm sorry.
Madamme Butterfly . Loved it! Would have been 5 , but the line to the coats and the food in the intermission was more chaotic than it should have been.

A fantastic way to experience the opera . We booked tickets to Madame Butterly before we left as it coincided with our trip. Tickets were about 35pounds each for the stalls. Which I thought was very cheap compared to the UK. The building is stunning and opulent. Great moving performance of a tragic love story. The bar offers drinks at the intervals. It was sold out so i would book on the official website before you go.it costs 200forint to check a coat in. I believe this is the only way you can see inside all areas of the opera. It's a majestic building and breathtaking. Dress code varied but most people dressed smart, men in suits or shirts and trousers, women in dresses or trousers, heels and a nice top. Worth doing for the experience alone!

Top sight on your check list. The state opera house has a wonderful building from outside and inside. I can just recommend to book a ticket for a show too, it's not in Hungarian and has English subtitles in case of other languages. It's just right at the M1 subway station called "Opera". There are guided tours in 9 different languages (9 EUR per person) and photos can be made inside only for a fee of 1.5 EUR. This sight is a good decision in any season or any weather conditions, open all week long.
Building is both outside and inside are beautiful. We were around the Opera House several times for last 17 years, always stoped and make pictures, we liked it.

Impressive decorations on side. Very rich interior, without the tour you can see only the entrance hall which is pretty impressive. To enjoy the sound ( it is third best in Europe) take a guided tour at 3 pm.

outstanding. it was the first time i visited an opera.my only regret is that i couldnt afford a ticket to see an opera play.all the cheap tickets were gone and only the 45 euro tickets were left.so if you want to see an opera and not just the tour like us then book a ticket ahead.
Amazing. Attended this as part of a tour.The inside is incredible,the guide was very informative.We had a special Operatic Performance which was great

Swan Lake - Hungarian State Opera House. The theatre is incredibly beautiful. We attended a performance of Swan Lake (box 2, seats 1 and 2). We really enjoyed every moment. The view of the stage was very good and the quality of the performance was high. I would recommend it to anyone who loves ballet or opera.

Beautiful - but to me oversold. This is a beautiful opera house but neither the tour or the (extra cost) mini concert met the build up given - I still would do the tour but probably would skip the mini concert (two songs by a great singer with recorded music on the stairs) - while we had a great guide and the group was so large they split it into two the tour felt a bit rushed and superficial - I would have loved to have a demo of the claimed amazing acoustics for example - worth while but could be better done

Stunning Opulence. There are English tours every day at 3 and 4pm which are worth the time and money. Our guide was full of enthusiasm and great facts that really brought the history of a fantastic building to life. We were offered a 'small concert' at the end of our tour for a small additional charge (payable at the start). Whilst it was a pleasant experience with the opera singer dressed to impressed and with a marvellous singing voice I do think we were mis-led as the concert took place on the staircase and not in the auditorium and consisted of two songs!
Great Building. In my view one of the great opera houses of the world, stand back and just take in the wonderful architecture, magnificent.

Breathtaking. I visited the opera house on my second day being in Hungary. The building is just magnificent. I am not surprised why it is world famous. The building is just astonishing with all the deep architecture and the lighting effect during the night. In my opinion, it is one of the most beautiful buildings in Budapest.
Great. For sure one one of THE most beautiful theater. Don't miss It. Take advantage of a guided tour avAilable in many languages for a resonable price.

Beautiful building with gorgeous ceilings. 22nd October 2015. To see the actual auditorium you have to go on a tour which, from recollection, is only available at limited times in the afternoon. We simply admired the outside of the building and the lovely painted ceilings inside the foyer area. It is on Andrassy Boulevard which is worth a long stroll on its own and then you can take in at least part of this magnificent building.

Beautiful opera house but entrance quite expensive for Budapest. Visitors must join the guided tours for this attraction. Tours are offered in many languages and the duration is about 30 to 45 minutes. Although it is a beautiful building and the tour guides are well spoken, it was quite expensive. The tour guide mentioned one can go to the opera for a fraction of the guided tour by buying a cheap ticket for the opera or other events, although without the explanation of the history.

Beautiful Venue for Beautiful Music. Viewing the opera house is well worth the cost. Spend the extra fee to be able to enjoy a couple of arias live, if you are not one who usually goes to the opera. Ceilings, chandeliers and main hall are stunning as is the main staircase.

Beautiful place. Beautiful building Definitely buy tickets so you can enter and see the inside We bought 2 × 1500 HUF ( which is $7.5 AUD) tickets which are terrible seats at the top which offer only partial views BUT go a little earlier ( 15 minutes ) and they upgrade your tix if theres available seats near the stage. We got great seats at row 11 which are about 10 x more expensive. Really nice experience

Interesting reconstruction.. As opera houses go this one is special because of its historical trials and tribulations. It is beautiful, but if you have seen the Paris Opera House, you might find other things to see in this wonderful city.

Afternoon Visit. The brief afternoon tour was very hectic, crowded, and rushed and we felt like cattle in a slaughter house. That being said, our guide was funny, witty and conveyed a good sense of irony although in a group of 20+, he wasn't always heard over the chatter. The house is opulent but the visit would be much better served by watching an evening opera where the luxuriousness of the venue could truly be felt and experienced. We payed extra to hear two brief operettas sung by a talented singer but again felt this experience could not begin to savor the luxury of an evening performance.

We love the Hungarian State Opera House. The Hungarian State Opera is elegant, with excellent performances. We saw Giuseppe Verdi's Otello, which got rousing applause from the audience, and dined next door at the charming Callas Cafe.
Another Budapest beautiful building. As part of our walk up Andrassy Ave we encountered this beautiful building. We didnt have time to walk inside but just admired it from the street.
House of music. If no time for a full evening program pay a short visit to the foyer and be amazed by the fine frescos.

Opulance. Gilded vaulted ceilings, exquisite murals and 3-ton chandelier, opened in 1884. We were with Tauck and had a special tour and a performance of arias by a tenor and contralto. It was very special.

It's an opera house to be seen.. We've been there on November 2015. It was a great operagouse. You can attend everyday tours at 3pm and 4pm. It is 11 euros and it lasts about 40mins. After the tour by paying 2 euros you can attend a mini concert. It highly recommend you to attend this.

Great Opera House. My husband and I had a private tour of this opera house. It is well worth visiting. It is very ornate inside and is well worth the very minimal ticket price. If you want to take pics, you have to purchase a pass. It is well worth it to take pics home of this beautiful place. The K+K hotel is right beside here. It is very easy to find.
Very good performances.. This time I had Das Rheingold and Andrea Chenier. Both good performances, I prefer Das Rheingold and will be back in March 2016 for Die Walküre.

Swan Lake at the Opera House. The magic of Swan Lake was perfect for this magnificient building. I will long remember this perfect evening. The dancers, more graceful than one could ever magine, magnificient music, dramatic costumes, lighting - the eerie dawn mist slowly lifting to reveal the "swans" heads tucked into their wings.The building has tiered balconies, gold leaf adorning the stucco decorated walls, soaring proscenium - the Opera House is a must for the visitor to Budapest

Wonderful!. Went there last saturday, November, 7th, wonderful place to go and great to enjoy some opera in the morning. Loved the costumes in Mario and the Magician (Freddy Mercury, the Marilyns, Einstein, even Uma Thurman’s Kill Bill :D ), congrats to Enikö Kárpáti - loved the touch of modernity. (y) I already knew the plot, but you should check the english subtitles.Congrats to the magnificent Ildikó Komlósi (amazing and powerful Judith! :)) and to Krisztián Cser (as a fearful and filled with secrets Bluebeard).Definitely a must see in Budapest.

Visiting the Opera. Great place to visit any time. The building is beautiful and the performance is amazing.You could visit it during day time, with guided tour - it definitely worst the time.If you visit an evening performance, please were appropriate dress. ( Jeans, flip- plops, short and t-shirts are not welcome)

Old world splendor. Do not pass up an opportunity to go to the Opera in Budapest. What a better way to tour the inside of this stately building than to sit in the seats and enjoy world class music! During intermission walk the staircases, visit the royal staircase, look at the display of photographs from days gone by, look for the cigar holders on window sills (for the gentlemen to leave their cigars and resume smoking during intermission!) and let your imagination soar. Music is at its best in Budapest so treat yourself to whatever tickets are available online as you plan your trip. You will not regret your efforts!
Great tour Great Guides. You learn alot. See alot. Worth it! Taking pics is an extra charge for some odd reason. there is a lot to take picture of!!

Do the tour - it's well worth it!. We did the tour of the opera house. It was spectacular and very informative. Takes about an hour. We weren't able to book ahead but went to the box office at 10am and booked a tour in English for later in the day. We also booked the mini-concert afterwards (be careful - not after every tour) that cost about £1.50 each ( 600 HUF) and you got two songs from an opera singer to pre-recorded music but it was exceptional. That takes place on the grand stairway. The place is well worth seeing, very opulent and you get to see most of it, including the main hall. I did consider booking for a concert here but glad I didn't because the seats aren't very comfortable lol You pay about£1 extra to take photos but we didn't mind overall it's quite a cheap visit.

Beautiful building! . Lovely visit to the opera house. The whole building is beautifully decorated. Our guide spoke very good English and was able to answer all of our questions. The little concert performance at the end was also a great way to end the tour.

Treat yourself to a glass of champagne. The first floor bar at the front of the Opera House is well worth a visit, even if you are sitting in the cheap seats. A glass of champagne is only 1140 ft, about £2.75, and a canapé is less than 600 ft, about £1.50. If you have not popped in for a while, they have tarted the place up, with a new, central serving station. The murals above eye level also appear to have been cleaned as they now appear almost to glow. If the weather is nice, there is also a terrace to stand on to look over Andrassy Boulevard - an UNESCO World Heritage Site no less.

Seriously Beautiful. It is seriously beautiful and the 1 hour trip inside is worth the money ( to see where the £15 million euros from the EU was spent ) and have a coffee in the cafe. The extra for the Opera singer at the end of the tour was worth it to hear the power of an Opera voice.

Prettierthan Vienna`s Opera House. Budapest Opera House was another breathtaking surprise during this trip. Its interior is far more beautiful than the famous Vienna Opera House.The guided tour was also great and provided a lot of information not only the Opera House construction, but also regarding the society of that time.

saw swann lake. beutiful beilding,stunning performance but horrible chairs,we sat in one of those boxes just above the royal box and they just have some very-very uncomfortable chairs crammed next to each other 4 in the first row and 4 in the second so you pay double to sit in the first and to sit for 3 hours -not a nice experience

Amazing building with so much history. When visiting book the guided tour, the tour guide provides you with the history of the opera house and you have the opportunity to ask any questions.
Such a fantastic building with so much history.
Excellent value for money,

Wow! This is a must even if you are not an opera fan. The opera house building is just amazing from the foyer to the auditorium and the bar, which is an incredible room. We were lucky enough to see Massenet's Werther, a wonderful performance and good orchestra. We had our own box for £80 two. Try that at Covent Garden!
In all, not to be missed.

Rivals Opera Houses of Paris and Vienna. A majestic, structure with beautiful architecture, the Opera House rivals those in Paris, Vienna and Dresden, all of which I have visited. The facade celebrates musical themes, with statues of Hungary's most prominent composers (Liszt) and the interior contains ornamentation by famous Hungarian artists (Stobl and Lotz). You feel the opulence of this place, upon entering the foyer, with hits lavish chandeliers and grandeur sweeping main staircase with red carpets and gilded walls. The three-story auditorium is breathtaking. We did not get a chance to see a performance this time on our trip, but have been in the past, and it is memorable.

Impressive. Unfortunately I could not attend any performance at the Opera House as I was only two days in Budapest, but I sneaked into the building to have a look at it. It looks very impressive. I took some pictures that I will try to share.

Don't let outside appearance detract you from seeing this building. As an Architect I was disappointed when I first saw this building. It simply did not look grand enough. But I went inside and immediately signed up for a tour. There is a daily tour several times in the afternoon. Our guide spoke perfect English and gave us an excellent background history of the building. The interior is beautifully and tastefully decorated. We were taken to all the rooms open to the public. The tour lasted about 45 minutes and was worth it. Before the tour we had a light lunch at the cafe within the building. Great soup!

Beautiful!. This was a surprise visit for us! We were in town on a National Holiday and were able to explore the Opera House for free! It was fun to sit in the boxes (and feel like Pretty Woman for a few minutes) have a snack on the balcony and snap some photos with costumed performers!

Splendidly over the top. We paid for a short tour complete with 5 minute opera performance. The tour guide was knowledgeable and spoke English very competently. Gorgeous opera house. The 5 minute opera performance was very special with the performer walking through the crowd and dancing with a very fortunate gentleman whilst singing at the same time.How absolutely beautiful.
State Opera House. We went on a tour of this facility and even had the chance of watching the ballet Swan Lake-wow how fantastic that was!!

Beautiful. The Opera House is beautiful. This time we could not go to the ballet as no seats left. So we went to an afternoon opera for children. Haydn's 'the uninhabited island' we all sat on cushions on some stairs, not in the main opera house. It was sung in Hungarian so the children could understand it. Both the other chestra and singers were young, but really excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed it. Lovely to see children sit happily watching opera!
Try to Catch a Performance. A magnificent concert hall. Got tickets to the opera on the day of performance - excellent at a remarkably affordable price.

The true royalty of Opera. This magnificent building is a tribute to the much loved HugarIan queen Elizabeth. Take a guided tour, viewing the royal reserved staircase entry & box, sit in the audience and feel Budapest's passion & love of opera from childhood. The tour finishes with a solo performance of popular operas.

A great tour. My wife and I went on a one hour tour of the Opera House. The theater is amazing and we wish we had gotten tickets to a performance. We got to sit in the royal box and see how the Emperor would enjoy the opera. The building is amazing and should not be missed.

Plan ahead. This is a fabulous venue, but plan ahead if you want a tour or to attend an event. Tours are only at specific days and times. If you want to attend an event be sure to check the schedule in advance and get tickets.
Opulent Opera House. A fantastic 100+ year-old Neo-Renaissance opera house. The interior is classic with gold leaf everywhere. There is a full tour with a few looks behind the scenes.

Beautiful Opera House. We saw swan lake here in a box seat for about $75 each. The performance was lovely (our first ballet) and the theatre was beautiful. There is a cash bar. We enjoyed sitting in the box seats. If you do not want to purchase expensive tickets you can buy standing room tickets where you could explore the opera house and watch something for a little bit.
Stunning!. I'm not a big opera fan,but I have a great respect for it. We toured the building and learned a lot,but mostly we were knocked out by the grandeur. Definitely worth a visit.

Open air rehearsal. As we approached the opera house we heard the singing of a magnificent aria. The cast were performing a full dress rehearsal at the front of the building. What a brilliant idea to include everybody in the splendour of opera.

One of the best Opera houses in Europe.. Located on Andrassi Avenue in jewish quarter. The outside facade of the building is wonderful and even inside is spectacular. Loved the way the opera house is built and adds a royal feel on the street. Could not get a show as tickets were sold out the night we wanted to visit. But still visited the place and got a few pics clicked.

Classic architecture. I was able to tour this building, it was also interesting to see the street performers right outside. Prices for performances aren't cheap, especially at the last minute when selection is limited.
Swan Lake. We saw Swan Lake in October. It was amazing. The inside of the Opera House is absolutely beautiful! Highly recommended.

Gold leafed grandeur. We took the guided tour of this wonderful opera house and were not disappointed. Our guide spoke excellent English and was very knowledgeable. We sat in the stalks for the start of the tour which then went on to include other rooms apart from the auditorium. Gold leaf everywhere, along with exquisitely carved oak pillars and delicately painted ceilings. Enormous brass chandeliers and black and white mosaic floors.The tour ended with a few arias, sung on the grand staircase. The tour lasted less than an hour and was excellent. To use a camera in the opera house incurred a charge of €2.
Amazing experience. Went to ballet at the opera house, and it was an amazing experience. Check out this amazing building on a tour or go to a performance.
Great tour!. An informative tour in a beautiful venue. Spend the extra money to get the photo pass and mini concert. The tour does not include the stage.

Wonderful Opera House!. Very nice showing of Opera House! Opera House is beautiful! But groups were huge! it has to be more guides! And the concert after the show was too small, maybe at least thee peaces, not two.

Spectacular - Standing ovation. What a treat - we bought tickets yesterday - and had great seats for Werther - we are not Opera aficionados- but we're thrilled with the smart orchestra & their conductor- the performance of the singing voices that held us spellbound - and the stunning architecture! We did have a glass of champagne before and at intermission went upstairs for an espresso- and out to the balcony - this was a very special & romantic evening - thanks to our new friends for suggesting it and Ivana from Viking for facilitating

Wow...so beautiful and like stepping into a fairytale. I was fortunate enough to watch 'Swan Lake' whilst in Budapest. Such a beautifully stunning building and the buzz of people in the foyer before the performance was exciting. I did the day tour of the building and then to come back in the evening for a performance, I saw the Opera House in all its glory. Even the cloack room was classy! Walking into the venue and hearing the orchestra tuningnup was amazing. Then the actual ballet was something I could never have imagined! Could hear the tap, tap,tap of the ballet shoes on the floor from me seat which was 6 rows back in the stalls. The production and acoustics were nothing I had ever witnessed before. If you are able to see a performance...any performance...treat yourself! The bar during the breaks was worth a visit to people watch! It is something I will never forget.

Swan Lake. Beautiful, opulent opera house. Unfortunately, our view from Box 4, row 1 was fairly obstructed. Intermissions are longer than in the US. Plenty of time for both a restroom break and a drink.

fantastic building, great audio. based on a tip from our walking tour guide, we went to the opera, it was way cheaper than doing the guided tour and great to see and hear a performance there.The building is simply stunning and the acoustics, well go see and hear for yourself, well worth the time, go early in the day to book your seats and be amazed at the bargain price.

Amazing venue for opera. While researching our trip to Budapest I read that the Opera House is rated as the 3rd best in all of Europe - a surprise to me. I was able to purchase tickets to see Cosi Fan Tutti during our stay and was not disappointed. Excellent quality all around in a magnificent building inside and out.

Beautiful building and preformances!. This is one of the best Opera houses I've been to. Even for budget travelers like myself: I bought my ticket for 1500 HUF (around €5,-). Had to take the 'backdoor' and many stairs to reach my chair. But it was SUCH good value! Highly recommended!!

Opulence in grand style. This is well worth a visit on two counts. To have a tour and gain an insight to the Opera House. It's a really interesting tour and if you have the time see a show to have the overall experience . It can be booked online. When in Budapest, this is a must
Schedule your visit. For a small fee they will tour you in your prospective language. On a couple tours they have a musician do a 5 minute concert.

Just amazing. Well worth the evening, truly impressive and breath taking, be it the settings, location, structure, history, layout and performance. Choices of shows and spectacles to see. Well worth it and highly recommended.
A must see in Budapest. Beautiful and stunning architecture. Nice tour and a great little sampling of opera by a performer after the tour. Nice touch.

Swan Lake. We booked this online in the UK and it was a highlight of our trip to Budapest. The Opera house is exquisite inside and the performance was fantastic. Top tips are to take a bottle of water and to try and find out how long the performance will be though. Swan Lake started at 6pm and didnt finish until 9.45pm by which time we were starving. There were two intervals of over 15mins, and a third around 5mins. Dont expect ice cream at the interval either... The boxes looked amazing, so get one if you can; we were in the stalls and the view etc. is fine.

Good Tour of the Opera House. The opera house is a small version of the one in Vienna. They have daily tours that give you a good background on the history of the opera house that included a short singing by one of the singers in the company. Very nice touch to the end of a good tour. This is a popular tour so make reservations early in the day or the day before to ensure a spot on the tour.

Magical Night at the Opera House. My husband and I bought tickets online for the opera; it did not disappoint. The building is breathtaking inside and out. The performance we attended was a symphony arias; simply magical. Would highly recommend to any Budapest travellers.

Open Day ( Oct 23rd ). On Oct 23rd, Museums are free, and other places organise community events. This was an Open day, where there were many child-friendly events, but also, for me, a chance to hear extracts form Nabucco sung by soloists and chorus and a chance to join with the Chorus in Va Pensiero ( Chorus of the Hebrew slaves ) which the Chorus master taught us ( in Hungarian ) You could wander at will and enjoy this magnificent building. Normally a tour charge applies, but well worth it. Metro (orange line ) Opera

Pretty.... Go for the tour and pay those few dollars more for the 5 minute performance on the stairs if you didn't manage to get any tickets for a show. Not surprisingly, there's always confusion before the tour starts because everyone waits at the same place and there's no system what so ever. The say we went, there were about 6 separate groups for English tours alone. Wait at the foyer and when it's time, just give your tickets. As you head up the stairs, some one there will sort you according to groups. The opera house is of course smaller than the one in Vienna but it was one of the very few buildings surviving the war. Tour is short but entertaining enough.
So much character. Didn't actually have the time to go inside, but is worth going to see. Would like to come back here.

A beautiful place to watch the ballet. I organised a night at the opera house to watch Swan Lake the ballet on the 21st Oct the building is amazing and the bar was great. Best thing we did on our break its a must such a special occasion!

World class opera house. Definitely make time to take the tour. The building itself is a work of art, and you walk in the footsteps of so many famous people. Our tour guide was great, giving us not only background information, but also instilling a feeling of what has happened here throughout the years.

One of the most beautiful opera. I like this building and the performans also. I saw at least ten show here and all impressed. My favourites Madama Butterfly - Giacomo Puccini and Otello - Giuseppe Verdi. But if you like modern, you can enjoy the West side story also.So you have to go to twice a day here. The first visit building with guide during the day and the second is a performance in the evening.

Great old building. This is an old style opera house dating back to the imperial years of Austro-Hungary ( opened 1874). It is renowned for its very good acoustics. Although relatively small, just over 1,000 seats, the interior is a very good example of neo-renaissance design. Even if you cannot get a ticket to an Opera or Ballet performance, take one of the many guided tours. We visited just before the performing season, but caught one of the impromptu outside rehearsals that are common with this Opera company.

Beautiful building & excellent value for money. We watched 2 one-act Hungarian matinee operas & had a great time. The experience is the best part- box seats were so cheap! The wine was very good value & you can enjoy a cold glass on the balcony during interval. The surroundings are sumptuous & worth the ticket price alone.

Loved the architecture!. This historical building is a must see! I've been to Budapest twice and went to the opera both times. I am always amazed at how beautiful this building is. I've seen others in Europe and this is one of my favorites. The opera was very good as well. Ticket prices are decent and although I am always in the balcony, the view is still fantastic. Magical!
Well worth a visit. Even if you are not going to see an opera, its well worth a visit and tour. Very interesting architecture and history

Grest performance in beautiful building but uncomfortable seating!. Tickets for Swan Lake booked on line. Very simple easy process and email confirmation received. I printed up the tickets and took these with me. All ok.However we were not allowed to take our coat into the theatre and had to pay to have them stored in the cloakroom.The seats were VERY uncomfortable after sitting in them for 3 hours and the temperature dropped towards the end of the show.The building is beautiful however and the ballet was incredible!

Exquisite Performance of Swan Lake. Better than just a tour by far. Get tickets to see a performance. We saw Swan Lake on the evening of our first full day in Budapest. It was the perfect end to the day. More ornate than even Palais Garnier in Paris it is also more intimate. We had great seats and the ballets was wonderful. Long but two full intermissions. During intermission we visited the bar. Service was fast and friendly.

Striking and Ornate Architecture. There are tours available which end with a brief concert. We tried to attend one, but the timing was never right. But we were free to walk inside the spacious lobby area and view the impressive interior decor.

Spectacular Opera House. The Hungarian State Opera House in Budapest is one of a kind. It is well worth the time to take a guided tour--beautiful hall with lots of gold, lots of history, and a story behind nearly every nook and cranny. Even if you can't attend a performance, the guided tour is a real highlight.

This is a stunningly beautiful building. You can tour this building and be awed by the gold leaf, carvings, and marble. We did not have time to see a performance but that would be amazing, especially in the boxes with red velvet upholstery on the chairs.

Beautiful and amazing interpretation of the swan lake. We make a point to visit state operas throughout the world and greatly appreciate these beautiful building from another era. We preferred the Budapest state opera to its Vienna counterpart as it is warmer, but smaller...We enjoyed an amazing ballet. The swan lake was played by an abundant cast of dancers and the orchestra was incredible. Very reasonable priced for such a quality (150$ for 2 great tickets)

Very poor Tour. 1. The guide did not speak clear English and offered only very superficial information. Music and opera did not feature!2. We were sat a few feet from the curtain and the guide proceeded to talk about everything behind us while THREE other tours were going on at the same time in different languages. It was a Tower of Babel.3. We were told how big the stage was but never saw it. We were told we were lucky to see the buffet, which was similar in decoration to the entrance hall - which can be seen for free - and we saw nothing of backstage (many in the group of 31 were disappointed by this).4.The tour took just 25 minutes of being rushed from one place to another and was very expensive by Budapest standards.5. We resisted paying extra for a 5 minute concert at the end of the tour and then found that we could hear it anyway for free before the tour began as we waited in the entrance.6. Our advice, go to an opera.Otherwise go into the entrance and admire it 15 minutes before the 4pm tour is about to begin and stay till 4pm then leave. You won't have missed much!

Beautiful and Stunning venue. Definitely worth a visit!. I went here with my partner to watch the ballet, I would recommend if you are seeing either the ballet or the opera, to dress suitably! It doesn't go down well with the locals if you go in trainers, luckily we read this before visiting! There was a 'technical error' which led to the bar being opened and the show being temporarily postponed. The venue is stunning, absolutely gorgeous, but isn't massive (in comparison to the Albert Hall). Book some seats!

Go even if you only have time to visit the lobby. This is a very beautiful building inside and out. Buy tickets in advance for the very popular Opera House tours. But a visit is worth it, even if you only have time to visit the wonderfully elegant lobby.

Free ballet on Memorial Day. We poked our head in to see the inside of building and was told there were several free shows on this day. We were thrilled to see a small ballet from one of the box seats. What a treat as I had wanted to see some type of classical music concert while in Europe bit did not get to until today. I primarily wanted to be able to sit in a beautiful music hall and take it all in. Fantastic!

Beautiful building. Beautiful building and the tour is very informative. we paid for the mini concert and got a little taste of a brilliant voice. My wife loved it and would definately recommend and go back to see a proper opera

A stunning Opera House...Swan Lake. Booked a long weekend in Budapest and noticed that Swan Lake was on.Being a fan of The Royal Opera House in London and of Ballet meant that the Swan Lake production at the Hungarian State Opera became a "Must do".I wasn't disappointed either, the production was very good, the Opera house itself is stunning and the whole evening was a delight!I highly recommend a visit!

One of our favorite places to visit in Budapest! See the Mini Opera at the end, Must See!. Visiting the Hungarian Opera was the highlight of the day during a week of many beautiful wonders here in Pest. They offer tours in many languages with some very good presenters. They give the history behind the building and funding of the opera house dating back to the 1800's when the Austro-Hungarian Emperor ruled from Vienna. During the 1800's they spared no cost to build this magnificent facility still showing the opera today (Swan Lake was playing,)The tour concludes with views from the box seats and a mini concert, extra, but well worth it. The beautiful young opera singer belts out 2 songs and dances with a tourist and comes right up to the people watching from the stairs. She is so into it, you can see her tears and sweat; a very moving experience!Next door to the opera house was a wonderful bistro (yes we like to eat, but we walk to all these venues.) Callas Bar Cafe offers some excellent coffee and wonderful deserts, (see my separate review with pix of the wow cheesecake!) Reasonable price too for both Callas 3144FT/ $11.76US for beer, coffee and cheesecake and the Opera House Tour was 7500FT/$28.19 including the opera, camera tag and 2 people.Dont let the money scare you, everything here is really low priced and you can use an app called XE currency to do a quick calculation for USD, Euros and HUF/FT (Hungarian Forints.) And contrary to what i previously read, most places do take Amex and Visa which give you what you spent in both currencies immediately online.BTW Weather in October is wonderful; one day light rain, sunny and slightly windy, able to walk everyday around mid 50's sometimes a bit windy but you wont freeze or even need your gloves.

No Self-Guided Tours/Don't Go Early.... We thought we'd be clever and get to the Opera House when it "opens" at 10AM. Take it all in, and move on to the next attraction... Big mistake... Unlike other Opera houses/theaters they don't allow self guided tours, only guided tours that start at 3PM (15:00). There looked to be only two tours a day, the other was at 16:00. So if you get there when it "opens", you'll be relegated to the lobby, the gift shop, and the bathroom. Unfortunately, we never made it back later in the day for a tour. One would think the Opera House could increase its revenue by allowing self-guided tours all day, but they didn't ask me. Advice here is don't show up until the afternoon for your guided tour.

Alive with music, history and culture. A lovely building to visit with beautiful architecture, ornamentation, paintings and history. The afternoon tours take no more than an hour and is well time well worth spent. The opera house compares well to other European venues although a little smaller.

Do stop and look.. I did not do a tour or go to a show, I went to see the opera house entrance, foyer, shop and coffee shop. The opera house foyer is a must see. It is stunning but has a definite "female" feel to it, delicate, soft and beautiful design, art and architecture. Definitely worth a visit and its free.
