Beautiful Building. I have been attending Operas for over 50 years but unfortunately the singers take off for the summer so there were no performances while we were in European capitals. This is a beautiful building and the tour was very good. the short "mini-concert" after the tour was fun.

Amazingly beautiful. We took the guided tour and really enjoyed it. The building is so beautiful, every surface is covered with paintings, carvings or gold like a jewel box. Our guide was friendly and informative; adding in tidbits about Empress Elizabeth & others that really livened up the tour.We reccomend a visit to the Opera House.
Beautiful. We only saw it from the outside.There are very beautiful buildings around it, at night its spectacular.

A nice tour. Take the Opera House tour for a fun 1 hour experience. It is offered is several languages and lasts about 40 minutes. You pay an extra $2 for a 8 minute mini concert after the tour by one of their opera singers. You at an extra $2 to be able to photograph inside the opera house. There is no room to set up a tri-pod, so bring your fastest lense and crank up the ISO so you can shoot hand held shots without vibration.

beautiful building. Very nicely maintained opera house, much prettier and opulent than the Vienna State Opera house, although smaller. The tour of the interior is quite informative. We didn't have an opportunity to hear anything performed in the main hall - the tour can include a short concert but this is done in a smaller room in the back so doesn't give you any idea about the sound in the main hall. Definitely worth a tour with many fine restaurants in the area as well.

Hungarian Delight!. Take the guided tour of the Hungarian State Opera house. Tickets can be bought right inside on the left at the gift shop. No need to try and buy in advance as they take large groups every day. One tour at 13:00 and another at 14:00. Arrive 15 minutes in advance of the tour you want and you will be fine. The tours are available in all languages and include a walk through the private royal quarters. Beautiful architecture and interesting information makes this a delightful and fun tour. We spent about 45 minutes looking at all the gorgeous paintings, carpets, and furnishings. A must do Budapest site!

great tour. I would recommend the tour that includes the optional 5 minute opera at the end of the tour. It was outstanding, and as a bonus the opera singer actually pulled my 17 year old son out of the crowd and danced with him!

Must Do. Compared to the Vienna Opera House, where I attended an performance last year, the Hungary Opera House is even more ornate. Though smaller, it is grander due to historical competition between the two cities.The acoustics are excellent and ticket prices are unbelievably inexpensive. Top ticket price for the best seats in the house for a weekend evening performance is only around $60! World class singers and musicians, grand historical building, and economical admission make this a "must do" on your trip to Budapest.

Beautiful!. A monumental piece of work, absolutely gorgeous. On Andrassy Street, this building looks even more gorgeous at night. Worth a visit. Beautiful architecture, and holds some very grand concerts as well.

monumental. Monumental. Really monumental. Even looks like a Paris Opera. It is located on Andrassy street - I think is the most fashionable street of Budapest. I have not visited the opera inside but outside it is a must visit place in Budapest as well as Andrassy street itself.
Simply AMAZING. What a beautiful place. Went on a guided tour with a really interesting and funny young lady who had a good knowledge of the history of the buidling. So many beautiful things to see.

Beautiful!. So beautiful inside! You can get tickets very cheap for some things though some seats are not the best. Some things we have seen there have been dull, some ok some wonderful! Saw a lovely ballet there, my partner, who thought he'd hate ballet, loved it! The whole place is like a set for Dangerous Laisons, painted ceilings, gold, lovely. And where else would you witness what we did at the end as we waited to leave: an old German man glaring and saying 'You Sir are not a gentleman' and an even older Hungarian man with a walking cane arguing' No, Sir YOU are not a gentleman!

Beautiful Opera House, but tour was too crowded. This is a beautiful building that everyone who visits Budapest should see. We were there on a Monday and normally museums and public buildings are not open on Mondays. Although they did have two tours - at 3:00 and 4:00. We were there for the 3:00 and there were too many english speaking people there. We could not hear the guide of see the objects she was pointing to.

Beautiful building. It was a very beautiful building: lovely interior. Can't say much for the acoustics really as we saw a ballet - the only thing available when we were there. It was Snow White and the Seven Dwarves so lots of kids - but nice to see them dressed up for the evening.

worth visiting. worth visiting, the tour is 45 min which is not too long, the guiding tours are in 6 languages and they tell nice and funny stories, not just dry facts. The building is beautiful inside and outside

Excellent!. Watched Romeo and Juliet Ballet here for £10!!! Excellent value. Bought tickets the day before. Absolutely stunning inside and the ballet was beautiful! In the breaks you can have a drink/just stroll on the outdoor terrace. Was fun getting dressed up- we had our own little booth!
Awesome, fantastic acoustics. This opera house is stunning, and has been rated as having the second or third best acoustics in the world. (La Scala is always at the top). Don't miss it.

Splendour. This is a well timed tour, lasting less than an hour, and the opera house is truly magnificent, well worth the effort. Best to book in advance, as queues can get quite long justbefore the tour. Nice shopping int he area and the Maria Callas Cafe across the road is a nice oasis.

Architectural masterpeice. The guided tour was a little pricey and perhaps not that interesting for younger children, however the building is a work of art.
An excellent way to pass a rainy afternoon

Very beautiful. We really enjoyed the tour that explained many interesting features and told many of the interesting facts and fables of the Opera House. What a beautiful place! Hard to believe it is so old!

A must see in Budapest. The Hungarian Opera is a masterpiece of architecture. It's outside betrays the magnificence that one sees inside. We visited the opera and took a english tour at 4PM. It was a well worth visit. The wood work and panels are exquisite. It is a compact opera and so seems even better. I would have loved to see a show there, but there was not one that day.
fantastic building. i have been there for a ballet... wonderfull building and wonderful shows

Interesting if brief tour, skip the mini-concert. We opted to attend the "mini-concert" after the tour. It was just 500 florint per person. I had asked the cashier if it was live, and she said yes... Well, I knew something was up when we went back to the bar for the mini concert and there were no seats. We stood as we listened to one tenor sing two arias, accompanied by a recording played on a small stereo. Rather silly, and an unfortunate ending to an otherwise pleasant and interesting tour.
Up high. We could not see very well as it was the ballet. We finally convinced the ushers that we needed to see and they found a spot for us in a bird's nest!
Amazing value in the Gods. I used to go weekly and pay about £1 in 1997 and not much more fairly recently. To achieve this I had to find the local booking office next door and never use ticket booths
we only saw in side the foyer. as there was a opera taking place it is a beauitful building out and in side.

Absolutely lovely! Great value.. I saw the Opera Lady Macbeth, by Verdi, for around $12 had pretty decent seat. It was a wonderful. It was a great production, beautiful singing. Beautiful Opera House!
superb quality and an architectural gem. The building is worth seeing, one of the great examples of Central European opera houses. Their performances are great!
Great value for money. Paid £3 for a gallery view which was well worth the opera Red Cliff. The acoustics and view of the opera was captivating!

You must see this!. One of the great Opera Houses of Europe, and your visit will illustrate why. Tours are given in many languages, and performances range from a very low price to moderate (by American standards).

A good opera building - book a box. We did not go for a guided tour - but instead booked 2 tickets for an opera. Unfortunately the perfomance on when we were there was the National Center for the Performing Arts in Beijing's unique opera production Red Cliff. Not for us and we left at the interval but the opera house, and surroundings were excellent.The tickets are cheap compared to London (around £35 for a top seat; £20 for a good seat etc) and available online (http://www.opera.hu/en/.)As you would expect, subtitles are only in Hungarian, so read the plot summary before seeing a show.In the circle boxes they have 3 different prices - the front row of the box is top price, the second row is 2nd and the back is 3rd price. You can probably get away with a 2nd row seat to save a bit of money but a front row is recommended - or in the stalls.All in all a beautiful building, probably seats around 800 and so is large but not too big.

An afternoon experience. I booked online to see a ballet SNOW WHITE & THE SEVEN DWARFS. I would guess that the majority of the audience were tourists in Budapest. The Opera House itself is a marvel of architecture and a sense of opulence from a prior period of history. Whilst the seats were probably the least appealing thing about the building, the rest was a feast for the eyes with its ornate red and gold fittings. At interval, we wandered through the building and saw other parts that would not normally be available for viewing. The ballet itself was wonderful and very reasonably priced, as were the refreshments on offer at interval. Well worth a visit.
Great place to visit!. Do the tour...and also pay some extra money (500 Ft) for the mini Concert..well deserved!
Lovely. Really worth a visit...I loved it!!The whole building and the atmosphere were great, despite the fact that we couldnt understand the language we enjoyed the play!

Amazing interior and worth a visit!. As I come from Ireland, we don't have fine and magnificent buildings from the past over our way. I just walked around with my mouth open taking in every detail, picture, decorative detail on this tour of the opera house. Amazing. The actual theatre auditorium is amazing! You also get to listen to a short 5 min opera at the end if the tour also.

Cheap yet amazing. Although it's possible to go on a guided tour, seeing a show is recommended. The tickets are cheap and available online. There are a lot of people on stage, which makes each show impressive. Unfortunately, subtitles are only in Hungarian, so read the plot summary before seeing a show.
Not much from the outside.. Brilliant from inside - just a short walk from Corinthian hotel where we were staying - stunning !
must be the cheapest opera in the world. tour tickets were 15 euro, and the opera rickets were staring from a few euros! we just get 2 tickets and enjoyed the balcony view.

An evening at the Opera in Budapest. We were so lucky to book seats for the Opera 'Madam Butterfly'.
The set and the Opera sters made it a memorable evening.
For some of my friends it was their first visit to an Opera and thy fully intend it will not be the last. Seats were so much chaper than Opera in the U.K.

Beautiful Structure. Don't miss the tour!
There are 2 tours per day: 15:00 and 16:00.

Impressive building. The Hungarian State Opera House is beautiful and the tour incredibly informative. We heard some great stories; it was fun and worth the effort--although if we ever come back, we feel it would be best just to buy tickets to an event!
Great tour. This is a more beautiful Opera house then Vienna's. The tour was wonderful and informative. The inside was spectacular. Worth it.
Snow white. A great ballet but a bit childish maybe. Impressive opera house with good seats for around 3000 forints.

Loved it!. We went to watch a ballet since we wanted to visit the building and thought we might as well have the full experience. What we got was a real treat!The building was so beautiful. You should get there a bit earlier to walk around and take photos, or enjoy a drink at the balcony while looking down at the streets. We booked the tickets at a music store and with some strange luck, we got seats in the middle of the 7th row of a full house performance!Even the show was great! We enjoyed good ballet of Romeo & Juliet with impressive stage design. All at a very reasonable price.

Tosca. Went to a performance of Tosca. The lyrics are in Italian (I'm not so good at Italian) and the supertitles were in Hungarian (I'm completely ignorant of Hungarian) and still it was fantastic. The acoustics are excellent, the performance was moving (Scarpio was great) and the interior is baroque at its zenith

Building was spectacular but tour was terrible. The architecture, design, and splendour of the Opera House is amazing, but in my opinion it was not worth the painful tour in order to see. Tours were at 3:00 and 4:00 only. We walked in off the street and booked the 3:00, along with about 400 other people. Groups were split into the language of the tourists (English, French, German, Italian, Japanese, Spanish) which I thought nice, but about a third of the group was English and ended up overwhelming the one English guide whose poor little microphone and speaker could not be heard by all but those standing immediately next to her. I personally couldn't hear a word. Mobs of pushy people in groups criss-crossing and bumping into each other, cramming into small rooms, occasionally shoving, all putting a major damper on the beauty of the place. Eventually we "lost" our group (along with about 20 others) and we tagged along with the much smaller Spanish group - even though my Spanish is bad enough and I could only understand about 20% of what the guide was saying, it was still better than the 0% I could hear from the English guide. After that group my wife and I sort of meandered around on our own which wasn't exactly permitted, but finally found some beauty to salvage out of the fiasco.I'm sure that attending a performance here is an unsurpassed experience, but do yourself a favor and skip the tour.

Don't take the tour!. Worst tour of my life. There were over 100 in the English speaking group and our guide spoke so fast and you couldn't hear a thing if you were in the back of the crowd. The microphone with the speaker was a joke, my grand kids have one just like it and it was a joke. Paying for taking pictures was also wrong as no one hardly had the band on and they were taking pictures and never paid. Also the 5 minute "mini concert" was NOT IN THE THEATRE! Nope it was in a room and it too was very disappointing, all in all a rip off. The building is lovely but they need to learn how to organize this tour better as at times there were several groups in different languages and all of them were talking at the same time and trying to talk louder than one another. Save your money and time!
EXCELENT. We went to the Opera House for the Ballet ANa Karenina and was the best money invest

Enjoyed the ballet.. We decided it was better to buy the cheap tickets (1200Huf) then pay for a tour. We saw Romeo and Juliet. We were in the nosebleed section and unfortunately it was still quite warm, but we got to experience the opera house for dollars. We only booked the day before.

Our first ballet..... Did the guided tour - good, but would have been nice to see behind the scenes etc. However, went later in the evening to see Romeo and Juliet - truly stunning, great company, great music and a tremendous performance - all from a glorious seat in a box for around £20.
Wish I'd spent more time here. We just popped in to look because we only had one day in Budapest (will be back). Beautiful. Worth the stop. Note they have reasonable tour/mini concerts at 3 and 4pm.
Behind the scenes. Interesting afternoon tour with an excellent guide
Opera House. We visited but unfortunately all the tickets were gone. Advise to book early
Madame Butterfly with a twist. Extremely talented cast though the costumes were a little off on the period. Still a gem!
It ıs so cool. ıt is really cool buildingö I really lıke the ambıans.
wonderful. Snow White was splendid. The theatre is outstanding and prices are a gift here.

Photos bands - for what?. The tour was interesting, and the building is beautiful, but considering that I paid an extra €2 for photos, and was the only one in the group to be wearing the photo arm band, I was more than a little annoyed to see the guide watching people without them taking photos and saying nothing. They need to stop charging if that is going to happen! Not like it is cheap int the first place...
Beautiful building and performances. The Opera house is lovely and the performances excellent. A truly romantic evening and a memorable experience. Like something out of a movie.
Hungarian Opera. We went as a group of twenty - great seats in the orchestra area and a great opera house. A first class seat costs less than $45.

A gem. A small gorgeous house.
The opera we heard, MacBeth was sung in Italian with Hungarian super titles so we understood little but we attended a stirring performance with great staging.
Intermission refreshments are good and reasonable.
Magnificant. We saw (heard) Puccini’s Madam Butterfly – sung in Italian with Hungarian sub titles. Lovely in two languages we didn’t understand.
Excellent guide and tour. We went on an English speaking tour and the guide and opera house very memorable.the guide was very entertaining and informative

An incredible experience. My husband and I were in Budapest over the Christmas holiday and were lucky enough to see the Nutcracker at the Hungarian State Opera. The inside is absolutely stunning. We had very good seats in the stalls, but as the incline is minimal, if someone tall sits in the three rows infront of you, your view is a bit blocked. Go for one of the boxes, great views from all of them it seemed. The building on the outside doesn't look like much, but it is a must see inside!
spectacular!!. You must see this! pay for a guided tour and be prepared to be blown away by the sheer beauty of this working opera house.
Beautiful decor great Opera House. We saw Snow White and the 7 dwarfs ballet which was very good.
Beautiful building. I went on the English tour and my guide was excellent and very entertaining, the building itself is beautiful and the opera that was part of the tour was also very good. Amazing.
Take the tour!. If you take a tour of the Hungarian State Opera House, you'll see the magnificent interior with all the marble, red velvet seats, paintings and busts. Highly recommended.

Breathtaking inside. Loved the story of its history as told by tour guide (we had a good one). And it was gorgeous. Didn;t like the huge # of people on both our tour in English and the hordes of others getting tour in several other languages. And it wasn't even summer yet!

Tosca - simply a wonderful performance I am glad I did not miss. I knew from looking at the internet prior to leaving home, that there were only a handful of tickets left for the following Saturday's performance of Tosca. Once I had checked into the hotel, I made my way to the Opera House and was fortunate to discover that some tickets remained available. I was not really bothered where I sat as whilst I enjoy all kinds of music, was not sure if this was really for me. I therefore went for the cheapest which was for HUF4000 which appears to be extraordinary good value and probably recognises the subsidy from the government. I had a choice of rear stalls, box, or front balcony. I opted for the latter.I made my way up the endless flights of stairs and since I had no idea where to sit, showed my ticket to a guide and she told me to sit at the front. I happilly sat where she said and had plenty of leg room and a fantastic view. The seat to the right of me remained empty but the two seats to the left of me were occupied at various times by no less than six people during the performance as they sought to gain advantage from their inferior places further back. This resulted in arguing and the guide being called to sort matters out.The performance consisted of three scenes of about 45 minutes each with twenty minute breaks. I did not understand a word since the subtitles shown in lights above the screen were in a foreign language but I got the gist of what was going on and this did not detract from the experience. I thought that it was overall, simply a wonderful performance from superb performers in an outstanding opera house.One last point, once back at the hotel, I realised that my seat should have been in the second row and whether I was directed to the front in error or not, I will never know. I was delighted where I was sat since on later checking the seats behind me, I discovered that apart from the view, the others had no leg room whatever.
Stunning building. Unfortunately we went at the wrong time for the tour but what we could see was stunning.Also had a great shop just inside

Breathtaking Opera. The opera house is a definite must, you can get tickets for either the ballet or opera for a little more than the cost of the tour ticket. You are charged an extra HFLT 500 if you want to take photos, but people were busy snapping away without the wristbands that give you permission.
Madame Butterfly. Small, beautiful opera house, with rather uncomfortable seats.
Beautiful building, ok tour. It was a beautiful building and the tour guide was very knowledgeable but the 4 minute snapshot of opera singing at the end didn't justify the price!

An Amzing Opera House. Ignored the tours that are available, just booked tickets and went to see Tosca to get the full experience. Ticket prices from £1.40 - £35.00 so anyone can go, not too formally dressed either. Production was great and the Opera House is amazingly full of gilt and little detailed paintings to keep one amusedinthe boring bits!!!

High standards at bargain prices. I saw three performances at the State Opera House - one ballet and two opera. All were of international standard as one might expect. At one I took a box seat at 12000HUF, the others a 3rd floor (central section) seat at 1200/1300HUF (c£3.50!). There was very little difference to justify the 10x markup, but all were terrific value compared with UK prices. There are a few restricted view seats available from 500HUF.My advice - don't book the afternoon tours (c£2600HUF) - just attend a performance and ask for 3rd floor, central section, seats. You have to enter via a side door - but you can see the main staircase anytime. The building is just fabulous, outside and in, and the acoustics very good.
Folk dance. was great time to see the traditional dance , i had great time there
Tours are available. We took a tour of the opera and there was a 10 minute performance at the end of the tour

Get the cheap seats!. I found out from my hostel that it's cheaper to go to the opera than it is to have a tour of the place a lot of the time If you get cheap seats online. My view of the stage wasn't great but the ornate ceiling was pretty close to my head and it was worth it for that alone (I only paid about 2 euros for my ticket!)Even if you're not an opera fan it's worth going for the first act just to see the inside during a show.

A fine old opera house. The production, music and acting were of a high quality, which are the most important factors. Lovely atmosphere - mix of budapestas and tourists. Drinks and food reasonably priced. One downside was that it became very hot in the auditorium, but lovely to go out on to the balcony overlooking the street in the intervals.

Good tour. Great tour conducted in a number of languages. Opera house is a must see attraction. Wouldn't worry about buying a ticket for photography, as this was not monitored or enforced. Also the mini concert at the end was not that great. The actual tour took about 40 mins, the building was very impressive.
The prettiest Opera House in Europe. This is a " must see" venue, even if you don't want to take in a performance. The interior decor is just fabulous, the best in Europe in my opinion.
Great Tour!. We went on this tour on a holiday-it was open when not much was. The tour is available in several languages and is very well done.
amazing experience. the tour is well worth it and the added bonus of the solo performance at the end fabulous -

The guided tours are worth it!. Although we are not opera fans, we did try the 40' guided tour, which was actually very interesting. The building is superb and the info you get from the tour is worth the try!

First rate Puccini. I took a tour of the Opera House the day before I attended a performance, and was glad that I had the history before getting the full effect of a full house! What a fabulous bldg! The acoustics were terrific, seats are cheap ($54 for most expensive seat). I thoroughly enjoyed my visits to the Opera Hosue. Note that while guide books tell you to dress formally, there were men in Polo shirts and T shirts among the crown at an evening opera.
Busy venue. For an extra one euro you can have a mini concert with one opera singer doing two songs
Guided Tours 3 and 4 P/M only.. Guided Tours in 6 langueges. Opera shows almost every night. Very reasonable prices.

Stunningly beautiful. Enjoying a performance at the opera house was one of many Budapest highlights. The interior is amazing. You feel like you have stepped back in time to a place where royalty would feel at home. There are performances most nights and some matinees too.
Saw a ballet, nice evening!. Tickets came to less than $50 for great seats at a ballet. Happy we saw the ballet!
beautiful. We went to a ballet. We bought tickets from the box office the day we arrived. The building is just beautiful!

Beautiful. I wish I could give a full review but my husband and I didnt get to do the tour so we only saw the entrance and the gift shop. The entrance was amazing wish we could have seen more. Tours are from 3 and 4

Great entertainment ; well organised. Booked MadamButterfly on the Net from UK a month before travel. Printed ticket off and entry went well. Rarely can anyone have such great value - three hours of entertainment for less than £5 in such charastmatic arena .
Beautiful building with beautiful music and ballet. This is an architectural masterpiece, filled with expert musicians and truly talented ballet dancers.

What a beautiful building. I really lucked out in obtaining tickets for an opera the day of the performance. I actually bought the tickets on line as I didn't want to have to come back to the box office 3 hours before the performance started....I tried my chances at the online purchase and got a great seat for about $45. The building is beautiful.

A Hungarian National Gem. This beautiful and historic opera house is unmissable. Book an opera, or if you want to see all the rooms including the view from the guard's balcony, take the tours at 15:00 or 16:00 only. The tours are excellent, and be sure to pay for the 5 minute opera concert afterwards.
Madame Butterfly. Saw the Oera, all in Italian with Hungarian translation , but was great!

Take the tour. A tour of this wonderful building is really a Budapest must. Happily largely undamaged in WWI, WWII, the 1956 revolt, etc., it provides an intimate insight into Budapest's cultural life.
nice building. Nice place to see, it´s located on Andrassy street with lot of luxury shops.

Ballet. This opera house is absolutely stunning visually but the ballet we went to last weekend, Anna Karenina was the best ballet I have ever been to anywhere both from a dance perspective and also the whole production, music, costume staging. Great experience

Beautiful Opera House and Performance!. This is a beautiful Opera House with details galore! It's a must see when visiting Budapest. We enjoyed a highly energetic ballet performance. We highly recommend the Opera House! Dinner at Menza and a performance at the Opera House is a perfect evening.

great tour. Take the afternoon tour if you are not so sure about sitting through a full opera and are more interested in the architecture. They provide a full tour of the facility with history and a mini concert at the end. Was a great afternoon stop.

It's More Than a Stop on the Yellow Line. The Opera is a stop on Budapest's famous Metro Line 1, but the Opera House is more than a mere subway stop. Definitely work in time to see a performance if at all possible, and experience opera in a rich setting as it was meant to be enjoyed. The Hungarian Opera Company is excellent and is known for their outstanding performances which would cost twice as much in almost any other European capitol. If you are unable to attend a performance, however, pay the small fee to tour the inside during the day at the very least. The inside is a riot of painting and gilded woodwork that will dazzle your senses. The rich reds and golds give a luxurious quality to the music house. It is a fitting setting for opera and other musical performances in a city famous for its classical music and a country famous for its composers.
Gorjus!. The building is beautiful and we went along to see Tosca. Although we didn't understand a single word, there was a good atmosphere but was builing hot in the balcony.

State Opera House tour + mini opera. A must to visit; worth pre booking in busy holiday periods; and do book also the mini opera which takes place immediately after; and do book the correct language you wish for the tour. Photo opportunity beyond belief if you also book a photo ticket.

Spectacular inside!. Don't be misled by the outside of the building - the inside is highly spectacular! Of course, many of the opera performances and ballets are fantastic, and extremely affordable (some of the lower categories of seats offer great views and acoustics nevertheless!).

First opera ever. We were on a walking tour and were being shown the inside of the Opera House and took a chance on seeing if any tickets might be available to see the Opera Carmen. Good luck for us they still had a couple of seats left. This was our first experience with opera and we loved it! The seats were not the greatest but we enjoyed the performance tremendously. We also loved the opulent theater. If you get a chance this is a good place to see an opera.

a highlight!. Never been to the opera before but despite it being in French with hungarian subtitles (checked out synopsis of start before we went) wonderful experience in incredible building . Highlight of out trip & we only paid £12 each for seat in Gods with excellent views

Great experience, shame about the language!. We thought we'd try out Madame Butterfly whilst in Budapest and were not disappointed. The sub titles didn't help though so we didn't understand a word they were singing about! Fantastic venue/atmostphere. Can recommend champagne on the verandah
Fantastic Building. Beautiful building, we didn't get to go inside but wished we had

Beautiful building with rich interior. Saw madame Butterlfy - good opera but no English subtitles - so be familiar with the story. The interior is very beautiful! I can recommend this to everyone - also no opera lovers!
Grand opera in Budapest. A small, marvelous opera house. Easy access by subway, a classic, beautiful venue with great acoustics. Enjoyed many great performances here.
Share an evening with music lovers. The Operahouse itself is a fantastic building with amazing acoustics. The interior is in gold and red. Seats are comfortable

Amazing opera experience. We were only in Budapest for a day and thought we would check out the highly recommended opera. We thought we would do one of the tours they give most days at 3 or 4 pm. But we were on the fence about taking the tour when we found it cost about $15/person (including the optional "mini concert"). We asked someone leaving the earlier tour and they said it was wonderful so we paid our money and took the tour. And we were glad we did.The large (huge) group of people was efficiently broken up into smaller groups by language and size of group. Our group of about 20 had a wonderful/enthusiastic younger woman guide who was quite knowledgeable about the history of the opera and explained it's history and highlights in an entertaining way as she took us through the many different areas of the opera house.The real highlight was at the end when we did the "mini concert". One of the lead female soloists came into a smaller lounge area (with tremendous acoustics) and performed two songs for the group of about 50 who had chosen this option. Hearing her perform "close up" was one of the best vocal performances I have ever heard and certainly attended. In the second number she was using an empty crystal glass as a prop for the scene the song she was singing was associated with. I kept waiting to see if the glass would shatter (like in the old "is it live or is it Memorex" commercials). Overall highly recommended.
beautiful. stunning! a definate must see. see at night for details...

rip-off tour, avoid. joined the Engllsh speaking group for tour, didn't hear a word as at least three other groups all going round at the same time talking in different languages. Didn't go behind scenes.
So so beautiful!. Book your tickets online if possible. The inside of the building is a must see! Stunning and well worth the (cheap) price!!!
Impressive. The architecture is stunning, the lightning by night is fabulous. Lovely situated.
Stunning. Amazing building, absolutely stunning. Even seats in a box were cheap. If you don't dress up a bit though you may end up feeling a bit scruffy. I know I did in my tshirt and jeans!

Oh the beauty. The outside of the opera house isn't particularly impressive but inside the beauty is really breathtaking. We purchased tickets for an opera here and the experience of being the opera house with the grandeur, surrounded by the amazing energy, singing, and costumes will be an lifelong memory.
A definite highlight of our time in Budapest.

Lovely exterior!. They only open at 3 and 4 pm for tours, so time your trip unless you are seeing a performance here. The porte cochere has a beautiful ceiling that's viewable even if the rest of the interior is not.

very beautifull building. the inside is very good decorated and it is told that the austrian emprior when he visited the hungarian opera house, he was angry coz it was much beautiful than the austrian opera house and he left the opera house before the end of the show.

Good experience. Ok, I am NOT an opera-lover (this was a quid pro quo with the missus for the shooting event!) but it was a decent evening. We went to see Madame Butterfly in this beautiful venue - happily the Italian opera was translated with subtitles above the stage. Unfortunately it was only into Hungarian. I didn't really know the story so it kind of passed me by a bit. But still, we had top notch seats for around $50 each so can't get too vexed with that.

a tour of the Opera. All the tickets being sold out for the performance, I found some consolation in purchasing a guided tour of the Opera, as it was a perfect opportunity to see all the beauty of the building. We had a French-speaking guide (she spoke very good French, almost no accent) who took us all around the building, telling its history and secrets in so much detail that I regretted that the tour was oven in some 50 minutes. Well, the Opera house is not as great as the Opera in Vienna and thice as small as the Opera Garnier in Paris, but it is definitely worth a visit. The interior is close to that of the Opera house in Vienna, and yet, it has some special charm.
Great time at the Karamozovs!. Skip the tour and see an opera or ballet! Truly breathtaking!
Lovely building. Beautiful opera house, with an excellent guided tour. There was nothing I disliked about the opera house.

Opera house. Just awesome! We took the one hour tour that includes a mini (5 minutes) concert at the end. The guide was very friendly and informative. No luck in reserving for an opera play during our stay because all days were sold out. Maybe next time we will try to reserve online before arriving.
Awesome. Great tour followed by concert. Excellent tour leader who shared history.

Very impressive, but.... The building is great, and the tours offered twice daily help. Skip the "mini-concert" at the end. It's a guy and a boombox. Not exactly a concert. I tried to find a performance, everything was sold out. Perhaps its best to try to book a performance before traveling to Budapest.

Opera Experience at it's bests.. Going to the opera is always a special experience. However, when you go here, the experience is definitely enhanced. Between the beauty and history of the building and the quality of performances you really leave thinking WOW.

Opera House Budapest. Excellent choice of operas ongoing.
Great value
Wonderfil experience
Baroque charm. Beautiful building with an interesting history. We took the short guided tour plus mini-performance due to lack of time. Definitely worth a visit.
Great Opera experience. Our second time to this wonderful company. Highly recommended and a terrific value!
Beautiful Building. Almost more impressive than the opera house in Vienna! Definitely worth a visit and check out a performance if you can. Very inexpensive for quality productions!
Carmen. Splendour of the opera house,but wooden seats!take a cushion!we knew the opera,but no English sub titles.

Incredibly beautiful. We could not get tickets for an opera performance but we did see ballet ("Taming of the Shrew"). The building is one of the most impressive ones we have seen, and the performance was excellent (and inexpensive!). If you can't get tickets to a performance, by all means go in and see interior of the building. It's an experience.
Opera House. This is a very beautiful opera house. Pay for the mini concert at the end of the tour...it was worth it!

Try to get to a performance!. I joined the English 45 minute tour and mini-concert performance and was glad I went. Even if you're not there in opera season, there are many evening musical performances available.

What a treat!. We went to see an opera in this Opera House. Inside it's really beautiful! The opera that we saw was Madame Butterfly. They did a really good job to play this opera. We had a great time.

first time in opera. we went to the Opera on a special occasion and found out that the entire show was in German, with Hungarian subtitles. i still am not sure what it was about but the Opera itself is beautiful and the music was great. Suit is a must.

Don't miss it! (see review for useful tips). Booked tickets via http://www.jegymester.hu/hun/opera/Opera- for about 2$ pet ticket to the opera Carmen, side balcony seats. Please note that the cheapest tickets category, as we bought, will offer you a view for only half of the stage (if you will be able to book a seat on the first row of the balcony- probably the view will be better). It is OK if you are not the biggest opera fan and come to feel the ambiance... So if you would like to see the opera itself, even from afar, pay more and enjoy the full experience (you can buy a ticket in the center of the balcony for about 6$ per ticket, if you book in advance).Don't buy the tiny binoculars the opera offers. It is useless and a waste of money (500 HUF+ Deposit of some sort of identity card/driving license/mobile phone). Pay more for the tickets and you will see the stage, even if you are far from the stage, I promise you.The building itself is amazing and the ambiance is unique. it is a MUST DO experience.I would recommend it to anyone coming to Budapest.The dress code is a bit more relaxed than we thought- people were dressed elegantly but you will blend in the crowd even without a sparkling evening gown or a tuxedo. A nice buttoned shirt and elegant trousers for the gentlemen/a nice little black dress for the ladies will not raise any eyebrows...
Good, but old uncomfortable seats. A fantastic building, beautifully cared for. However the seats are pretty spartan and hard.

Great Sunday morning treat. We toured the Opera House on our first visit to Budapest and have wanted to attend a performance. We had the chance to hear a preview performance of the Budapest Symphony on our last visit. Just to sit and imagine the history of the building and listen to the music was such a treat. And by attending a rehersal the tickets were much less which is always an added bonus. And it was on a Sunday morning.
Has the WOW factor. A great place to explore. If you go in the afternoon, as well as a guided tour you get a mini concert. Check times before you go.

Atmoshere, history and great performances. Just go! I was never interested in ballet, or really so bothered about Shakespeare but took some friends to see Taming of the Shrew as a ballet. An excellent evening, will now try an opera. Good value for money just beware if you get a very cheap ticket you won't see much, also some of the boxes on the sides are OK for 3 but anymore and its a bit of a limited view. But then for £2.00 who's complaining. Stunning building, sets and performance

excellent tour. This tour was excellent. The opera house is amazing to see and the guide included wonderful stories about it and some of the people who have been there over the years. Well worth a visit, especially if you've been to the opera house in Vienna.
Beautiful place. We had a guided tour in English and it was very informative. It's a beautiful building.

A must to in Budapest. Everyone should visit the Opera House in Budapest while here. If you're not into Opera at all, you still would like to experience the interior of this beautiful building and the atmosphere.
Butterfly. Famous opera house with an all Hungarian cast for this performance. All great!

No English Sub Titles. We go to the occassional opera and know what to expect During our recent vist to Eastern Europe we saw 4 operas. The State Opera House in Budapest is magnificant however there were no English sur-titles. This is not the case in other European opera houses. So if you go ... know the opera that you are seeing or go online and read the synopsis before going.

Going back to the past - as a member of the noblity. A really beautiful buiding, in which you can imagine how it was to be a member of high society in 1890 or so. If you ever liked to see a Sissi-movie, go there! If you didn't really like them, go there too, to understand the 'belle epoque'. Tip: if the German language isn't really a problem for you, take the German tour, even if your English is a little bit better. (this might be the case for a lot of Dutch and Belgian readers): the group is much smaller, you can see more and in our case the guide was a very nice girl with a lot of humour!

Amazing building. Great place to tour but it can get very busy! the building is terrific and the outs guides are very knowlegeable but ti was crowded and a little disorganized when we were there, worth it however!

Budapest Opera is always the highlight of our visits to the city.. The interior is beautiful, the seats are quite comfortable (compared to some other traditional opera houses I know) and the productions are always of the highest standard. Seats are amazing value and you can book them on line.
grand opera. The opera was beautifully done, except translation not given in English. So, if you go, make sure you know the storyline. If regular seats are sold out, ask how to get the cheap tickets!
gorgeous. was the most fabulous opera house ever. acoustics brilliant

Such a lovely building!. They have tours at 3 or 4 pm everyday I think. I would TOTALLY recommend this. I really enjoyed it and our guide was really fun and made it really interesting for the entire group :) I think there are like 6 language groups, so I'm sure you'll be fine. You have to pay extra if you want to take pictures during the tour and also there is a possibility of attending a short performance ( given that you pay extra of course). I got a student discount here as well, so flash the card if you have it ;) This is a must to do!! You can reach this very easily either by walking or just take the yellow subway line and get off at Opera. Easy as pie, no? :) Enjoy it!
See the inside. Nice building, go inside to see the nice entrance. They have some tours inside the building.
Great experience. Great ballet (The taming shrew). If you are afraid og height dont go to 3rd floor.... Pay some more money and choose grat seats.....
Ballet - The Taming of the Shrew. Everything, the building, performance, the whole experience.

Gem of Culture. The architecture is amazing, if you are an Opera, Ballet, classical music lover (even if you aren't) you will get mesmerize by its beauty, the columns, the marbles, the stage....I love this Opera House!

A great experience even without subtitles!. Tickets were unexpectedly affordable, even for a seat in the box it was only about 5 euro. I saw Carmen, and since I knew the general plot and music I got by okay. However, I can imagine being frustrated with a play I didn't know, but the experience was really in enjoying the music, the gorgeous building and the ambiance.
Beautiful building. Didn't get to do a tour, but from what I saw that will happen the next time.

Unforgetable Opera. A beautiful house. Go on line at the official site to get tickets for your visit. Seeing things in London the prices for the top seats are very very reasonable indeed. I would not miss the opportunity, get yourself a programme as well which will give you an insight to the opera you will be seeing.

Beautiful building plus a lovely ballad. We went to watch a ballad based on Shakespeare's Taming Of The Shrew for the production's opening night.The building is overwhelmingly beautiful on the inside ,would definitely recommend a visit.We booked the tickets online about 4 days in advance and paid 12 euros per person for our seats in the upper stalls and feel it was well worth the money for the 2 hour long lovely ballad as well as the chance to explore the Opera from inside.
Lovely architecture. Didn't get the chance to go the opera but the building is worth a visit
Beautiful. The Opera House Tour was great. It is a beautiful building with lots of history, beautiful ceilings, wall coverings, pictures and the tour itsef was very informative.

Worth a visit. Booked tickets for La Traviata from the UK some time before our visit to Budapest. We booked a box, second floor and thoroughly enjoyed both the opera itself and the opulence of the building. We had a fabulous experience for a fraction of the ticket price we usually pay for opera in Edinburgh. Well worth a visit.

Spectacular. We managed to book seats to see La Traviata and we had a wonderful evening. The Opera House inside is simply stunning and opulent and I am not surprised it is called the most beautiful opera house in Europe. An evening to remember!
Beautiful. Do the tour which is not expensive. Good guides with a ten minute slot by one of the opera singers at the end

Amazing!!. This place is amazing! We took the tour and it is well worth it. The guide was great, very knowledgeable and friendly. It is possible (and affordable) to go see an opera here, but if you don't have the time the hour long tour is a great way to see the opera house.
Very nice. This building is the vivid image of the "Phantom of the Opera"
Disappointed. Lovely building but thought the tour was poor for what they charged for admission

Overwhelmingly Beautiful. Our landlord had, at our request, purchased tickets and they were in our apartment when we arrived. At first I was disappointed. I did not know the opera being presented at all. Bank Ban, ?? Researched it and was not enthused but it was our opportunity to see the much-heralded theater and music is music. We were ushered to our booth on the second tier. Six chairs and the sight of everything-- stage, orchestra pit, main floor and other booths. Lavish decor and architectural highlights. Stunning.. The production began and the acoustics were jaw-dropping. The balance between pit and stage, chorus and soloists, the costuming, the dynamics, totally engrossing. I am certain that no matter the production, this is an incredible company to see in an incomparable setting. Our tickets were about $35 USD each and the seats were prime. A great date night.
Beautiful entrance. Only managed to go in to the foyer as we would have had to wait for a guided tour to go any further. They also offered "mini operas" during the day for a reasonable fee.

Opera is not my thing. For those that love fat men and fatter women screeching at each other go for it. I'd much rather be sitting in the bar at the Gresham palace having lunch ending with Dobos Torte and Palinka!
What a delight. Inside and out this auditorium must be seen. We grabbed a balcony box to see Tosca - we were second row so had a restricted view but this was definitely a holiday highlight
Great stay at the Budavar Pension. Beautiful building. We bought half price tickets for the ballet and it was wnderful

Catch a show!. The Opera is a great old building in the Parisian-looking section of Budapest. I was able to catch a performance of Strauss' Arabella during my stay. I paid $13 for a 2nd row box seat. There are plenty of seats available for $2-5 that are up high, if you aren't an opera fan get one of these and just come see the building. If you like the show, stay and enjoy the surroundings. People dress a little better than most in the USA for the theater. The performance was good. I didn't care for the Tenor in my performance, but the rest of the cast was good!

Fabulous building. Wonderful atmosphere, especially if you can afford a box. I can't judge the music but for an evening out hard to beat. Order & pay for interval drinks before the performance and then enjoy the view up and down Andrassy while you enjoy them.

Beautiful. The opera house was beautiful and we enjoyed he tour. The "mini concert" which is an additional cost of around 2€ is simply a tenor soloist that performs 2 short versions of a piece while you stand in the reception area. It was worth the additional money, however, it would have been nicer to be seated in the actual opera house for it.

Felt like a queen .. The building brings back the ambiance of centuries past.Sitting in a box next to what was the king's box was truly fun. Sipping champaigne on the balcony and looking out to the main shopping street of Budapest was magical. And, most importantly, the production of Giselle was world class.This is what it must have been like centuries ago...

A wonderful evening. As part of a surprise birthday trip to Budapest my partner gave me tickets to La Traviata. The standard was excellent and the opera house is beautiful! We had top price seats and couldn't believe the price we paid for them, which meant we could treat ourselves to the delicious Hungarian champagne in the bar!
wow. Stunning building, not long ago overhauled. Great sound. Great productions for the most part. Good prices, too. Like opera, love this.
beautiful and elegant. a visit to the opera house transports you back to an age of elegance.. so beautiful and the guides are amazing

Opulent and glamorous!. We watched the ballet here and we absolutely loved it! The opera house is a beautiful piece of architecture and looks like an opulent palace from inside. We watched the ballet here and it was well worth the experience as its well lit up and the acoustics are amazing.You can reach the opera house pretty easily by metro but do not forget to bring small change with you (500 forint or smaller) as they sometimes do not have change to give you when you purchase a ticket. My suggestion is to pre purchase your metro tickets beforehand so avoid having to buy a ticket during the busy period.

Pop in for a visit or buy a ticket for one of its performances. If you can, buy a ticket for one of its performances: ballets, operas or concerts. You won't regret it! The dress code is not strictly formal, so don't worry too much about that. The interior is impressive so treat yourself to a show and enjoy the experience.
Great Tour!. Very informative tour, enjoyed the mini-opera at the end.
Watched a nice opera tonight. The opera was great, but didn't have English Lyrice for the non-hungrian people. Pity.
Excellent performance, cheap price!!!. Ballet. Great performance, beautiful theatre. I enjoyed a lot!

Indispensable. It is a paied and guided visit. We went with our guide, and visited the opera room, a very beutiful room with some golded walls, and a very beautiful crystal lamp.
The lovers room, the galery, the ceiling and wall paints made this visit precious.

Interesting but could be left off your list of must dos. Quite enjoyed being inside the grand building but too many tours and people all trying to hear.
Not good value for money.
special. It's a beautiful building in the heart of Budapest. It's a must seen place in the capital city.

Opera House Tour. If you like visiting Opera Houses then this one is a must! We did the opera tour - turned up half an hour before the tour was due to start and bought our tickets. From the outset, the tour seemed highly organised - different languages were split into different groups with different guides. Our tour itself was somewhat over subscribed, but not a problem as they split the English tour into two groups. Our guide, Cecelia, was excellent - knowledgable, friendly, funny and obviously passionate about opera and the building itself. We went to the mini-concert afterwards, which consisted of a couple of songs - great fun and worthwhile doing if you're not going to see an opera, so you can at least have heard some opera in the opera house!
Tour was interesting.... It was average...interesting but probably wouldn't be top of my list of recommendations.

Opera House...the lobby was pretty. I was really looking forward to visiting the Opera House. The lobby itself is stunning. However, we did not plan in advance and came before the "visiting times" when tours are provided at 3pm and 4pm. Even had we made it at that time, I doubt we would have toured the Opera House...it was a bit pricey at about 2000 forint (about $8 US dollars) AND you had to pay an extra 500 HUF to take pictures! I think it did include a mini-concert type event. However, if you just wanted to visit to take a few pictures and look around, all you get is the lobby and entrance. A bit disappointing
Great experience. Highly recommended. The State Opera is a magnificent building. I purchased my ticket on their website, very easy to use and tickets are cheap by London standards.

Beautiful Building & Very Affordable. The Opera House is stunning and if you are an opera virgin like me it's a very good taster. Beware however, if you book for the very top tier on either side and aren't on the front row your view may be severely restricted. It was worth a visit just to listen to the stunning orchestra.

Sunday Morning at The Opera House. Went to see the Hungarian Philharmonic Orchestra in rehersals,nice cheap price an 3 rows from the orchestra on a Sunday morning.The place was amazing and you can also go on a guided tour to find out much more.

Parsifal in the State Opera. To see Parsifal was really an experience! The Opera House is very nice historical building with a special atmosphere. Even if the opera was with just Hungarian subtitles, we enjoyed it very much.

Wonderful building, Adequate Opera. The Budapest Opera house is a magnificent building. It is certainly worth a visit as an architecture showplace. As to the Opera itself, we usually attend the Metropolitan in New York so the review must be read with that qualification. The voices of the characters were uneven. They sing without amplification, the orchestra can drown out the weaker voices. Sit close so you can hear. The chairs were not very comfortable. We were there on a Friday night, the Hungarians dressed formally, tourists not so much.

great experince but no subtitles. We watched the opera here and we enjoyed the opera house as well....the setting was perfect, usher was very friendly...she let us read the synopsis in english for free....because unlike other opera houses we have been to, there were no english subtitles.
Take the "mini" performance. With the tour they give a 5 minutes "taste" of 3 performers singing. Its worth the price.

Went to see the ballet in the cheap seats.... .. not worth the saving - pay a bit more for better seats as the view is really really restricted! We got seats in the balcony on the left hand side and could hardly see any stage at all! Ended up sitting on the stairs for the first half and moving into some empty seats in the centre of the balcony for the second half.The ballet itself was fantastic and the room is beautiful. At the interval we had 2 beers and a pretzel for a really reasonable price and the whole night was a success, especially when we had moved seats, just wanted to write to say to anyone who was umming and ahhing, it really is worth paying that bit extra to be central as the room curves so dramatically!!

Ballet at its best. For those of you who grudgingly fork out 100pd for a ticket in London, the value of attending a production here is fantastic. Quality although occasionally variable, is certainly par with the best in Europe. The building itself is magnificent and the opera-goers chic. This is one of the best things about Budapest.

Interesting. Book direct with the Opera Visit lasts 50 minutes. You only see the stairs and seating area.Lots of interesting gilt and ornate decorations. You are not taken backstage.If you have nothing else to do then worth a visit but not top of the list

Excellent Elegance!. We didn't get in on one of the tours, but we did make sure to see the ballet production of Don Quixote. Same day purchase, we were able to get great seats in the 5th row for 12.000 forints each (about 55 USD/each) -- a fantastic deal for an amazing performance in a spectacular setting. Seats were available for as low as perhaps 800 forints or so (3.60 USD) -- I don't know what kind of view those seats have - but don't let price keep you from seeing a great production!

Great little tour. The English language guide was lovely with her delivery. She was thorough, thoughtful and even had a nice sense of humour. The Opera House is magnificent and they do a nice job showing it.
Wonderful place. Beautiful place to tour but check dates of performances.Most expensive seats are just over £30 as far as I can remember, depending on the show.
Lovely. Beautiful house. Nice performance of Cosi Fan Tutte.

You can't have this in London!. I booked a ticket a few weeks before on internet which was available in English and very user friendly. (Hungarian Opera, Bank Ban) Centre and the first 5 or 6 row, and the ticket was less than GBP40.- I think this is one of the most beautiful opera house in the world. Wonderful performance and unlike Covent Garden, everything is very decent price like programme, drink etc. Excellent experience.

Beautiful!. Arabella was my first opera. Thankfully, I had read the synopsis the day before because it was in German and only translated into Hungarian. Very elaborate. Lovely in every way. Gorgeous building. Even with no English translation, I would recommend it.
Taking the tour is worth it.. The tour was interesting and the opera house was spectacular.
Impressive building. Didn't go inside, just walked all around the outside. Beautiful building and well worth looking at.
Opera or not. Beautiful building but choose your opera carefully
Nice experience. The building was very nice, we found very cheap tickets at the last minute. The play was not so interesting for me, but it was a nice experience.
One of the World's Best. The superb architecture and design and the atmosphere and productions.
Superb. We went to a night concert here and thoroughly enjoyed a stunning performance.Budapest has so much cultural depth,it really is just stunning.
Great building. We liked the guided tour of the building which was with a very friendly guide who took the time to answer any questions we had about the history of the opera house.
nice opera house. good plays , can choose between languages local/english

I'm no Opera goer but would still recommend. I've been to the Opera once before-it was a terrible one so I let myself be persuaded to go to this one following the reviews (and mainly my other halfs insistence). It was really a great experience and the singing was superb. The building itself is a place to see as its really quite something else. Very posh affair where everyone gets dressed up so make sure you bring your sunday best. And it was very cheap compared to Operas in other parts of the world, so i'm told.
Folkdancing. Very entertaining. Would definately recommend. We had wine during the intermission.
Rich, Glamorous, Beautifull. Impressive building, full of history, a tribute to Opera and music.
Wonderful site. Architecture was wonderful. Could only see the outside. Was on our tour.
Worth the pricey entry. Although it is about 7.50 euros for student entry, this Opera house is breathtaking (and I have been to many!).
Like a Palace. Try to arrive by Metro yellow line and emerge to its splendor before you. Pretty illuminated at night

Beautiful building!. This is a must stop and see place in Budapest. Even better yet take in an Opera while there. It is very cheap as well! One tip though, a couple of friends and I attended an opera that was in German so they had Hungarian subtitles. Hence we were very confused to what was happening. I have heard that if you go to an Hungarian opera the subtitles will be in English.My favourite part was taking in the general splendour and the prelude music!

Great place to watch a performance. The insides of the building are amazingly beautiful. It is not a huge place, which makes it all the nicer. Tickets are relatively inexpensive especially compared to cities like Vienna and Prague. It's a must-go.

The tour is nice if you love opera. Very lovely building, reminds me a lot of the Vienna opera. Rich decor inside, and the tour is nice as you will hear a lot about the history of the art and rooms that you would not know on your own. Unfortunately it does not include the stage or backstage, but you get some private access and its well worth the modest cost.

An impressive venue for Opera and Ballet. We attended the State Opera House on 24th Feb to see the ballet, but the building was also a huge attraction! Very elaborately decorated with beautiful staircases and rooms. Well worth a visit, and if attending a performance bear in mind the locals dress up more than those of us in the UK usually do.

Beautiful architecture, history, and oh yes, great opera too.. Gorgeous building, architecturally magnificent. Opera in Budapest is relatively affordable, and features great artists, some from outside the country. Many operas are translated into Hungarian. A tour of the building is worthwhile for opera buffs. Walk onto the balcony overlooking Andrassy Ut during intermission - it can be a singular experience. There are several excellent cafes within walking distance.
So beautiful. We booked a ballet, and unfortunately, the show was awful. But it was worth it, cause we got to see how beautiful the place is. Can't miss it.
Stunning interior!. A German Opera, sung in Italian with Hungarian surtitles was not the perfect combination (!) ..... but the setting made up for any misunderstanding of the plot

European Grand Elegance. To experience what Budapest can offer, it is a must place to visit. During the season, there is a performance almost daily. Tickets are reasonable, and can be purchased online. We enjoyed "Marriage of Figaro."

Beautiful experience. Got a great price for a box seat...watched the Hungarian National Ballet perform The Taming of the Shrew. The building is magnificent and if ever you're in Hungary, you should definitely not miss watching a show in this building!

We booked a ballet performance. Try to book online to see an opera o ballet. If you book boxes, try to sit in front of the box and in front of the stage. Great to see the fancy way people dress to go to the opera and the inside of the building is magic !

most beautiful opera house. This opera house must have guide tour aorund the state Opera house. You cannot walk around yourself and they give you something to wear on your feets over your shoes to stop those stratching on thier vintage floor. All the chairs are red and velvety and it fit for a king and queen to be up on those balcony to watch and with golden interior. For those who like music and Opera this is the place to go.

Beautiful and worthwhile. We bought tickets to Cosi fan Tutte, and it was an incredible experience and amazing value. Lucky enough to acquire dress circle box tickets by purchasing well in advance, we had a perfect view of the stage and a choice location for hearing the orchestra. And of course, the hall itself is beyond magnificent: richly decorated, it has a real sense of place.Tickets in such a choice location for such a high-quality production in any other major city would cost magnitudes more: it would almost be a crime to not experience an opera there if you are an opera fan.
One of a kind. Extremely beautiful. Much alike the Vienna Opera House.
Unforgettable atmosphere. Great musicians, excellent architecture. For many international conferences a great social evening program.

Be brave - don't just look, go to a performance!. First of all, I have 2 admissions to make:1. I have NEVER been interested in opera and could not have imagined enjoying a performance of Tosca sang in Italian with Hungarian subtitles BUT I DID!2. I chose Tosca for its 3 Acts (with 2 opportunties for a discreet escape...!) and 2 hours and 50 minutes performance (a reasonable time to sit still and be QUIET)Booking the tickets via the Opera House on-line system was remarkably easy. I was able to print e-tickets immediately and a few days before the performance I received an email reminder. Two tickets for seats in a 'box' on the Upper Cicle cost £44.55 (in total). We shared it with two other people with ample space to hang our coats up. At times our view of the action on stage was restricted and next time I would chose more central seats rather than at the side. The ambience in the Opera house was relaxed (rather than formal or stuffy) and the staff were helpfull and spoke English.The performance was powerful and engaging AND despite the language issues I cried at the end.........The beautiful interior added to the experience and I would highly recommend attending a performance at the Hungarian State Opera House. Be brave and go!

Beautiful Building. the outside doesn't look all that special, but the decorations and history of this place are amazing. Take the tour if you want the story, buy a ticket to just enjoy the experience.

Great experience. We went to see Tosca. Had front row seats, booked on line before we left home) and were therefore able to see the orchestra well (which we liked; others may not). The singing was good, especially ~Attila Fekete as Caravadossi - but something went a little bit wrong in the final act with the chorus from the background Never mind! They overcame it and we still thoroughly enjoyed it. By English standards the tickets weren't expensive and, of course, you get to see the opera house thrown in! I've sat in more comfortable theatre seats but if you like opera, it's a must.
Looked pretty. This place looked pretty from the outside. I never had time to see a show unfortunately.

A worthwhile venture - but skip the "mini-concert!". A tour of the Hungarian State Opera House (Magyar Állami Operaház) was rather superficial but well worth the opportunity to see its interior grandeur and Neo-Renaissance touches. The façade’s balustrade displayed large statues of composers including Smetana, Mozart, Wagner, Tchaikovsky and a host of others. Corinthian columns on the second floor framed elegant archways. Inside, marble and gold leaf were de rigeur along with ceiling friezes/frescos which depicted a plethora of mythology including the Apotheosis of Music. It seemed almost as ornate as the Garnier in Paris. Marble columns were constructed of three different types of marble which differentiated its components: the post, pedestal and capital. Gleaming gilt capitals effortlessly supported the ceiling. The interior was dripping in gilt which was a foil to the relative poverty of the nation during its construction. The auditorium was relatively small (I’m from New York City)in spite of the young docent’s description as large – her first tour in English. There was no carpeting to help facilitate sound. Oddly, the parterre boxes had walls with their only opening facing the audience – quite antithetical to effective acoustics, and underscored the “see and be seen” culture that was indifferent to the performance at hand. I would strongly advise against paying an additional fee for a “mini-concert” that followed the formal tour which was an embarrassing solo performed by a less than inspiring tenor.
More beautiful than Vienna Opera!. It was built to be smaller than the one in Vienna as to not to eclipse that - but it is much more beautiful :)
Great building. Fantastic building, the tour is great but buy a ticket for an opera if you sit in the gods it's very cheap, but be warned it's sang in Italian with Hungarian subtitles :-)
Music. I didn't know budapest had so much to do with music so yeah it's worth it.

Opulent to the max!. Gilded and amazing interior, with great acoustics. Bring your camera and soak in the spectacle! We saw Die Fleidermaus in Hungarian with German super titles, so a plot summary was helpful to bring. No programs were provided in English or any other language. You are required to check your coats-don't mess up!
Go to a performance!. Beautiful place & great value for performances- not so much for just the tour!
Don't miss it when visiting Budapest. We saw the opera Figaro from Mozart. Great opera, beautiful building, unforgettable experience. Don't miss it when visiting Budapest.
good, but.... The tour in opera was educational, but it will be much better if they show us the stage and behund.
Beautiful Building. Lovely building and opera prices accessible. We paid about £15 for seats in a box and the performance was terrific.
Beautiful building. This building is an architectural gem what is a must see when you are in Budapest!

Beautiful. It seems that most critical reviewers here are disappointed in the quality/pricing of the tour and are taking it out on the poor building. But opera building is gorgeous. We bought online tickets to Mefistofeles. Got there half an hour earlier. Bought some sparkling wine and drank it on the outside balcony and watched the people coming to the performance and beautiful outside details. We also reserved wine/food for intermission so we did not have to wait in any queues. Therefore had plenty of time to look around. It is truly a gorgeous building in fine details. If you need bathrooms then try to find them early. We tried to find them at the end of the performance and as we could not see any signs, went to the lowest level to be told that bathrooms are only upstairs. We have mixed feelings about the Mefistofeles and would not recommend it but that is another story.

A great looking opera house. Pure oppulence will blow your mind when you take a tour inside this wonderfully looking opera house.Alas, I did not get a chance to watch an opera there, but I'm sure it's wonderful!

A worthwhile tour and even better show. The tour of the Opera House gives an added historical dimension to the city and it is well worth spending time in the beautiful interior. Better still if you can then do what we did and see an Opera itself there. The tickets are much cheaper than in the UK and the level of production very high. A great finale to our trip.
WOW!. I actually do not like Opera, however, we attended a show and it was just incredible. This is definitely a must while in Budapest!

Gold-rimmed pleasure. The building dates from 1884 and was at the opening by Fransz Joseph I immediately besieged by curious Budapestians. At the start of this year, the same thing almost happened again. Only this time curiosity wasn’t the motive, but the public anger of tens of thousands of people protesting against the in the Opera House celebrating supporters of the current government. Fortunately the building was spared another assault.The citizens of 1884 must have stopped, mouth wide open, when entering the Opera. For the wealth of the former Budapest appears to be carved in the walls of the place. The building resembles an inflated jewel box in which the giant collection of gold ornaments of the wife of Francis Joseph is stored. It is gold, gold & gold that glitters, and when the lights go out, you have caught a mild gold fever when you slide away into the red plush.We visited the opera Rigoletta by Verdi, part if which is well known by many people from an advertisement for pizza (....). But at the sound of La Donna e Mobile the thoughts of pizza quickly shift to the catering of the Opera itself which contributes to the delicious experience of your visit to the Opera. Wonderful hors d'oeuvres with salmon and caviar for the price of a pretzel. You eat them together with the tasty dressed Budapestian crowd surrounded by sumptuous ornaments. It is like being a living work of art framed in gold.In terms of seating choice, we recommend the lodge/stalls. For 40 euros you're like a Royal sitting in front two seats in the box opposite the stage. Between enjoying the music, the play and watching the audience and the building, it is hard to restrain yourself from rasing your arm, opening a slightly curved palm of your hand and wave like a Royal to the people below.
Beautiful. Sat in a box with season ticket holders. They were so kind talking with me and sharing chocolates from their christmas tree. Excellent performance. Don't miss the refreshments dirt cheap.

Go to see the small yet beautiful Opera house. Go to see the small yet beautiful Opera house
We went a one beautiful folkloric show there Music & performances of whole cast -inc 100 members of chorus with their perfect choreography.
Wonderful night at the opera. Beautiful surroundings. Fabulous architecture. Service not brilliant but well worth a visit.
Amazing ceilings. I didn't go to a performance but just standing in the reception was worth a visit

Breathtaking. Now I know they say the Hungarian Opera house is not only one of oldest in Europe but also one of the most beautiful. They do not do it justice. We saw "La Boheme" and while we didn't understand a single word, we were mesmerized as more by the architecture and acoustics than anything. We may have accidentally left early...oops. if you want to make a splash, where bright colors. The Hungarians we saw tended to wear all muted and dark colors, and my wife wore a pair of Guess Marciano Gold Stiletto heels. You would have thought she walked in naked. We saw this in January 2008.

most amazing building - not to be missed. worth every penny of the ticket price to see this beautiful building. Friendly and informative guide to give you a behind the scenes view of this incredible building. fascinating history. Would definitley try and see an opera here on my next visit to Budapest
Worth a Look. This small yet beautiful Opera house is worth a peek. Tip: attending a show is usually cheaper than taking a tour. You can also just walk inside for a few minutes for free.

What a stunning night. What a stunning night .Fortunate to have booked 1 month before the Holiday .Worth every florintMusic & performances of whole cast (inc 70 members of chorus with their perfect choreography!) and an audience so friendly and well dressed as to put British audiences to shame

Wonderful building providing superb performances. What a joy to visit such a beautiful Opera house that is so REASONABLY priced. We sat in the 1st balcony central box @ €40 each - nowhere else provides such value for money.The bulding itself is a joy to visit.BUT beware the language issue. We attended an evening sung in German and spoken in Hungarian - with respective subtitles in Hungarian and German!But a fabulous evening and great spectacle.

Be vigilant and get tickets. No bad seats!. Where to begin? It is out of a storybook. We recommend taking the tour to see all the nooks of this fabulous place. And enjoy fabulous opera. Do NOT pass this by, even if opera is not your thing.
Impressing. Breathtaking visit but don't take the short performance with the visit.

Next door to us!. Our hotel K&K Opera Hotel Budapest is 20 metres from the Opera House. We wandered in on our way back to our hotel one night because there had been a lot of VIP visitors there and we were curious. The President of Hungary had entertained the President of Kosovo at the opera that evening and as they had departed when we arrived the staff allowed us to wander around. Had we not done that we would certainly have booked in next day for a guided tour as the Opera House is stunning and full of history.

Outrageous entrance cost. They ask 11,5 Euros, just to see around the place,not a performance included!When the entrance to Parthenon,Greece is 12 Euros ,a humankind heritage,it is an insult to ask for the same price to walk around an Opera House in Budapest

Nutcracker. We managed a night before's pair of tickets in the ground stall area for this evening performance which was full of very well behaved children..the wooden seating was somewhat alien but comfortable nevertheless -the compulsory coat collection service was served by only two ladies which made reuniting with ones apparel a bit of a bun fight-The performance was long but lovely and wonderfully executed in a wonderful old building!

Wow.. The opera house is incredible inside. We decided to go to an opera instead of a tour and we really recommend this for a number of reasons. The most important one is as it's cheaper! We got very good seats for £4.50! The tour was double the amount and was only to last 45mins. The opera was our evening entertainment, was much cheaper than sitting in a restaurant or a bar and lasted 3 hours! However, please be aware that you must pay for cloakroom as no jackets or bags are allowed inside. The woman on the cloakroom could not speak a word of English and was very rude to us (even though we attempted to speak Hungarian).
Outstanding. Fantastic experience. Beautiful building, great acoustics and fantastic version of la boheme!
Excellent Cultural Experience. Beautiful building; wonderful performances and a fantastic atmosphere. No aircon so in summer it can be tough

must see/hear. - the opera speak no americano - ie. subtitles only in HU- good performance - guest stars occasionally - perfect to try out the feeling of it if you come to Budapest- interior is absolutely a must see
